loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2 western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 18 years old.  In 2007, Isatu established her clothing material business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to support her children. She works at the business 7 days per week, from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. Isatu says that her main business challenge is insufficient capital to expand.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that she can save on cooking energy costs

loans.name: Ann Banadurga Shg Group

texts.en:
The "Ann Banadurga SHG" group consists of ten women who live in the rural area of Odisha, India. Its people work in the fields in activities such as animal husbandry and agriculture; many people also head to the city every day for various types of work like vegetable selling, flower selling, etc. The members still proudly preserve their traditional dress as well as their cuisine. They always strive to provide their children with a better future. 

One of the group members is Pratva, the lady sitting with a raised hand. She is forty-three years old, married, and has two children, aged eight and thirteen. Her children attend an area school. Her husband is a farmer, and he is engaged in paddy cultivation. Pratva's husband helps in her business. They live in their own home. 

Pratva spends her time at home, caring for their children. However, to help her husband with living expenses, she raises cows and sells the cows’ milk. She currently has two cows. She also works in agriculture for both home and commercial use.

This loan is to purchase a Jersey cow and its fodder so that she can increase her milk production. Her goal is to own more higher-quality cows. 

On the behalf of this group, Pratva says, "We are very much thankful to Kiva lenders for their help and support."

loans.use: to purchase a Jersey cow and its fodder so that she can increase her milk production.

loans.name: Edison Fernando

texts.es:
Edison joven de 20 años de edad, nació en Sigchos  en una zona rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi vive en un cuarto arrendado desde hace algún tiempo atrás, terminó sus estudios primarios con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio de ellos, y al no poder  seguir dándole para que siga estudiando Edison  tuvo que buscar primeramente trabajo. 
Actualmente trabaja como ayudante en un local de carpintería ,desde hace algún tiempo atrás, además se dedica a trabajar como ayudante con un grupo de amigos que tienen juegos mecánicos y van de feria en feria por toda la ciudad y sus pueblos, por su experiencia Edison quiere emprender con su propio negocio y es por esto que quiere invertir en la compra de una cama elástica y un argollero , su mayor obstáculo en la vida ha sido que por su corta edad nunca le han podido dar un crédito para emprender  su pequeño negocio, 
Edison es  quien ha dado todo el apoyo económico a su familia, es por esto que su madre siempre le apoya en cualquier decisión que tome. Al ver la situación económica de su hogar Edison  a más de seguir trabajando se hará cargo de su propio negocio, y luego contará la ayuda de uno de sus hermanos,  y un amigo por el momento no cuenta con el apoyo de ninguna entidad financiera, vino a Fundación Alternativa ya que su madre es una cliente nuestra. 
Además a él  le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto.  Hace llegar un cordial y efusivo  agradecimiento a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal ya que con el dinero que le financiemos podrá cumplir con uno de sus mayores sueños.
texts.en:
Edison is a 20 years old young man.  He was born in Sigchos, a rural area in the Cotopaxi province, and lives in a rented room.  He completed elementary school with great effort and sacrifice, but unable to pay for additional education, Edison had to look for a job.

Currently he works as a carpenter’s helper and has for some time.  He also works as a helper for some friends who have carnival rides and go to the fairs around the city and other towns.  Edison wants to use his experience to set up his own business and wants to buy a jumping bed and establish a group.  His biggest obstacle is that he has never been able to get a loan to start his small business.

Edison is the one who has provided all the financial support for his family, and this is why his mother supports him in all his decisions.  Having seen the financial situation in the home, Edison will take charge of his business, as well as continuing to work.  He will also get help from one of his brothers and a friend.  At the moment he doesn’t have any financial support, so he came to Fundación Alternativa because his mother is a previous customer.

He would also like to buy a vehicle in the future so he can visit more customers.  He ends his great appreciation to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making the growth of his work and personal life possible, since he will be able to achieve his greatest dreams with help from this loan.

loans.use: to buy a jumping bed.

loans.name: Félix Álvaro

texts.es: Félix  es un hombre luchador, desde temprana edad le ha gustado la actividad comercial de la cual inicio con poco productos, actualmente con los 21 años de tener  dicha actividad hoy tiene un pulpería bastante solida en cuanto a su nivel de inventario el cuenta diferentes tipos de productos que demanda la clientela, es casado, su núcleo familiar cuenta con 5 personas las cuales colaboran con la actividad del negocio y también se dedican a sus estudios, actualmente este señor quiere aprovechar la oportunidad  de negocio por las fechas navideñas por tal razón se presento a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el cual lo utilizaría en la compra de arroz , azúcar, aceite, frijoles, semolina, maseca, harina, jabón , papel higiénico, salsa de tomate, gaseosas, polla, queso, huevos, ace, cloro, café, pasta dental etc. para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela el cual le vendría a mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Félix is a fighting man; from a young age he has enjoyed the business that he started with few products. Now in its 21st year, his small grocery store is very solid in its level of inventory as it has different types of products that his customers demand. 

Félix is married and his family unit consists of five people who all help with running the business and also study. 

Now Félix wants to take advantage of the business opportunities of the holiday season. For this reason he approached CEPRODEL to ask for financing that he will use to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, semolina, Maseca corn flour, flour, soap, toilet paper, tomato sauce, sodas, chicken, cheese, eggs, Ace detergent, bleach, coffee, toothpaste, etc. He needs these products to meet the demand of his customers and by selling them he will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, semolina, Maseca corn flour, flour, soap, toilet paper, tomato sauce, sodas, chicken, cheese, eggs, Ace detergent, bleach, coffee, toothpaste, etc

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 63-years-old and married.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Estrella has borrowed and paid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Estrella aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Myrna is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, eggs, sugar, milk, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, eggs, sugar, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, sugar, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Nieves has been in this business for two years. Nieves earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and farming vegetables.

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58-years-old and married with two children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.

Delia has borrowed and paid twenty-two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Delia aspires to save enough money so she could repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong is a 43-year-old married man with one daughter and one son. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Cuong operates a business washing and repairing motorcycles and selling parts. He has been involved in this business for ten years. 

Cuong would like to take a loan to invest in his business by buying washing tools and motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers. He hopes that, through this loan, he will be able to increase his business turnover. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy washing tools and motorcycle parts to stock his store and serve more customers

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 37 years old, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a local factory. Loan earns income through her general store and cafe that serves people in her community.

Loan started her business ten years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety and quantity of new products, such as household items and coffee, to sell to her customers. Loan hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of new products, such as household items and coffee, to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a merchant. Dung has been running a general store and selling shoes for earning a living. 

She started her business one year ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different shoes, and also sugar, milk, and noodles to stock her general store. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products, such as sugar, milk and noodles, to stock her general store, and also to buy shoes.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is requesting a new loan to buy and process leather materials for selling. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business, processing capacity and sales. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business and increase his income, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and process leather materials for selling.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Remedios is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her manicure/pedicure business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her manicure/pedicure business.

loans.name: Agua Viva Group

texts.es: Orietta, quien en la fotografía aparece de las terceras de pie de derecha a izquierda  y con gafas en su cabeza pertenece a Banco Comunal Agua Viva que está ubicado en Castro. Sus socias y socio están dedicados a la repostería chocolatería comercio y venta de abarrotes. El negocio de Orietta es banquetería, chocolatería y repostería, comenzó con su negocio hace cuatro cuando se capacitó junto a un grupo de amigas, y empezó con su negocio por el hecho de que su hijo mayor se fue a estudiar fuera de Chiloé y ella debía ayudar en su hogar. El mayor problema que ha tenido es la falta de dinero. El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar insumos para la venta de cuchuflis artesanales. Ella esté muy esperanzada de que le irá muy bien con la venta de cuchuflis. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder compartir con gente que tiene sus mismos intereses y que está con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Orietta, who appears in the photograph standing third from right to left, with glasses on her head, belongs to the Agua Viva Village Bank, which is located in Castro. Her partners work in baking, making chocolate, trade and selling groceries. Orietta's business is catering, making chocolate and baking. She started her business four years ago when she trained along with a group of friends. She started her business because her eldest child went to study outside of Chile and she needed to help with her home. 

The largest problem that she's had is a lack of money. The loan that she is applying for is to buy ingredients for the sale of artisanal cuchuflis [rolled waffles filled with dulce de leche]. She is very hopeful that the sale of cuchuflis will go very well. What she has liked most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that she can share with people that have her same interests and that have a lot of ambition to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make artisanal desserts.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is a 36-year-old married woman. She lives with her two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a mason. For 15 years, she has run a business of selling coconuts and breakfast meals to people in her community.

Le would like a loan to purchase a large quantity of coconuts and good-quality food to better satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of coconuts and good-quality food to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Erum Naz

texts.en:
Erum Naz is 29 years old and a hardworking and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons, both of whom are studying in third class. Her husband is a security guard and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. For 4 years, Erum Naz has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. 

For that reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room onto the salon, as the space in the salon is much too congested now. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very thankful to both Brac and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49-year-old Millicent from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children. She also supports 2 relatives at home. 

Since 2005, Millicent has run a business within her community, selling cups, plates and food containers. She says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

Millicent requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, Millicent would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Ann Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
The nine women from this village created a Self-Help group called "Ann Maa Tarini SHG", and Namita is the president of this group. In the picture, the lady seated with a raised hand is Namita. The group is made up of members having a purpose to help and support each other in their business activities and in their personal lives. All the group members are engaged in different activities to make some money for their household expenses.

Namita lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her son, aged eight years, who is in school. She is engaged in flower cultivation and flower selling. In India, the fresh flowers are used for God worship and for decoration; so Namita plucks the flowers in the early morning and sells them to a nearby market at retail as well as wholesale. She also sells the small flower plants. 

Her husband is a farmer who is engaged in paddy cultivation; he helps in Namita's flower selling. Namita and her husband both take on all the family's responsibilities. Namita has a dream of making a house for her family and educating her children. 

Namita, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 225,000 INR. Namita will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her flowers and flower plant business. 

She is really very thankful to Kiva for this opportunity

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her flowers and flower plant business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Two of her children currently attend school. 

Kadiatu runs a retail business.  She sells charcoal and palm oil for resale. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business from 9:00am until 4:00pm, six days per week. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, charcoal and gari to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, charcoal and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Fatmata from rural Waterloo in western Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children ranging in age from one to ten years old.

In 2011 Fatmata began to sell pharmaceuticals to earn money for her survival. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:30 p.m. seven days a week. Inflation and establishing a proper selling location are her main business challenges.

Fatmata is applying for a 1,500,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more medical drugs to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her living standards and increase her business.

Fatmata plans to expand her business in the coming years. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  In 2010, Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her family's welfare. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of hair products and general stock for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of hair products and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Biswa Dolagobinda Shg Group

texts.en:
The "Biswa Dolagobinda SHG" group consists of sixteen women from a small village of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are engaged in different activities like animal rearing, vegetable selling, milk selling, etc. They help and support each other in their business activities, as well as in their personal life. All the group members are dedicated and committed to enhance their business and make a handsome amount of money, so that they will be able to educate their children and have a better standard of life.

One of the group members is Saraswati, the lady standing first from the right. She is thirty-one years old, a married lady, and lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her two children, aged three and six years. Her first child goes to a local school. 

She has been engaged in cow rearing and cows’ milk selling for the last three years. From this activity, she is able to contribute a small share to her family's household expenditures. She wants to register her first child in a good school.

She, along with all the group members, has requested a loan to invest in their respective businesses for enhancing their business activity. Saraswati will use her portion to purchase a Jersey cow and renovate its shade. 

She is very excited to take this loan, and she says, "We are grateful to Kiva and its lenders for providing us this opportunity."

loans.use: to purchase a Jersey cow and renovate its shade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional waxed cotton fabric

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
Norlinda is 38 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

She has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mildred works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from goat fattening.  

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. Now she is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Leonora is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 50, is married and has one child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a guard man. Phuong earns an income by running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business eight years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular, foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular, foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Marie from Waterloo1 Western rural in Freetown. She is married and has 4 children, three currently attending school. In 2010, Marie established her retail business because she wanted to contribute to taking care of the home. She works at the business 7 days per week. Marie says that her main business challenge is transportation problems within her area.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of cooking oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school frees and to increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood and bamboo for the repair of her fishing boat.

Nerissa has been in this business for five years. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Nerissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials, like wood and bamboo, to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2 western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. For the past 20 years, Isatu has established her wood business.  She began her business because she wanted to take care of her welfare. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more wood for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to buy a vehicle to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF, and now she is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant business.

Arlita hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags and clothing material for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, in the Western Rural Area in Freetown. She is married with two children.  In 2007, Fatmata established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to support herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic slippers and clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers and clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Jariatu from Waterloo Western Rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. After her wedding, Jariatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income for her family. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Jariatu requires a loan in order to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Jariatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 35-year-old housewife and the mother of two children. 

She is very talented and excels in the work of hand embroidery. She started her work after the death of her husband, four years ago. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from the people living around her. In this way she manages to provide for her children. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she needs to purchase more material in bulk, such as reels of threads in different colors, packs of needles, sequins, pearls, etc. This compelled her to contact BRAC and apply for a loan of PKR 25,000. In this way she will able to complete the orders on time. 

Robina intends to use part of the profits on the betterment of her family members and on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a fast and clean cooking gas package to cook meals late at night

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar, age 46, is a responsible mother living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has long been a member of BRAC and this is her fifth loan with them. 

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste paper, etc. He has been running his business for many years. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have enough money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money.

Therefore, Kishwar requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the repayment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods to sell.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз сельская женщина, занимающаяся разведением крупнорогатого скота. Ей 40 лет. Она живет с мужем и четырьмя детьми в селе района Шахритус. Вот уже 6 лет как Кундуз выращивает коров и телят для продажи. Параллельно с животноводством она как и многие жители села занимается растениеводством. Ей в этих деятельностях помогает муж. Сейчас Кундуз хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе. С такой целью она просит кредит для приобретения пару телят. Кундуз надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Kunduz is a village woman who works with cattle breeding. She is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in a village in the region of Shahrituz. Kunduz has raised cattle and calves to sell for six years already. In parallel with the cattle breeding she, like many of the inhabitants of the village, also works with field crop cultivation. Her husband helps her with this business. 

Currently, Kunduz would like to increase the number of cattle in her cattle yard. With this aim she requests a loan to purchase two calves. Kunduz hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase two calves to increase the number of cattle in her cattle yard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics by the pound, threads and cotton.

loans.name: Rosiel

texts.en:
Rosiel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more of the needed products for her business. Her business has been running for four years now, and it keeps on growing. 

Aside from selling frozen products, she also sells fish, rice and vegetables, and her loan helped there too. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children, while her income from business is assisting their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan  to purchase more stocks of frozen and processed foods, like hot dogs, ham, sausages, and more. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosiel dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  It is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of frozen and processed foods like hot dogs, ham, sausages, and more.

loans.name: Raikul

texts.ru: Райкуль 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. Райкуль -домохозяйка, имеет среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Райкуль занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Супруг Райкуль работает электромонтером, получает определенную зарплату ежемесячно. Благодаря упорному труду Райкуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,80 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Райкуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку одной коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Райкуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение дочери.
texts.en: Raikul is 36 years old, married and raising one daughter together with her husband. Raikul is a homemake and has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 16 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS).  Raikul's husband works as an electrician and earns a set monthly salary.  Thanks to Raikul's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow and also a 0.80 hectare land plot, where she grows beans and clover for sale. The monthly income amounts to 14,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Raikul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy another cow in order to increase livestock headcount. Raikul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her daughter's continued education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap, along with wax cotton fabric,  to expand her business

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years, and earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Now she is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional foods to sell through her food vending business.

Leny dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Abibatu from Tombo, Western Rural Area in Freetown. She is married with one child aged 3 years. After the war, Abibatu established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to get her daily bread. She works at the business 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem within her operation area.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Abibatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Now she is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, nails, etc. for her business.

Amelia dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, nails, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin selling cooking gas packages to her community to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Kadie from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has eight children. She also supports 2 relatives at home. 

Since 2010, Kadie has run a business within her community, selling flasks and plastic bowls. She says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

Kadie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more flasks, plastic bowls and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, Kadie would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more flasks, plastic bowls and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Binta from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. After her wedding, Binta established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income for her family. She works at the business from 8 AM until 6:30 PM, six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Binta requires a loan in order to purchase bags of char coal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Binta plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 54 years old and married, with three children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

Lydia has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Lydia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing copper rods through melting. He buys scrap copper material from a factory and puts it into a high enough temperature for melting and then reshaping.

Nasreen has four children and they barely manage to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health and education. She needs to earn sufficient income to support her family well. She is in her fifth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. 

Currently she has requested a loan to buy more raw materials for manufacturing so that her husband can increase his sales. She expects a boost in their earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of the business. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap copper for reshaping.

loans.name: Samra

texts.en:
Samra is 45-year-old lady. She is married and living with her daughter and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her husband because he owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover is very high. 

Due to the high costs, he is facing a shortage of materials and is unable to purchase the expensive raw material to sell. Therefore, Samra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can resolve the shortage problem. Through this amount her husband will buy a stock of threads, fancy fabrics, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Samra is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for resale.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 33 years old, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.  She is a very hard-working and honest lady. 

She has to do a lot of hard work to meet her household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and to tuition in the evening. It is challenging for them to afford the school and tuition fees, so that both are doing a lot of hard work to run their house. 

Nasira owns a small beauty parlor at home, and her husband has a small job in a firm. Both are contributing their full income for household expenses. 

With the passage of time her beauty products are going to run out, and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 
Nasira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

She will buy cosmetics products, such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors, and combs for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Guldzhahon

texts.ru:
Гулджахону 31 год. Она живет в районе Гиссар, недалеко от столицы. Гулджахон замужем, имеет двух детей школьного возраста. 
Гулджахон предприниматель. Еще в 2003 году она открыла свой торговый бизнес и уже 10 лет как продвигает его. Гулджахон на рынке района имеет торговую точку, где занимается продажей сезонной обуви. Сейчас она продает зонты, резиновые галоши и мягкие сапожки. Ее товар хорошо расходится, так как это сезонный товар. Сейчас Гулджахон обратилась за кредитом. Она просит в кредит 1300 долларов США для приобретения новой партии товара. Ей очень нужен этот кредит для развития торговли.
texts.en:
Guldzhahon is 31 years old. She lives in the Gissar region, not far from the capital. Guldzhahon is married and has two children of school age. She is a teacher. In 2003, she opened her own retail business and has already worked with it for 10 years. 

Guldzhahon has a sales point at the regional market, where she sells seasonal shoes. Currently she sells umbrellas, rubber overshoes and soft boots. Her goods sell well, because they are seasonal. Currently, Guldzhahon has applied for a loan. She requests a loan of 1,300 US dollar to purchase a new shipment of goods. She needs this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase umbrellas, rubber overshoes and soft boots to sell

loans.name: Kilisimasi

texts.en:
Kilisimasi is a 39-year-old married  woman with four children . She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this  for years. 

Kilisimasi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Kilisimasi hopes to support her family and extend her business.

loans.use: to buy for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Шахноза раньше работала в салоне красоты. Она предоставляла услуги парикмахера. Шахноза 2 года назад начала новый бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она работает в ателье, где находится в центре ее района. Шахнозе очень нравится ее работа. Она очень способная девушка. Благодаря упорному труду и высокому качеству, она имеет своих регулярных клиентов. Шахноза хочет построить новый дом, так как их дом очень маленький и старый. Шахноза и ее родители не имеют денег для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, кирпич и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young and cheerful woman. She is 25 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Shahnoza used to have a beauty salon. She was a hairdresser. 

Two years ago, Shahnoza started a new business of sewing women's clothing. She works in a studio, which is in the center of her region. Shahnoza likes her work very much. She is a very capable woman. Thanks to persistent work and high quality, she has returning customers. 

Shahnoza would like to build a new house, as their house is very small and old. Shahnoza and her parents do not have enough money to purchase building materials such as cement, brick and so on. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as brick and cement, for building a new house

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают двух дочерей. У Айсулуу - среднее образование. По характеру Айсулуу очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Айсулуу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 2,88 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулуу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Aisuluu is 38 years old, married, and raising two daughters with her husband. Aisuluu has a secondary education. By nature, Aisuluu is very responsible, sociable, and cheerful. She and her husband work in livestock and farming. They started fifteen years ago when they bought 4,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Aisuluu's hard work, her farm now has a dairy cow. She earns a monthly income is 10,000 KGS from selling milk. She also farms 2.88 hectares of land, where she mainly grows beans. She sells her crop to wholesalers. In order to further develop her farm, Aisuluu approached the  microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Aisuluu plans to invest profits she makes from the loan in further expanding here livestock, and she plans to save money to educate her children.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mabinty from Tombo Western rural  area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 3  and 18 years. One of her children is currently going to school. In 2010, Mabinty established her cookery business. She began her business because she wants to get her daily living. She works at the business 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business transportation problem within her operation area.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Memunatu from Jui Eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. For the past 15 years, Memunatu has run her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a source of income to support the home. She works at the business from 8 AM until 6:30 PM, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the high cost of transportation.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase bags of charcoal and palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Memunatu plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.ru: Навбахор трудолюбивая женщина. Она 20 лет назад начала свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур. Навбахор еще в доме у родителей помогала своим родителя по выращиванию сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи и зерновые культуры. Навбахор является основной кормилицей ее 2 детей, так как ее муж не работает нигде. Навбахор хочет, чтобы ее муж начал свой бизнес предоставлением услуги такси и таким образом помочь ей по обеспечению семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони, так как ей не хватает денег для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Navbahor is a hardworking woman. 20 years ago she started her business of field crop cultivation. Navbahor helps her parents with growing crops and breeding livestock at their home. She especially grows vegetables and seasonal crops. 

Navbahor is the only breadwinner of her two children, as her husband does not work. Navbahor would like her husband to start a business of providing a taxi service, and this way help her with supporting the family. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni, as she does not have enough money to purchase a car. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a car to set up a taxi business for her husband

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and married with five children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buy and sell fish.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load phone cards and a buy and sell charcoal business. Janeth is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Meriam works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Meriam is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and married with three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru:
Исмоилчон женатый мужчина из города Турсунзаде. У него есть четырехлетний ребенок. Для Исмоилчона его семья самое важное и главное в его жизни, и ради своей жены и детей он работает и живет. Исмоилчон занимается растениеводством Ему 28 лет. И уже 12 лет своей жизни он выращивает овощи в парнике. За такое время растениеводство, выращивание овощей под вниманием стала для него любимым занятием. Свой опыт и умения в этой сфере деятельности он получил отца. Отец научил его всем капризам этой деятельности. 
   На данный момент Исмоилчон нуждается в финансовой поддержке. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить семена овощей помидоров, огурцов болгарских перцев других овощей. На вторую часть кредита он построит парник для овощей на зиму. У Исмоичона большие планы на зиму. И он просит Вас помочь осуществить его план. Помогите ему.
texts.en:
Ismoiljon is a 28-year-old married man from the city of Tursun-zoda.  Together with his wife, he is raising a 4-year-old child, and considers his family the most important thing in his life.  He lives and works for the sake of his wife and children.  Ismoiljon grows vegetables for a living; for the past 12 years, he's been growing them in a greenhouse.  During this time, he's grown quite fond of this line of work.  His experience and skill at growing vegetables is due to his father, who taught him all the nuances and tricks of the trade needed to succeed as a vegetable farmer.

Currently, Ismoiljon is in need of a loan to buy seeds and build a new greenhouse for the winter (to grow tomatoes, cucumbers, and Bulgarian peppers, along with some other vegetables).  He has big plans for this winter, and hopes you'll help him bring his plans to fruition.

loans.use: buy some vegetable seeds and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Former National Guard Laura had pressure washed her grandparents’ home dozens of times before she realized that what she had been doing for years as a helpful granddaughter could also be a promising business venture.

Laura started a pressure washing business that offers services to North Carolina residents who need their decks, sidewalks, patios, and driveways cleaned. Despite having initial issues funding the business, Laura has been doing a stellar job. Within its first year, Laura's business has received rave reviews online from satisfied customers on platforms like Angie’s List.

“That is what it is all about: Doing something you love and keeping your customers happy,” Laura explains.

Laura will use this loan to expand her business, which means purchasing the equipment needed to begin offering interior home cleaning services and buying a hot water pressure washer that is necessary for her to continue operation during the winter months. 

With your help and this loan, Laura envisions a big future for her pressure washing business. Help her bring her vision to fruition. 

Check out her business here: http://landerspressurewashing.com/

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for interior home cleaning.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Mirna de 52 años de edad,  es madre de 3 hijos dos de ellos estudian y trabajan para poder ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar al igual que su esposo quien labora como guarda de seguridad devengando un salario muy bajo, Mirna empezó vendiendo maíz para sacar adelante a sus hijos, hoy en día con mucho esmero y esfuerzos también vende frijoles, sorgo, purina y queso. Con el  crédito que solicita invertirá en estos granos mencionados para ofrecer más a la clientela de esta manera ir creciendo poco a poco para el bien común de la familia.
texts.en:
Mirna is a 52-year-old mother of three children. Two of her children are in school and are working to help her with the household expenses, along with her husband, who works as a security guard, albeit for a very low salary.

She started selling corn in order to provide a better life to her children.  Currently, she works very hard and also sells beans, sorghum, cheese and Purina products.

She intends to use the loan proceeds to invest in these items so that she can offer more to her customers and grow her business little by little, which will benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase things such as corn, beans, sorghum, cheese and Purina products.

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been running several businesses -- food vendor, mixing and selling flour for making porridge and selling honey. She has been in business for 13 years now. She works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Rose's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start making and selling porridge flour and selling honey as well.  She also increased stock in the food store.  She can now meet her customers' demand.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates all who have supported her group because everybody can now support family demands, especially school fees and hospital expenses. Rose has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to buy a plot of land, to start building her house and to cover household expenses.

Rose will share this loan with her loan group "Mt. Livingstone" which has a total of twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize and millet.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Helena, who is married with four school children, is aged in her late 30s. Currently, Helena has been running a business of genge-duka (small general store) selling fruits, vegetables, dry foods like maize and baking flour, cooking oil, sweets, and other products on the same premise. 

She has been in this business for fourteen years now. Helena opens her business from 6 AM to 10 PM each working day and is able to make a good monthly return. 

This will be her 14th loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Helena's previous loans all were paid back successfully. She used them to buy her business out-of-stock products to meet her customers' demands. Her business profit she used to cover school fees and household expenses for her family. Helena managed to buy a plot and build three house rooms where now she is putting electricity. 

Helena will use this loan to buy new products like fruits, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, and other items for her genge-duka business. She dreams to build another two rooms. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Riziki" which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new products like fruits, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, and other items for her genge-duka business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to get more stocks of used clothes for her business, which has been running for five years now. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth dreams to expand her business and hopes to own a house and lot. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from her study of the word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Shakilah Peninah

texts.en: Shakila is a 23-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling second hand clothes. She started this business with a vision of earning a living and looking after her family. Shakila is facing challenges of weather changes and price fluctuations. However, she has a vision of building rentals and transforming her business into a renowned boutique of second hand clothes around town. Shakila has asked for a loan to buy stock of second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Susan works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. 

Susan, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 26-year old woman. She lives with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Saima’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw. He pays a daily rental for this rickshaw because it does not belong to him. They are an ultra poor family and he has been feeding his 6 children through this work. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased.  He was worried for many days about how to pay the rickshaw rental and so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Saima has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband. She still needs some more money for this.  Therefore, Saima requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings. She hopes that now her husband will not have to pay the daily rental.   

Saima hopes that her husband will be able to increase his income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is taking a loan to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery work at home. She has been knitting embroidery for many years and feeding her children. She is a responsible mother. She knows about her duties and responsibilities toward her children. She always keeps busy and is ready to provide better for her dear children.

Shazia is 34 and the mother of four children. Her husband works in a small firm for very low daily wages. He comes home very late at night. She has to pick up and drop off her children herself, manage routine work and complete her tasks for embroidery as well.
 
Shazia's dream is to construct her house according to the population of her children. For this purpose, she is saving.
Shazia is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan because this loan will increase the monthly income and savings.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like clothes, shoes and other mixed goods.

loans.name: Sren

texts.en:
Sren, 56, is the widowed mother of four dependent children who are still in school. To provide for the entire household, she has been making snacks for selling and she also has cars for rent too. Having in this business for 37 years, she is able to earn about $27 per day but she can manage to save about $10 each day after daily expenses. 

Sren is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan. With this loan, she is going to repair her cars for rent. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income from her current business so as to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: to repair her cars for rent

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery work with a machine at home to support her family. She has become an expert in machine embroidery, but a few days ago her machine broke due to her continuous work. Now she wants to buy a new embroidery machine to continue her business. Therefore, she requested a loan to buy an embroidery machine so that she can embroider more dresses to sell and grow her income. 

Rubina is a mother of seven children. She is motivated to provide good clothes and education for her family. She hopes to boost her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children. Rubina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for embroidery.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 37 years old and married with one son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a guard. Phuong earns income through running a food stall and general store that sells rice and different household items to people in her community. 

She started her business seven years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying more furniture, dishes, and better quality food to better satisfy  her customers. 

She hopes the loan will help her business to run smoothly and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture, dishes, and better quality food to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Don Carlos es originario de la ciudad de Granada. Se dedica a la pesca artesanal, lo cual le ha generado ingresos para su familia. Esta agradecido con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha sobresalido en su negocio, con los equipos adecuados manteniéndolos en buen estado. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar redes y darle mantenimiento a su lancha. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá realizar la pesca en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Don Carlos is from the city of Granada in Nicaragua.  He is a commercial fisherman, which has enabled him to earn income for his family.  He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for helping him make progress in his business, since through their help he has been able to keep his equipment in good condition.

He is seeking a new loan in order to purchase nets and perform maintenance on his boat.  He believes that the loan will be very helpful, since he will be better equipped to run his fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase nets and perform maintenance on his boat.

loans.name: Silvia Gladis

texts.es:
Silvia ha sido una mujer pujante y trabajadora, durante más de 35 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de la confección, oficio que aprendió de la mano de su madre y sus tías que siempre realizaron esta labor. Su experiencia laboral la obtuvo mientras trabajaba en diferentes empresas desempeñándose como operaria, pero hace 12 años, con algunos ahorros y el apoyo de los créditos, pudo comprar sus propias máquinas e independizarse, montó su propio taller en la casa donde reside con su esposo y sus dos hijos, trabaja en compañía de una prima en una jornada diaria de 2 a 5 am y retoman de 10 am a 4 pm, cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocida por la calidad de su trabajo y esto le ha permitido generar los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar.
El crédito que solicita será destinado a la compra de telas, hilos y nylon al por mayor, esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con la producción encargada por terceros y, aprovechará la temporada escolar en la que se mejoran las ventas y por ende los ingresos que percibe.
Silvia tiene como meta la ampliación de su taller, en el que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y, en un futuro cercano desea abrir un almacén para vender la producción de sus propios diseños, esto le dará la capacidad de tener mayor rentabilidad y así seguirá luchando por el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Silvia has been a vigorous and hard-working woman. For more than 35 years she has worked in the field of dressmaking, a trade that she learned from her mother and her aunts, who always did this work. She obtained her work experience while working as a machine operator for different businesses, but twelve years ago, with some savings and the support of loans, she was able to buy her own machines and become independent. She set up her own workshop in the house where she lives with her husband and their two children. She works along with a cousin and a day worker from 2 to 5 am, and they resume from 10 am to 4 pm. She has the advantage of being known for the quality of her work, and this has allowed her to generate sufficient income to support the household economy.

The loan that she is applying for will be destined for the wholesale purchase of fabrics, threads, and nylon. This will allow her to have sufficient supplies on hand to complete the production commissioned by third parties, and she will take advantage of the school season, in which her sales improve and as a result the income that she earns.

Silvia's goal is the expansion of her workshop, in which she would be able to generate opportunities for employment, and in the near future she wants to open a store to sell products of her own designs. This will give her the potential to have greater profitability, and in this way she will continue working for the well being and the quality of life of her family group.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and nylon wholesale

loans.name: Madhuban Mahila Krushak Club Group

texts.en:
The women of the Madhuban Mahila Krushak Club are from a small village in Odisha in the northern part of the India. The group is composed of 13 women who earn their living by raising animals like cattle and chickens, selling milk, and cultivating and selling vegetables. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan with People's Forum. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new year with solid goals and dreams.

Tunalata is a 40-year-old married mother of three children who range in age from 8 to 15 years old. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Tunalata. She completed three years of formal education but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. Along with all the clients of People's forum, Tunalata realizes that education is a vital key to a successful future for her children. She shares that her business is running quite well and, because of its success, she will be able to register her children in a good school this year! Her husband shares the same goals for the children. Tunalata is engaged in vegetable cultivation and she produce potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and seasonal vegetables. She is applying for her first loan with People's Forum. The requested funds will be used to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. With an optimistic spirit and positive attitude, Tunalata looks forward to this new year with its challenges, blessings and successes.

On behalf of her colleagues, Tunalata expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support. In addition, the ladies send greetings to all for a happy, healthy and successful new year!

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en: Sita is 18 years old and a single woman  with no children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, beans, eggplant and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sita needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, seeds, weed killer and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Sita will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes etc

loans.name: Faridakhan

texts.ru: Фаридахан 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают двух приемных дочерей, своих детей к сожалению нет. Фаридахан очень заботливая мама. У Фаридахан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Фаридахан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Фаридахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 2 бычка, а также обрабатывает 1,28 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фаридахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Фаридахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение своих девочек.
texts.en: Faridakhan is 38 years old, married, and raising two adopted daughters with her husband. They do not have biological children. Faridakhan is a very caring mother. Faridakhan has a secondary education. The primary source of income for the family is Faridakhan's work in livestock and farming. She started this business twenty years ago when she bought 6,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Faridakhan's hard work, her farm now has a dairy cow, a horse, two calves, and 1.28 hectares of land where she grows beans and potatoes. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Faridakhan approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Faridakhan plans to invest profits she earns from the loan into increasing her livestock and she plans to save enough money for her girls' education.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando is married and has three children. He runs a service-based business providing motor transportation in his community, earning to provide for the family needs.
