He has been in this business for six years. Armando joined GDMPC and borrowed funds to buy new tires. He hopes to save a portion of his income for his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Somoern's Group

texts.en:
Somoern is a 31-year-old mother of two dependent children. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items and farming rice for 13 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Somoern joined VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house where her family can live.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like soaps, sugar, salt, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's school fees

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Doña Dalila es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de librería, el cual le ha permitido salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que logro aumentar sus productos, crecer más su negocio y sobre todo, cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, etc. con el fin de ofrecer los productos más buscados por sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Dalila is native to the city of Managua. She is a salesperson that runs a bookstore, which has allowed her to get ahead and have a better quality of life. 

She feels grateful to Kiva and MiCredito as she was able to increase her products, grow her business and above all, meet the demands of her customers. 

She asks for a new loan to buy books, notebooks, pens, erasers, etc. in order to provide the products most wanted by customers. She believes that the loan will be very helpful as she will earn a better income and improve the conditions of her business.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks, pens, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco es un campesino de 44 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos de 13 y 2 años.
Actualmente trabaja como contratista de obra en una empresa y, de manera alterna se dedica a manejar el negocio de su suegro que consiste en la producción lechera, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres que le enseñaron desde pequeño las labores del campo, pues era su única alternativa de vida en esa época; de esta forma complementa los ingresos suficientes para sacar adelante a su familia.
Su propósito es tener su propio negocio de producción lechera, pues de esta forma podrá complementar los ingresos y hacerle frente al principal desafío que es la inestabilidad de su trabajo actual, para lograrlo solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará ganado productor de leche, así avanzará un poco más para cumplir sus objetivos y mejorar los ingresos.
Francisco, con la humildad y la nobleza que lo caracterizan, manifiesta que sueña con adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de su familia y además quiere luchar para seguir dando a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is a farmer, age 44.  He is married and is the father of two children, ages 2 and 13.

Francisco currently works as a contract worker in a company, and he also manages his father-in-law’s business, which consists of dairy production.  He learned this work from his parents, who taught him farming skills from a young age; it was the only way of life at that point in time.  In this way, he subsidizes his income in order to have enough to get his family ahead.

His goal is to have his own dairy business, so he can supplement his income in this way and face his main challenge, which is the instability of his current job.  In order to do this, he is asking for the support of a loan, with which he will buy dairy cattle.  Then he can move a little closer to his goals and improve his income. 

Francisco, with the humility and honor that are typical of him, shares that he dreams of owning his own home, where he can enjoy a better quality of life in the company of his family.  He also wants to fight to keep giving his children a high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Luis Octavio

texts.en:
Luis Octavio is an enthusiastic hog farmer from Morelos. His neighbors aren't nearly as excited; Luis Octavio lives in an urban zone and the flies and smells from the abundant manure generated daily are a local nuisance. Luis is investing in a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to treat his hog waste, resulting in multiple benefits. First off, the digester will process the waste, removing odors and resulting in a potent biofertilizer that does not attract flies. Luis Octavio will use the biofertilizer resulting from this process to help improve his crops without having to resort to expensive, fossil-fuel derived agrochemical fertilizers. The other byproduct generated by the biodigester will be a renewable methane-rich biogas - a clean and essentially free energy source. He will use the biogas produced from his pig waste to cook, heat bathwater, and heat water used to clean his animals' pens, allowing him to replace the non-renewable propane he currently uses. 

His digester will help him improve his relationship with his neighbors in addition to turning waste into multiple resources, resulting in social and economic improvements. This loan represents 80% of the total loan of his Biobolsa system.

loans.use: to buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Jinfeng

texts.en:
Jinfeng is an asylee from China. He used to have an import and export business in China. He is also an advocate of democracy in China. However, for this reason, he was persecuted by the Chinese government and had to close his business and escape from China with all his personal assets left behind.

He arrived in the U.S. in 2008. With his experience in the import and export business, he worked for a cosmetic products importer for three years. However, he is always an entrepreneur and doing business is always his goal. After he accumulated enough experience in doing business in the U.S., in 2011, he decided to start his new venture on this new continent as a wholesaler of cosmetic products. However, the business isn't always smooth. Because of limited capital, he has to rely on the bigger wholesalers who will eat up his profits. Now, with this Kiva loan, he can import in bulk from the manufacturers directly to increase his margin. His hope for his new life here in the U.S. all depends on this business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his cosmetic products wholesale business

loans.name: Zaira Daniela

texts.es:
Ella es Zaira Daniela y para empezar  va hablar sobre el proyecto, el cual es contarles que la carrera que desea estudiar profesionalmente es Odontología pero opto por la opción de estudiar primero Auxiliar de salud oral ya que esto le ayudara a tener más conocimientos y así poder  llegar un poco más prepara a la universidad, aparte le encuentra gusto y le llama mucho la atención.  
Se ve en un futuro, graduándose de Campo Alto como Auxiliar de salud oral, los planes para futuro son trabajar desempeñando  un cargo acorde con lo que estudio y así poderse ayudar a pagar la carrera profesional ya que tiene un costo alto pero sabe que esto no es un impedimento para poder alcanzar las metas de ella, en unos siete (7) años se ve graduada de odontología pero sabe que no dejara de estudiar ya que la ciencia cada día es más moderna, cuenta que este estudio le ayudaran a encontrar la felicidad plena,  ya que ese sería uno de los mayores triunfos en la vida.
texts.en:
This is Zaira Daniela who will begin by talking about her project. She tells us that she would like to study dentistry but decided to first study to be a Dental Assistant. This will allow her to have a greater amount of knowledge and in that way get to college a little bit more prepared. She also likes this area and was impressed by the service. 

She sees a future in which she graduates from Campo Alto as a Dental Assistant. Her future plans will be to work within the career path that she studied so that she will be able to pay for a more professional degree. This will have a higher cost to it but she knows that this will not keep her from reaching her goals. Within seven years, she will have graduated from dentist school but knows that she will not stop studying because science evolves every day. She says that these studies will help her to achieve complete happiness because this would be one of her greatest life achievements.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Бактыгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 32 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Bakhtygul is 51 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband. Bakhtygul has a secondary education. The primary source of income for the family is Bakhtygul's work in livestock and farming. She started this business 32 years ago when she bought 1,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Bakhtygul's hard work, her farm now has four dairy cows and four sheep. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm,  Bakhtygul approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Bakhtygul plans to invest profits she earns from the loan into increasing her livestock and she plans to save enough money to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru: Валентине 42 года, вдова, одна воспитала 5 детей. Старшая дочь замужем, вторая дочь-студентка, остальные три сына школьники помогают Валентине по хозяйству. У Валентины - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Валентина занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Валентины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Валентина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Валентина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Valentina is 42 years old, a widow, and is raising five children by herself. Her eldest daughter is married and the second daughter is a college student. Her three school-aged sons help Valentina around the farm. Valentina has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry. She started this twelve 12 years ago when she bought 10,000 KGS worth of livestock. Because of Valentina's hard work, her farm now has two dairy cows, and a horse. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Valentine approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy sheep for breeding. Valentina plans to invest profits she earns from the loan into increasing her livestock.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 63 años de edad, que se caracteriza por su tenacidad y su empuje, a pesar de las adversidades siempre se levanta con la frente en alto y sigue adelante, motivada por el amor a su hijo. Ha sido cabeza de hogar desde hace varios años, tras la separación de su esposo.
Se ha dedicado a trabajar en su propio negocio, una ebanistería que inició como alternativa para generar ingresos que le permitieran sacar adelante a su hijo y solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar, allí fabrica todo tipo de mobiliarios en madera, especialmente cocinas integrales, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo y de un empleado que contrata por temporadas, su horario de trabajo es de 7 am a 5 pm de lunes a sábado.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (madera, pinturas, entre otros), esto le permitirá cumplir con los pedidos ya contratados y tendrá disponibilidad suficiente para adquirir contratos más grandes, que le generen mejores utilidades.
María, con su perseverancia y actitud positiva frente a la vida, quiere seguir luchando para lograr sus objetivos y sueña con darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo a su negocio, atraer nuevos clientes y así estará en la capacidad para mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
María is a 63-year-old woman.  She is known for her persistence and her spirit.  In spite of her challenges, she always keeps her head high and keeps going, motivated by her love for her child.  She has been the head of her household for a number of years, ever since her husband left.

She works in her own business, a woodworking shop that she began as an endeavor to make money.  It allowed her to get her son ahead and take care of the basic needs of their household.  In the workshop she makes all types of wooden furniture, especially kitchen cabinetry.  She has the help of her son and an employee who works seasonally.  Her work schedule is from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. from Monday through Saturday.  

She will invest the loan she is requesting in the wholesale purchase of materials (wood and paints, among others).  This will allow her to finish the orders that have already been made, as well as to have enough available to get bigger orders, which will generate a bigger profit.

With her perseverance and positive attitude when facing life, María wants to keep fighting to reach her goals.  She dreams of her business having continuity and permanence, and of attracting new customers.  Then she will be able to improve the quality of life and well-being of her immediate family.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (wood and paint, among others)

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Emily would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emily dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Maryce, who is in her late 30's, is married with four children who are still in school.  She has been running a pharmacy for four years now.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 08:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This will be Maryce's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy medicines and has successfully paid back all her loans.  She is doing great.  She used her profit to make bricks to start building her house, pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy medicine for her pharmacy.  She dreams of opening another medical store.

Maryce will share this loan with her loan group "Waefeso," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
"Stability and security are just illusions. But they are necessary illusions because without them, there would be no way of going on,” says Nengboi whose husband was murdered by miscreants in the neighboring state and his dead body never found. She is the profile member of Ruth Group and the featured borrower for the group. When her husband was alive, she used to sell charcoal and firewood in the town market on the northern side of Manipur state, which is about 35 km from the state capital. But she discontinued her charcoal selling business, as she could not leave the house for business purposes. She had to take care of the family and the kids at home. 

Nengboi started running a grocery shop in front of her house. She sells all essential commodities like detergent soap, detergent powder, salt, toothpaste, edible oils, kerosene, onions, ginger etc. She usually gets the supplies from the nearest town market or in the capital market in Imphal. Most of the villagers buy commodities from the shop because the shop is located in the village itself and they don't have to spend extra money to go to the town market just to get a pack of salt. Because she doesn't have enough money to purchase supplies for sale, customers usually get irritated when their demands cannot be met.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase supplies from the army canteen at a low price and sell them. She is planning to open a savings account and start saving for the future. She says she will also repay the loan on time and try to expand her grocery shop. She thanks WSDS and Kiva for the generosity and love for the group members. She says, “Thank-You Kiva”.

The rest of the group members are engaged in raising cattle, pigs, poultry and other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more items like edible oils and cereals to sell

loans.name: Vioinda

texts.en:
This is Violinda. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Violinda dreams of having her own stall and hopes to make a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 23 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mylene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, chips and more.

Mylene has been in this business for one year.

In the future Mylene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs and chips

loans.name: Sophearith's Group

texts.en:
Sophearith is a villager from the Kam Rieng District, where crop farming is common. She is 31 years old and has three children. She is a rice farmer who also plants cassava as her primary business. She has been in this business for ten years. Furthermore, she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 80,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Sophearith is a client who has already received two loans from VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sophearith is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Kimyan

texts.en:
Kimyan, aged 21 years old, is a villager from the Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom Province. For 1 year, Kimyan has been working for one company and also growing paddy rice as her main source of income.
 
Kimyan is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Kimyan now is asking for an education loan to pay for her tuition fee at university. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee at university.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like beer, soda, beans and many other items

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
This is Remy. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan of 27,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Remy dreams that her business will flourish and hopes to make a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector. El crédito será utilizado en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para obtener leche de mejor calidad.

El sueño de Anastacia es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.Asi mejoar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Anastacia and a group of people from her community decided to take care of the land and the animals.  She makes a living raising cows to produce milk, which she sells to one of the industrial milk plants in the department of La Paz.  Her first step was to let the cows go free and not keep them enclosed far from the pastures where they like to graze.  Nor does she cut their horns, so they'll have their calves naturally, the nutrition they provide will be fresh and high quality, and they'll be healthy.

Anastacia lives in her parents' house in the community of Pallina Chico in the Viacha area of the province of Ingavi in the department of La Paz, an hour from the city of La Paz.  She has several heads of Creole cattle that require better care, given the weather conditions in the area.  She'll use the loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow to get a better quality of milk. 

Anastacia's dream is to have more cattle and ensure their good health.  This way she can improve her income and quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Shedrack, who is in his mid-30s, is married and has two children. One child is in school, while the other is still a baby. For eight years now, Shedrack has been managing his family by running a business selling bed sheets. He works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM per working day and is able to receive a good monthly profit. 

This will be his tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he has paid back in full, he bought stocks of bed sheets. Shedrack’s profit was used to cover school fees and household expenses, including home bed sheets, sofas, a fridge, and a TV. He is so happy with your financial support, which helps him to improve his life. Shedrack will use this loan to buy bed sheets to resell to more people. He dreams of owning a big plot of land. 

Shedrack will share this loan with his loan group "TRUST," which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to resell.

loans.name: Women Shg Huikap Awang Leikai Group

texts.en:
Pakpi is a resident of the Imphal-East district in Manipur, which is one of the Northeastern states in India. Pakpi is the featured profile member of the Women SHG Group and she is pictured with her hand raised. The group was formed to support one another morally and financially. They always stand for one another and believe in each other. Most of the group members are weavers.

Pakpi and her husband work side by side to support the family. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw to make an income. It is a tough job for the couple to make a living, as their income is unreliable, irregular and based mainly on the market value. 

Weaving is her main occupation and this is how she generates income for the family. She usually gets the weaving materials from shopkeepers on a credit basis and pays them back with interest after the woven products are sold. The woven products are sold in the neighboring village and nearby villagers. She also supplies them to retail suppliers in the main market. From the generated income, she pays the shopkeepers for the yarns and threads.

With the loan, she will purchase a variety of yarn and threads for weaving and weave different designs of woven products. She strongly believes that the income generated will be beneficial as she won't have to pay the shopkeepers interest money this time. She says “Thank you “ and she will always remain grateful.

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving and rice-selling businesses

loans.use: To purchase a variety of yarn and threads

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Una niña llamada juliana estaba cursando noveno ya casi lo iba a finalizar, estaba a mediado de agosto, cuando campo alto visito su colegio para darle la oportunidad a los estudiantes de hacer un tenido por un precio muy bajo, a ella le pareció una muy buena  oportunidad ya que a ella le llamaba la atención el área de la salud, a de mas los padres no tenían el suficiente dinero como para costearle una universidad, entonces ella podría ejercer su técnico y ganar algo de dinero para pagar la carrera cuando saliera de once.
Fue un poco complicado convencer a los papas ya que ellos tiene otros dos hijos a los cuales también debían sacar adelante para terminar  el bachillerato, el papa con el trabajo que tenia no ganaba lo suficiente como para poder costear todo lo que necesitaban los hijos, en el colegio debían pagar la pensión y otras cosas que requerían. El valor del semestre de enfermería era un poco económico y juliana quería salir adelante con esta carrera. Al convencer a los padres los de campo alto le dijeron que a la madre de juliana que el convenio iba a ser hasta que terminara la carrera, a si que fue pagando mensualmente, a  juliana le fue muy bien los 3 semestres que estudio, en el  tercer semestre realizo las practicas y le pareció muy bueno aprender a cuidar a un enfermo o a un adulto mayor, cuando fue a realizar los trámites para realizar el cuarto semestre de practicas le dijeron que el convenio que estaba manejando se le acabo.  
A ellos les pareció muy malo que el convenio se acabara, a si que una persona de campo alto les hablo sobre el convenio con kiva y es un poco mas barato para los papas poder pagar, ahora juliana tiene 16 años y espera obtener el convenio con kiva para que el papa y la mama tengan la disponibilidad de pagarle completamente el semestre, para que a si ella se gradué y al salir de once tenga el titulo de auxiliar de enfermería ayudándo trabajando para pagar la carrera y contribuir para que los dos hermanos también salgan adelante y puedan cumplir el sueño que tienen.
texts.en:
A girl named Juliana was completing her ninth year of school, and was almost about to finish up in the middle of August, when Campo Alto visited her school to give the students an opportunity to study at a very low cost.  It seemed like a very good opportunity to her because health studies really grabbed her attention.  Her parents didn’t have the kind of money that a university costs, so she would be able to put her skills into practice and earn some money to pay for her degree when she finished eleventh grade.

It was a little complicated to convince her parents because they have two other children who should also be given the chance to finish high school.  With the job that her father had, he didn’t earn enough to be able to pay for all that his children needed.  In the school he would have to pay room and board, as well as other expenses.  The cost of a semester of nursing was a little bit affordable, and Juliana wanted to move ahead with this degree.  

The people from Campo Alto told Juliana’s mother that the agreement would be in effect until she finished her degree, so they were going to pay monthly.  It went really well for Juliana for the three semesters that she studied.  In her third semester she did her practical training and it seemed really good to her to learn to care for someone who is sick, or for an elderly person.  When she went to sign up for her fourth semester, they told her that the payment agreement she had had was ending.

It seemed really bad to them that the agreement was ending, so a person from Campo Alto talked with them about an agreement with Kiva.  It is a little cheaper for her parents to be able to pay.  Now Juliana is 16 and she wants to make an agreement with Kiva so that her father and her mother have the ability to pay for the entire semester.  Then when she graduates and finishes eleventh grade she will have her nurse’s aide qualifications.  She can help by working to pay for her degree and also contribute so that her two siblings can get ahead and make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for registration for a semester

loans.name: Ann Jayaguru Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is called "Ann Jayaguru SHG" and consists of nine members who are all females from a small village in Odisha in the eastern part of India. They primarily work together but in different businesses like fish selling, animal raising, grocery shops etc.

Nilima is 37 years old and married with two children who are five and nine years old. She has been practicing her profession of dressmaking for a long time. Her main business is sewing and she has a good reputation. She learned in a sewing lab and when she gained more experience, she continued her own business.

She is requesting a loan of 225,000 INR from People's Forum for her group. She will use her portion to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, needles and threads to use for her business since competition has affected her sales a great deal and she needs more merchandise to offer her clients. She hopes to increase both her client base and her income.

All the group members are very excited to take this opportunity and all are very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, needles and thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is a farmer from the village of Mastara in the Aragatsotn region. He lives with his wife, two-year-old daughter, his wife's mother and two brothers. To take care of his family, Aram is engaged in cattle breeding, breeding sheep and hens and cultivation of grass and alfalfa. With the help of his brothers Aram sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. 

To sustain his agribusiness, Aram needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase forage for the livestock and to pay for harvesting services. As this is Aram’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support in collecting the needed loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Zaituni, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for 13 years now.  She works from 4 pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Zaituni's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy Irish potatoes and cooking oils for making chips and meet her customers' demand.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her loan. She used the profit to buy a plot of land and covered household expenses. She dreams of building her own house.

Zaituni will share this loan with her loan group "Mapatano" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a sack of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Carla Consuelo

texts.es: La señorita Carla tiene 26 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  licenciatura en enfermería, trabaja para pagar sus estudios se dedica a ejercer su profesión ya que trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería con la cual paga sus gastos de estudios estudia en la universidad Central de los Andes este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución y La señorita Carla va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como compra de una computadora para terminar sus estudios. Que durara el tiempo cinco años,  La señorita Carla enfrenta retos en sus estudios que son la competencia de profesionales que salen de esa carrera los cuales son varios y tiene que ser muy competente en su campo,  viven en la zona  Villa el armen. su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es de lograr realizar una maestría y seguir mejorando en el ámbito profesional.
texts.en:
Carla is 26, single, and studying for a nursing degree. She practices her profession by working as nursing assistant, with which she pays for her study expenses. She studies at Central de los Andes University. 

This is the first loan Carla has taken out with the institution and she is going to use the loan for the different expenses involved in studying, such as the purchase of a computer in order to finish her studies, which will last for five years. Carla is faced with challenges in her studies such as competition from the many professionals who obtain this degree, and she must be very competent in her field. 

They live in the area Villa el Armen. Upon finishing her studies, she wishes to be able to do a master´s degree and continue improving professionally.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Lemmy

texts.en:
Lemmy is 33 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Lemmy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lemmy requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 42 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are in school, Mercidita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercidita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, soap, shampoo, etc.

Mercidita has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Mercidita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, food items, etc,. to sell.

Grace has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, food items, etc., to sell

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en: Zurab is a 49-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, son, and pensioner mother. His wife is a teacher at local school and gets 360 Gel per month. Zurab is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 2 cows and a plot of agricultural land, where nuts and mandarin trees are grown. They produce cheese products and sell them with the harvested products. As the income is only seasonal, Zurab decided to start a more stable business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $5000 to purchase a minibus. As the minibus is purchased, he will transport people and increase the income of his family. With the increased income he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to transport people

loans.name: Edy Yobany

texts.es: Edy, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos y reside  en Taulabe, Comayagua.  Edy se dedica a la venta de refrescos, comidas y golosinas como churros, dulces, galletas, agua etc., este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años en su casa donde también le ayuda su esposa.  Anteriormente  trabajo como  operario en una maquila. Con el préstamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo con la institución y los a invertido en su negocio. Actualmente solicita 10,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos para elaborar comidas, refrescos, churros, dulces, galletas y otros. Su objetivo es incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos. El tiene como meta, darles una buena educación a sus hijos y apoyarlos en todo lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Edy is 38 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He and his wife have two children and live in Taulabé, Comayagua. Edy works selling soft drinks, meals, and snacks such as chips, candy, cookies, water etc. He has had this business for three years. It is located in his house, where his wife also helps him. Previously, Edy worked as a machine operator in a factory.

This is Edy’s sixth loan with the field partner, and he has invested his previous loans in his business. He is requesting this loan of 10,000 HNL to buy ingredients to make meals and stock such as soft drinks, chips, candy, cookies and others. He hopes to increase his sales and his income. His goal is to give his children a good education and support them in everything he can.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make meals and stock such as soft drinks, chips, candy, cookies and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to produce shoes and boots to sell to local residents

loans.name: William Mauricio

texts.es:
El es William un joven con ganas de salir adelante, con ganas de cumplir todos los sueños y todas las metas.
Escogió esta carrera porque le agrada todo lo que tiene que ver con la cocina y desea ser uno de los mejores chef más reconocidos en el país, los anhelos son conocer más acerca de la cocina tanto de su país como de nivel internacional, le gusta experimentar nuevas cosas, le gustan los restos y siente que se desempeña muy bien en esta carrera.
Tiene como propósito viajar por muchos países para a si conocer las diferentes culturas  gastronomía que existen, es por eso que trata de dar lo mejor de el en cada en cada clase y en cada taller para a si sobresalir tanto en lo personal y en lo académico, saber que con sacrificio y ganas se puede salir adelante.
Gracias a estas pocas bases  que tiene se ha podido desempeñar laboralmente, una d las tantas metas de William son poderle devolver en parte a la mama todo el esfuerzo y apoyo que ha tenido para sacarlo adelante, ya que el joven no cuenta con el apoyo del padre, solo tiene el apoyo de la mama que es cabeza de hogar.
Es por eso que el joven William se dirige a kiva con el fin de recibir el subsidio, ya que la mama corre con los gastos de arriendo, alimentación y educación, el joven desea seguir  su carrera gastronómica la cual es en este momento su prioridad para salir adelante.
texts.en:
William is a young man who is highly motivated to get ahead and to achieve all of his goals and dreams.

He chose a culinary career because he enjoys everything having to do with cooking, and he wishes to become one of the most recognized chefs in the country.  He desires to learn more about the cuisine of his own country, as well as cuisine from around the world.  He likes to experience new things, and he feels that things are going very well in his career.

He plans to visit many different countries so he can learn about a variety of gastronomic cultures.  It is for this reason that he tries to give the best of himself in every class and in every professional setting.  In doing this he will grow both personally and academically.  He knows that with sacrifice and willpower he will be able make progress.

Starting with very little, he has been able to establish himself in the workforce.  One of his many goals is to be able to give back and help to support his mother, in return for all the efforts she has had to make in order to provide him with a better life.  He never had the support of a father; he has only had his mother to help him, since she is the head of the household.

It is for this reason that William is applying for a loan through Kiva.  His mother already has many expenses, such as rent, food and education.  He wishes to pursue his gastronomic career, which is his priority and his means of getting ahead.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie runs a general store in their community while her husband earns income from driving. She has been doing this for four years, earning well for the benefit of her family. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. She works in her store for more than eight hours a day because she wants to save money to provide a better future of her only child.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
This is Carolyn. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase recyclable materials from collectors needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carolyn hopes to have other sources of income and dreams to have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials from collectors needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products needed in her grocery store. Her business has been running for five years now and it keeps on growing. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from the business is supporting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more inventory of mineral water for her business. Her loan is helpful not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 32,000 PHP loan to buy additional inventory of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norma hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams to have a better living. She attends weekly fellowship* meetings that allow her to give of her own share of God’s love and care in her life. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase mineral water to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
This is Belinda. She previously accessed an 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as intheir personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Belinda dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys  tiene la edad de 58 años, es casada y vive con el esposo y cuatro hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de pollos de engorde  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio de pollos  le ayudará a ella y la familia  a salir adelante. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gladys is 58 years old, married, and lives with her husband and four children. She is requesting a loan to buy broiler chickens to raise so that she can sell them when they are grown and make a profit. Her chicken business helps Gladys and her family to get ahead. She hopes that her business will grow and reach her objectives, so that in the future she can give her family a better quality of life and more economic stability.

This is the first loan that Gladys has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR gave her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens to raise.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Nenita has a general store business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Frisca

texts.en:
Frisca works hard to support her family. Frisca is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Frisca requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Frisca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a 37-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is operating a retail shop alongside running a salon to boost his income. He has a vision of buying a plot to build a home for his family despite the challenges of price fluctuation and customers who delay payment. Deus intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en: Irakli is 37-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, daughter and pensioner mother in a small village of Lanchkhuti district. His wife is a teacher at the local school and gets a small monthly salary. Irakli has a newly opened food market and needs to purchase stock. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $950. As the stock is purchased, he will offer a wide assortment of products to his clients, and the number of clients, as well as the family income, will increase. With increased income, Irakli will expand his market and will be able to improve his family life in the future. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his newly opened market

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a 41-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her main business is running a retail shop but she also practices agriculture in order to earn additional income. She has a hardship of competition. Her vision is to have a wholesale shop.

Janepher intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt, soap and match boxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt, soap and match boxes to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 39-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses like crop production, where he earns an extra income. He faces the challenge of stiff competition but has dreams of educating his children to the university level and also set up a ranch.

Geoffrey is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is 39 years old and married.  He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income, though he also practices agriculture production as a side income business. 

Nicholus faces challenges of weather changes and diseases that sometimes attack his cattle, but he has dreams of having more cattle in his farm.

Nicholus is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Asip

texts.en: Asip is 34 years old, married, and has two toddler children. He is from the village of Sadakhlo. His family runs an agricultural business and cultivates a plot of land where maize is grown. The income from this activity is seasonal and in order to generate stable monthly funds, Asip is going to start an additional business. With this loan, he plans to purchase a van and use it for making fruit and vegetable deliveries. He will sell fresh produce in the neighboring villages and have a good income, which will enable him to cover everyday costs, as well as expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a van to make fruit and vegetable deliveries

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is 27 years old and married. She lives in a rural village in the Kam Reing district of Battambang. She has three children. She has been involved in rice farming, planting corn, and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for several years, she is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s need. 

Sor is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sor is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. Sor hopes that the prices of her crops will increase soon, so she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 52-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, daughter, and son-in-law in a small village in the Lanchkhuti district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow, two calves, and a plot of agricultural land where maize and nut trees are grown. Davit's wife milks the cow every day and produces dairy products, which are sold to local retailers with the harvested nuts and maize. 

Davit decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase a horse. Once the horse is purchased, Davit will transport wood from the forest and will sell it. As the wood is mainly used for heating in the winter, Davit hopes the additional business will increase his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a horse to transport wood from the forest to sell.

loans.name: Anjum Ara

texts.en:
Anjum Ara is 42 years old and married. She is an active lady who is living with her husband and children in the city of Rawalpindi. She faced a real difficult time because her husband’s earning were not enough to provide for his family. It compelled her to initiate the work of stitching at home four years ago. She is well aware of the stitching techniques. She stitches clothes for the people who live around her house. She serves her community well and became famous by providing good quality service. 

However, due to the lack of money, she is unable to fulfill the demand of her customers. She is currently in her second loan cycle, and now, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of buttons and reels of threads in various colors. It will help her to earn more and, hence, better support her family.

loans.use: To buy stitching material.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old married father of two children who has been working in the construction business for three years. He started working as a builder when he was forced to quit school during his intermediate classes to help his parents in increasing their income and developing their living.

Mohamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary materials and tools he needs to use in a project he is working on. He is so optimistic about this loan and sure that it will come with a very impressive income which will help him develop both his social and financial situations.

Mohamad is working hard on developing and expanding his working zone. He hopes that in the future he'll be capable of recruiting someone who can help him respond to the increasing customer requests and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials and tools he needs to use in a project he is working on

loans.name: Alpher

texts.en: Alpher is a tricycle operator. He is 29 years old with 2 children from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. His motorcycle is very important to him because he generates income from it that supports the educational and financial matters of his family. It has been 4 years in servicing people and he never thinks to give up because he believes that in every step he makes, every step he gets, corresponding success will come to it. To answer the needs, he asks assistance from Paglaum MPC  to buy another unit of motorcycle to have an extra income for his family. PMPC granted his wish and he is very thankful to it.

loans.use: to buy another unit of motor unit.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is a 24-year-old single man who is the sole breadwinner for three members of his family. He has been running his door selling business since 2011, with four years of experience in his domain.

Jack is a hard worker who specializes in selling internal and external doors with special qualities and encouraging prices. He used to work as a sales person in the same domain, but his ambitions are beyond being just an employee. As a result, he established his own business and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can.

Today, Jack is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy newly released items with special, encouraging prices that he couldn't have without the acquired loan.

He hopes to expand his business and partner with many existing construction companies that will help him develop his business widely.

loans.use: to buy new released items with special encouraging prices that he can't to have without the acquired loan.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their business and life every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water to expand her business.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in a construction business for the past six years. He specializes in cement work, which he has a special talent in doing.

His business is his only source of income, which is why he puts so much effort in developing and improving it.

Haytham is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary tools requested to update his business. He will also pay for necessary materials to finish a certain project he is working on.

He is an ambitious man who works hard to develop both his social and financial situations and to make sure that his customers are served well.

He hopes that in the future he can establish his own construction projects that cover all sectors as well as improve his net profit.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools to update his business and to pay for necessary materials to finish a certain project he is working on

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy additional computers and supplies for her computer shop. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her child who is in college. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna dreams that her business will grow bigger, and hopes to have a vacation with her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and its where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hardware business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of hardware to resell.

She has been in this business for six years.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of hardware to resell.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 42 years old, married with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecil has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Cecil has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa Adoracion

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa Adoracion works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Theresa Adoracion requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice, soft drinks, canned goods, soap, biscuits and other grocery items.

Ma. Theresa Adoracion has been in this business for 11 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, canned goods, soap, biscuits and other grocery items.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Yolanda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Yolanda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Phanny's Group

texts.en:
Phanny, 31, is a married mother of two children. She grows rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland while her husband is a barber in the village. She and her husband have been in this business for 10 years. Phanny is able to earn about 26,000 KHR per day from farming. 

Phanny has been with VisionFund for one cycle and her group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. As group leader, Phanny is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia, age 27, is from the village of Idleti. She is living with her husband, two school-age children, and retired mother-in-law. The modest income that the family makes is from a small poultry farm. Specifically, Natalia has several chickens, and sells eggs periodically. These funds are hardly enough to cover feeding expenses.

In order to generate an additional source, Natalia decided to open a grocery store near her house, and sell various of food products. The family needs money to buy construction materials to renovate a small store. They will buy a stock of merchandise as well as fix their own coffee grinder machine to offer coffee grinding service to their clients. 

Natalia will work as a salesperson and serve her clients in a friendly way. The family will get more income, and they will be able to cover household expenses, as well as improve the living conditions in future.

loans.use: to renovate a small store, purchase merchandise, and fix the coffee grinder.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 36-year-old hardworking woman. She is a decent lady with many hopes and dreams. She belongs to a poor family and her biggest dream is to provide a quality education for her children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family and his monthly net income is inadequate to meet the family needs. 

Her husband owns a small electronic goods repairing shop. He has excellent skills repairing electronic goods such as televisions, radios, fridges, etc. This shop is the only source of income for his family. Presently he needs to purchase spare parts and tools for repairing electronic goods like television, tape recorders, etc.

Therefore, Nazia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. This loan would be very helpful for her husband to continue his work and to continue generating income. Nazia is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for repairing electronic goods

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig is a 40-year-old married man who lives in the village of Azizkendi with his wife, child, and retired parents. Rafig runs an agricultural business and grows various vegetables on his own piece of land as well as in a greenhouse.  He works hard all day long to earn his living, but his existing income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses. 

That is why Rafig decided to start another business. He applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved under the startup loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. This loan will help Rafig to purchase a minibus. Rafig will work on the minibus line as a driver and transport passengers from his district to the capital city. The new business initiative will significantly increase the family's funds. With the increased income, the family will be able to increase their daily spending and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a minibus and start working on the bus line as a driver.

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en: Khatia, 23 years old, lives with her parents in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Her mother is a saleslady at a local market and gets 300 Gel per month. Khatia has a mini market. She needs money to purchase additional stock for her market and she requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $5,000 to purchase stock. After expansion her market will offer a wide assortment of household goods to her clients. Khatia will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions for her family. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase home products and expand her market

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 29-year-old married mother of one child. She works in selling woman accessories, cosmetics, and makeup since six years ago, to help her husband in making their living and covering their precious child's increasing needs.

Salam is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special released Christmas and winter new collection, which will attract customers' attention and increase her sales. She will also use part of the loan to pay for driving courses and license, which will help her a lot in searching for many other wholesale sources where she can find the best prices. That will help her in increasing her income and replying to customers' needs.

She is working hard to keep on developing her business in a well managed way.

Salam will make sure that in the future, she will work on expanding her shop and keep on diversifying her products to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and pay for driving courses and license.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 30-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who has been working since 2009 in selling prepaid mobile phone cards in the Palestinian camp where he lives. Youssef is suffering from limited work opportunities Palestinian refugees face. That is why he found himself stuck in his current business that he is working hard to develop so that he can start a new life, make a beautiful family, and cover their needs.

Youssef is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business capital through buying prepaid mobile phone cards that will increase his business capital and will automatically increase his income. He is working hard so that in the future he can open a mobile sales shop where he will sell newly released mobiles, used phones, accessories and prepaid cards. He also plans to provide maintenance services.

loans.use: to increase his business capital through buying prepaid mobile phone cards that will automatically increase his income

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
After raising birds for over 20 years, Charles became concerned with how many breeders disregard their birds’ well-being. So Charles started Winging It Aviary, a home-based nursery that breeds baby birds. By raising the birds in a stress-free environment with large cages, Charles ensures that the birds are humanely treated. 

Charles’ insistence on the birds' safety is hugely popular with his clients. Clients pick out birds from his website (http://www.wingingitaviary.com/) and Charles weans them himself, hand-feeding and hand-taming the birds. He also provides ongoing technical assistance to his clients to ensure that they are able to properly care for the birds. 

Charles is ready to expand his business further. He would like to offer cages, perches, feed and other accoutrements so that his business can become a one-stop shop for his clients. 

Help Charles build his business and encourage humane treatment of exotic birds!

loans.use: to purchase cages, perches, feed and other accoutrements for his business.

loans.name: Hamra Group

texts.en:
Rutchelle is part of the Hamra Group. She is a Filipino citizen living and working as a housekeeper in Lebanon. She came to work hard and provide her children with the necessary standard of living. She is a 30-year-old single mother of three precious children, who she left to be raised by her parents. 

Rutchelle is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. This will help her to pay for her children's school fees, which is an important thing. She is working hard to provide for her children, since education is their only hope for a brighter future. She hopes that in the coming years, she will be capable of establishing her own business back in her home country, the Philippines, and to be next to her beloved children while taking good care of them. 

Rutchelle is the first from the right with the black top. As for the other borrowers, Gladice is the first from the left with light blue uniform, and Ma Elsie is the lady at the center of the picture with a grey uniform.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees, since education is their only hope for a brighter future.

loans.name: Benialita

texts.en:
For the past 3 years, Benialita has operated a business buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines. She is married and works hard to support her family.

Benialita has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase necklaces, bracelets, watches and rings to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase necklaces, bracelets, watches and rings to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
For over 20 years, Angel worked as a maritime engineer while dreaming of owning his own business.  Finally, 8 years ago, he realized his dream and started United Maritime Services. He was able to repair boats and make income while continuing his job as a maritime engineer. 

Unfortunately, Angel lost his job. He decided to move to Miami and devote himself to growing his business.  He found that he loves the freedom of being a business owner and has been recognized in the United States for his experience, skills and efficiency in the industry. 

Angel is ready to grow his business further, but he needs help with the administrative side. With this loan, Angel will be able to purchase the necessary technology (a computer, printer, etc.) to help him run the administrative side of his business. 

Help Angel realize his dream and build a livelihood!

loans.use: to pay for office equipment such as a computer and printer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 32-year-old married mother of 4 children who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She earns a living through agriculture in addition to extra income from her monthly salary. She has inadequate capital to buy manure and seedlings.  Grace also faces the challenges of prolonged drought and hail storms. She has hopes of becoming a role model to farmers around her area.  Grace intends to use the loan to buy manure and seedlings for the farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for the farm.

loans.name: Yoeng

texts.en:
Yoeng, 32, is married with one daughter who is still in school. She resides in a rural village located in the Choeng Prey district, Kampong Cham Province. For the last nine years, she has been farming rice and raising pigs. The current business earns her about 14,800 per day to support her family.

Yoeng is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is asking for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more pigs for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jeanett

texts.es:
Jeanett  junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.
