Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector y alimenticia. El crédito será usado en la compra de forraje y alquiler de tierra.

El sueño de Jeanett es comprar tierras para sembrar alfa y otros asi no alquilar el costo de 1 héctarea a Bs. 2000.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Jeanett and a group of people from her community decided to take care of the land and the animals.  She makes a living raising cows to produce milk, which she sells to one of the industrial milk plants in the department of La Paz.  The first think she did was to let the cows go free and not keep them enclosed far from the pastures where they like to graze. Nor does she cut their horns, so they'll have their calves naturally, the nutrition they provide will be fresh and high quality, and they'll be healthy.

Jeanett lives in her parents' house in the community of Pallina Chico in the Viacha area of the province of Ingavi in the department of La Paz, an hour from the city of La Paz.  She has several head of Creole cattle that require better care, given the weather conditions and the nutrition in the area.  She'll use the loan to buy fodder and to pay the rent on land.

Jeanett's dream is to buy land to grow alfalfa and other things so she doesn't have to rent for 2,000 bolivianos [BOB] per hectare.

This is the first time Jeanett has requested a loan from IMPRO and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fodder and to pay rent on land

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 27-year-old married father of two children. He has been working in glass manufacturing since 2007. Since his business is his only source of income, he has to make sure to keep on developing it in a well-managed way to stay capable of supporting his beloved family.

Ayman is a Palestinian  refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp with limited access to several working sectors. This forced him to choose this type of business since it was one of the available ones he was allowed to do.

Ayman is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise by buying raw glass to change into glass shields ready to to be sold upon request. He hopes that, in the future, he'll be capable of opening an aluminum sales business to run parallel to his existing business, which will reply automatically to his customers' needs.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise by buying raw glass to change into glass shields

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 39 years old and married with three children. His wife is a housewife. Zaur's elder son is 15 years old and is in ninth grade. His younger son is 11 years old and is in fifth grade. Zaur’s daughter is 13 years old and she is in seventh grade. They are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli City and now live in the Abseron region of Azerbaijan. 

Zaur is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between various areas of the Abseron region. Today Zaur needs a loan of 1,000 AZN. Therefore, he has applied for a loan from Komak company. With this loan he wants to repair his car. Zaur is thankful to the Kiva organization and Kiva lenders for their help. In the future, Zaur wants to replace his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 24-year-old married father of two children. He is a Syrian citizen living and working in Lebanon since February, 2013. This is when he established his current bakery to earn a living and improve his family's socioeconomic situation.

Houssam is a well known, hard worker with a good reputation and special talents in his domain. He has a long experience in his domain. He is specialized in preparing the Lebanese traditional breakfast, manakish, which is folded dough with several different toppings served on customer request.

He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a display refrigerator. He needs this to diversify his products/selling and to increase his production. He hopes that he can develop his small bakery into a small restaurant in the future. He hopes to one day turn this into a well known restaurant which would be everyone's destination.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator for his bakery.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marissa has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle. She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Natia

texts.en: Natia, aged 33, is from the city Batumi. She is married with two children. Her father-in-law lives with the family as well. Natia's economic activity is her newly started store where she sells curtains, towels, and various clothes. Natia works as a salesperson from the rented commercial space. In order to increase sales and generate more income, Natia is requesting this loan. With the loan, she will go to Turkey (neighboring country) where prices are lower and buy stocks of merchandise in bulk. She will enlarge her store and offer a wide assortment of products to her customers.  Natia hopes the Kiva loan will be helpful for her business and her family's well being.

loans.use: to add stock of merchandise to her newly started store

loans.name: Mea Jiezel

texts.en: Mea Jiezel works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years.  Mea Jiezel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 24-year-old young man. He lives with his parents in a small village in the Kobuleti district. The only source of family income is from agricultural activities. They have a cow and small piece of land where they grow fruit. Irakli is unemployed at the moment.

As the existing income is not enough for the family, and Irakli can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Irakli applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and permits the rural poor to start or restart businesses.  

A loan of 1,200 GEL will help him to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them between cities. Irakli is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to help his parents to improve their living conditions. This credit will be a great support for the family. Irakli is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is aged 25 years old and married. She is a mother of one child. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for five years and supplement their family’s income by working as garment workers and sometimes by working for others for a fee. The current business earns Sreymom about 18,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sreymom joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy ducks to raise in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her family to improve its standard of living.

loans.use: to raise ducks in order to earn additional income for her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 48-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children and has taken a loan for her daughter. She knits embroidery by hand at her home.

Zahida belongs to a poor family and each member is doing their part to earn money. Her daughter proved herself to be a brave woman and did not become a burden for her parents. She proved herself independent and is earning a sufficient income.

Zahida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Her daughter does not want to loose heart and wants to afford all household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her family.

Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is married and has three children. For the past 8 years, he has been running a retail business in his community, earning well enough to provide for his family's needs. 

Joey joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a loan to buy additional motor spare parts and accessories for sale. Joey wants to improve and expand his business to have a stable source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional motor spare parts and accessories for sale

loans.name: Diana  Alejandra

texts.es:
Diana tiene 19 años, vive con su esposo Oswaldo de 30, radican en Santo Domingo nueva provincia de la República del Ecuador; en casa de sus suegros. Oswaldo trabaja como chofer en una empresa  y Diana  hace un año emprendió en el negocio de la venta de arroz para ser ayuda en su hogar. Ambos se apoyan, en especial los fines de semana que es cuando salen a recorrer en carro de sus suegros a recintos aledaños a dejar su producto.  
Fundación Alternativa tuvo la oportunidad de ayudar a esta pareja de esposos, les ayudó con un crédito ya que solicitaban para comprar aceite y azúcar porque sus clientes también les piden este tipo de productos, están muy agradecidos por la ayuda brindada ya que están seguros que mejoraran sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, con estas ganancias ellos quieren luego comprar su propio vehículo para recorrer a mas sectores.
texts.en:
Diana is 19 years old and lives with her husband, 30 year old Oswaldo.  They live with her in laws in Santo Domingo Nueva province in Ecuador.  Oswaldo works as a driver for a company and Diana started a business selling rice to help out in the household.  Both support each other, especially on the weekends which is when they both go out in her in-laws’ car to nearby areas to deliver their product.

Fundación Alternativa had the opportunity to help this couple with a loan to buy cooking oil and sugar because their customers are requesting those types of products.  They are very grateful for the help and are certain that their income will increase and allow them to improve their quality of life.  These earnings will allow them to buy a car of their own so they can visit more areas.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Isam

texts.en: Isam is a married client from Iraq. He is 38 years old and a father of four children.  Isam is the only provider of the family and he works hard to provide for his children's tuition fees. Isam owns a garage and specializes in repairing vehicles. He established his business in 2002. He developed good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.  Isam is requesting a sum of $2,500 to pay the annual rent for his garage and to buy some assets. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may be able to open a bigger garage one day and provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his garage and to buy some assets.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 32-year-old widowed lady who lives with her two children in the Bolnisi district. Her children are 12 and 13 years old and go to the local public school. Nana is a teacher at the school and she has a small monthly income. In addition, her children receive a pension from the government for being orphans.

Nana decided to start her business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $500 for trading clothes. She will go to Turkey and purchase a stock of clothes and then resell them in the Bolnisi district. Her income will increase and she will be able to provide better living conditions for her children. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar lives in the village of Tchanieti. He is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and retired parents. Emzar’s wife earns a monthly income trading household items at an open market stall. Emzar is jobless at the moment and he’s decided to start a business to generate funds.

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country vulnerable poor. These individuals do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. With the received credit, Emzar will purchase a car and serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and Emzar will be able to improve the living conditions of the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Rosefilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosefilda works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Rosefilda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Rosefilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bojan

texts.en:
Bojan, 34, lives in a minority community with his family. He is a married father of two children, ages 3 and 7 years old. He is a hardworking person who works a lot to improve the family's life, while his wife is a stay-at-home mom caring for their children and home.

Bojan runs a cable TV business in his area and has been in this business for more than three years. He started with very simple equipment but has been fortunate enough to improve his business and profit so that he now provides TV channel broadcasting. He is requesting a loan for the first time to purchase tools to improve the quality of his equipment . This will help to increase the number of clients and help him to improve the business. His goal is to save money to ensure a better education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase tools to improve the quality of his cable equipment.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Doña Teodora, tiene 68 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el municipio de san Pedro Sula. Hace 10 años que doña Teodora se dedica al negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, cereales, pan, refrescos, productos de aseo, pastas, huevos y otros abarrotes. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 30,000 Lempiras y es el tercer ciclo con la institución, el cual lo  invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, refrescos,  azúcar, harina,  huevos, condimentos, manteca, jabón, pan,  y otros  abarrotes con el propósito de mantener surtido su negocio. Tiene como meta mantener  el negocio  surtido para generar más ganancias.
texts.en: Teodora is 68 years old. She is married, she has 6 children and she lives in the town of San Pedro Sula. For 10 years Teodora has worked for her grocery business where she sells food products like basic grains, sugar, butter, cereals, bread, drinks, pastas, eggs as well as cleaning products and other groceries. The loan she is seeking is for $1,475 and it is her third cycle with the institution. She will invest it in the purchase of basic grains, drinks, sugar, flour, eggs, condiments, butter, soap, bread and other groceries with the goal of stocking a variety of products within her store. Her goal is to keep the business stocked with a variety of items to generate more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, drinks, sugar, flour, eggs, condiments, butter, soap, bread and other groceries.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana lives in a minority community. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children, ages 7 and 11, who attend school. Mirjana's husband works in an electrical company. Mirjana has owned her own business, a cafe bar, for more than ten years. Since cafe bars are rare in her area, Mirjana is able to earn more profit. Her usual customers are the younger generation who have a good time drinking coffee. 

Mirjana is requesting a loan in order to buy new inventory and beverages to satisfy customer demand. She will also use the loan to buy a generator because the power is sometimes off, especially during the winter time, and she needs electricity in order to operate. These purchases will help her to better meet the needs of customers from all communities in her area. Mirjana hopes to save money for her children and their future. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy new inventory, beverages and a generator

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 45-year-old married Syrian citizen, who is living and working in Lebanon. Randa established her home products selling business in March 2011 to make a living and meet her family's needs.

Randa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise and diversify her products to provide her customers with a wide variety of products that will attract their attention and increase her income. She will also increase the items related to the Christmas season that are highly requested during this period. 

Randa hopes to expand her shop in order to meet almost all of her customers' needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and diversify her products to provide her customers with a wide variety of products that will attract their attention and increase her income. She will also increase the items related to the Christmas season that are highly requested during this period.

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
Eustaquio realiza sanidad animal en la comunidad y junto al grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; él se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El vive en casa de sus propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para incrementar su producción de leche y por ende sus ingresos.

El sueño de Eustaquio es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos, a la vez tener establos atemperados y ordeñadoras.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Eustaquio works in animal health in his and he and his group of people from the same community decided to care for the land and the animals. He works raising cattle for milk production which he sells in one of the Leche de la Paz industrial plants. The first step that he took was not tying up the cows nor keeping them penned up far from the pastures where they like to graze, nor cut off their horns. This way, they have calves naturally and the feed they  are given is fresh and of high quality, keeping the cows in good health. 

He lives in his own home located in the community of Pallina Chico, of the Viacha sector in the Ingavi province in the department of La Paz. It is one hour from the city of La Paz. He has several heads of local cattle which require better care because of the area's weather conditions. 

He needs the loan to buy a couple of dairy cows to increase milk production and therefore his income.

Eustaquio's dream is to increase his heads of cattle, caring for their good health and having milkers and warm barns. 

This is the first loan he has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and his income.

loans.name: Elvia Cecilia Eloisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Elvia, tiene 54 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene un hijo el cual ya es  mayor de edad y vive en su casa.
Doña Elvia para salir adelante y para que a su hijo nunca le faltara nada hace muchos años adecuo un local en su casa y surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, además de víveres  también vende productos de Avon y Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Como a ella le gusta ir mejorando su vida es así que con las ganancias compro una moto taxi la cual la conduce su hijo y le sirve para que él se gane la vida y para ella le quede una ganancia extra, lo cual le ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres y productos Avon y Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante mejorando su local.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the borrowing group "Las Divas de Tosagua" meets in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its citizens make a living in agriculture and in raising livestock; it is an area of lush vegetation. 

Elvia lives here.  She is fifty-four years old and is separated.  She has one son from this previous relationship; he is older and lives with her. 

In order to get herself ahead and to ensure that her son is never in want of anything, Elvia opened a small store in her home many years ago.  She stocked this small grocery store with food items and also with Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories).  Because she wanted to continue improving her life, she bought a moto-taxi with her profits.  Her son drives the taxi.  In doing this, he makes a living for himself and Elvia is able to have a bit of extra income, which helps them both move forward.  

Elvia is going to use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy food items and Avon and Yanbal products.  She has been involved with the communal bank for four years, and she likes the help and support that group members offer to one another.  Her goals are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy food items and Avon products.

loans.name: Gulputa

texts.en: Gulputa is 56 years old. She has three children. She is a very hardworking woman and she loves her job. In her region, her breads are very popular and because of that she has many customers. Gulputa has been working for 20 years in this business. Her main job is to bake bread which is called “Tendircoreyi” in Azerbaijani. She works without rest and her daughters help her in this work. Gulputa's monthly income is 120 AZN. Now she needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to open a new baker house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a new baker house

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia es madre soltera ella se dedica a la agricultura y junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector y alimentacion. el crédito lo utilizará en la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos.

El sueño de Ofelia y su familia  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellosy contar con grangas atemperadas.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a single mother. She works as a farmer and, together with a group of people from the same community, she decided to tend to the land and the animals. She works raising cattle who produce milk which she sells to the Industrial Milk Plants of the department of La Paz. The first step she takes is to not tie up the cows or keep them enclosed far from the fields where they like to graze, nor does she cut their horns. She lets the calves naturally den and the feed she provides them is fresh and high quality which keeps her cows in good health.

She lives in her parent's home, located in community of Pallina Chico in the Viacha Sector in the Province of Ingavi in the Department of La Paz which is an hour away from the city of La Paz. She has several heads of native cattle that require superior care because of the climate conditions in the region and their nutritional needs. She will use the loan to purchase a milk cow to increase her milk production and her earnings.

Ofelia and her family's dream is to increase their head of cattle, and to take care to keep them healthy and even tempered. 

This is the first time that she has sought a loan through IMPRO and the first time through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cowl to increase her milk production and her earnings.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 45 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the region of Jinja in Uganda. She is married and has four children, none of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sodas, beers, and snacks. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase more sodas, beers, and snacks, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and improve the well-being of her family. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to own more branches. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Aidah, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, beers, and snacks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old single man who is responsible for supporting five members of his family. He has been running his own business since August 2011, and he is developing it in a well-managed way since it is his only source of income. Ali has a call center in his village. He is the only one who provides this service in his region, which supports him and pushes him forward to develop it as much as he can.

To move his business forward, Ali started providing money transfer services, which is highly requested in his region since most of the villagers have relatives outside Lebanon who work hard to support them through transferred cash on certain occasions and for many other reasons.

Today, Ali is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start selling mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards, which will diversify his products and services to fulfill customers' needs and requests. Ali is planning in the future to continue expanding and developing his business through selling mobile phones and developing this business sector widely.

loans.use: to start selling mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards, which will diversify his products and services to fulfill customers' needs and requests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is married with five children. All of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Berna resides in the family home, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.  

Berna has a retail shop and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and soda.  She works in the shop for seven days every week and sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income from rental houses. 

Berna's major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also aspires to own a wholesale shop. She decided to join MCDT SACCO since they don't charge transfer costs to send and receive money.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and soda to sell.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда очень хорошая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она пережила очень тяжелую жизнь. После смерти мужа она осталась без кормильца с 6 детьми. Мавчуда имеет среднее медицинское образование. Мавчуда работает в местной больнице медсестрой. Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Мавчуда уже давно болеет. Она не имеет денег, чтобы лечиться. Последнее время она серьёзно больна. Ей срочно необходимо лечиться. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavjuda is a very good and hardworking woman. She survived a very hard life. After her husband's death, she was left with six children and without a breadwinner.  Mavjuda has a secondary education in medicine.  Mavjuda works at a local hospital as a nurse. She earns additional income from raising cattle. 

Mavjuda has been ill for a long time but doesn't have the money to get treatment.  Recently, she has been seriously ill. She urgently needs to be treated. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy drugs for treatment. She awaits for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy medicine to treat her illness

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the ingredients and supplies for her business. Her previous loan also helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business helps meet her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Ana would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy different ingredients such as flour, different spices, and supplies needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ana hopes to have a big stall for her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients including flour, different spices, and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Narcisa has been in this business for five years.

Narcisa requested a 10000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 27-year-old hardworking man living in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a general merchandise shop. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. He is a good father and desires to send his children to university. 

Robert would like to set up other sustainable income generating activities such as rental houses. Price fluctuations and high license fees limit his net profits. Robert's dream is to trade in wholesale. He intends to use the loan to buy salt, sugar, and match boxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and match boxes to sell.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel, who is from Iraq, is 64 years old, married, and the father of five children. He is the only provider for his family. 

Fadel is a carpenter, and he has been in this field for more than 20 years. He gained his experience by working at several carpentry shops as an employee. Fadel specializes in making furniture for bedrooms and living rooms. He established his own business in 1990. Fadel has gained a good reputation in his surrounding area thanks to his clean work and his affordable prices. 

Fadel is applying for a loan of $3000. He will use this loan to buy an electric saw that is specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to keep providing for his family and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a specialized electric saw for work.

loans.name: Miodrag

texts.en:
Miodrag, 34 years old, lives in Kosovo in a minority community. He is married and is raising two school-aged children. Miodrag is a hardworking man, motivated by his children to keep going. He has owned a boutique, selling clothes and shoes for adults and children, for more than 5 years. Although Miodrag started by renting a small store selling clothing, he now has his own shop and his business has expanded. He is hoping to continue to expand it in the future so that it can become his main source of income.
 
Miodrag also works as a medical helper in a clinic and his wife works as a kindergarten teacher, so they are both quite busy. Miodrag is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell, to help his business become more successful. Miodrag is very thankful for this help as his goal is to save money to ensure a better education for his children!

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the region of Jinja, Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Henry has been working hard to manage his Dippo which sells soda, beer, sugar, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  soda, beer, sugar, and soap and will help Henry to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Henry hopes that in the future, he will be able to boost his business. 

Henry is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a widow and has three children. She sells homemade sausage in her community, which she has been doing for six years.  Her earnings enable her to provide for the needs of the family. 

Emma is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to buy raw ingredients. She hopes to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Aguedita

texts.es:
Aguedita tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por encontrarse cerca al valle del rio Jetequetepeque, a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno lechero desde hace 03 años, vendiendo la leche fresca y quesos en su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para una mayor producción de leche de su ganado, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aguedita is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Zaña district.  Its population works as farmers, merchants, and raising livestock.  It’s a community known for being near the Jetequetepeque river valley, one hour from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been raising dairy cows for the past three years and selling fresh milk and cheese out of her home.  She is an enterprising woman and is asking for a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles, through Edpyme Alternativa, to buy balanced feed to increase her milk production and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Leonor Lourdes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 26 años que a pesar de que está comprometida aun vive en su casa.
Doña Leonor aprendió corte y confección en una academia de esta ciudad hace varios años, con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a  sobrellevar la carga familiar desde hace mas de 15 años  puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí  se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa y sabanas que es lo que más elabora y vende, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, ella también sale a ofrecer las sabanas que elabora, estas las vende muy bien ya que las hace al gusto de sus clientes y su trabajo es de muy buena calidad. Trabaja todos los días ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos con la cual saco adelante a su hija y ahora le permite salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 1 año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todo este tiempo. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The borrowing group "Hermano Gregorio" meets every fifteen days in the Jocay neighborhood, which is located in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its lovely beaches that people visit throughout the year, its unparalleled beauty, and for its many tourist attractions. 

Leonor lives here.  She is fifty-five years old and is a single mother to a 26-year-old daughter.  Although her daughter is engaged, she still lives with Leonor in her home.

Leonor learned dressmaking techniques in a school in the city several years ago.  With the end goal being to earn her own income and to help support her family, she installed a small sewing workshop in her home fifteen years ago.  Since then, she has made a living sewing all types of clothing and sheets; these are the items that she makes and sells the most.  She works to fill the orders from her customers while also selling the sheets that she makes with her customers' taste in mind.  Her work is of the highest quality.  She works every day.  This is her only source of income, and so she relies on her sewing services to move herself and daughter ahead. 

She will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials.  She has been involved with this borrowing group for one year, and she likes the help that the group members have offered her.  Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and for her daughter and family to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Debra

texts.en:
When Debra’s son broke his neck, she needed to find a way to earn income and afford her the flexibility to care for him. She decided to take her 15 years of experience and launch her own project management company specializing in the scheduling, staffing and controlling of construction developments, power plants and waste management facilities.

"ACE Scheduling Consulting Services" has grown large enough to provide Debra and her son with sufficient income. However, Debra’s vision is to grow the business from 2 to 20 employees. In order to do so, she needs capital to perform site visits on her contracts. 

Help Debra build her business and provide for her son!

loans.use: to pay for site visits to fulfill more contracts for her project management company.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with two children. She runs a general store while her husband is working as a government employee. She has been selling assorted groceries for five years, earning well as a complement to her husband's income. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell. Grace always find ways to augment their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Bobo

texts.ru: Бобо порядочный человек. Он живет и работает в отдаленном регионе. Бобо женат и имеет 2 детей. Он более 20 лет занимается скотоводством. Бобо имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу. Его опыт и навыки помогают ему развевать бизнес. Бобо хочет увеличить оборонный капитал и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Бобо запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bobo is a respectable man. He lives and works in a remote area. Bobo is married and has two kids.  For over 20 years, he been working in animal husbandry. Bobo has a lot of experience in this business. His experience and skills have helped him grow his business. Bobo wants to increase his working capital in order to attract more customers. Bobo is requesting a loan of $3,000 to purchase cattle. He awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase body cream, spray, powder, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa se dedica a la venta de pollos a la broaster y silpancho (silpancho es un plato típico que tiene un pedazo de carne con dos huevos fritos encima, servido sobre arroz graneado y un par de plátanos fritos), brinda el servicio de venta de comida rapida y que el alimento que proporcione sea fresco y de gran calidad. 

Ella vive en alquiler ubicada en la en Viacha, Z/ Villa Mercedes del Departamento de La Paz, aproximadamente a una hora de viaje desde la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Rosa es crecer y por esta razón el crédito lo usará para comprar una  máquina de hacer pollos al spiedo, la cual sea de gran ayuda para ella,llegar a darle una mejor calidad de vida, al mejorar sus ingresos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Rosa sells broaster chicken and silpancho. Silpancho is a traditional food that has a piece of meat with two fried eggs on top, served on rice with a couple of fried plantains. She sells her fast food and the food she offers is fresh and of good quality. 

She lives in a rented house in Viacha, Villa Mercedes, of the La Paz department. It is approximately an hour from the city of La Paz.

Rosa's dream is to grow. That is why she will use the loan to buy a machine to cook the chicken on a spit. This will really help her and give her a better quality of life and improve her income.  

This is the first time she has asked for a loan with IMPRO and the first time with  KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a machine to cook her chicken on a spit to improve the variety of dishes that she serves and also to increase her income.

loans.name: Mela

texts.en: Mela is married with four children. She manages the family's own farm, a vegetable garden, while her husband gains an income as a private driver. She has been working in her garden for five years, earning enough money for the basic needs of her children. Mela joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy additional seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm. She is hopeful to gain success from the farm and use her earnings to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ivonne Rocio

texts.es:
Ivonne Rocio tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Oyotún una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria, preparación de platillos que se ofrecen en los restaurants de la zona, su población también se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con más de 10 años de experiencia, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería arroz, aceite, azúcar, entre otros para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ivonne Rocio is 28 years old and lives with her husband and son in the district of Oyotún. It is a community that is known for its hospitality, and for the preparation of dishes that are offered in the region's restaurants. Its population also works in agriculture, trade, and stockbreeding. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She works selling groceries, with more than ten years of experience. Her business is located in her home. She has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles for the purchase of merchandise, including rice, oil, sugar, among other products, to stock her store and in this way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асел 38 лет, замужем, детей 4 (2 дочери, 2 сына). Дочери старшие - студентки, сыновья - школьники. Асел имеет среднее образование, с самого раннего детства Асел занимается животноводством и полеводством. В 1995 году она вышла замуж за Айдара и вместе с супругом начала заниматься разведением скота и земледелием. Соседи описывают Асел как: ответственного, целеустремленного, и доброжелательного человека. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Асел в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 4,000 сом (KGS). Трудная и тяжелая работа Асел не в тягость. Благодаря упорному труду Асел в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 35 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 5 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Асел вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асел обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Асел планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en:
Asel is 38 years old, married, and has four children (two daughters and two sons). Her children are students. Asel has a secondary education. Since her early childhood, Asel has worked with livestock and field crops. In 1995, she married Aydar and started working in livestock and agriculture together with her husband. Neighbors describe Asel as a responsible, committed and friendly person. Her husband and children help with the housework. The family is very friendly, family relations are very good. 

Asel provides the primary income for the family. She has been working in livestock and field crops since 1995 when she started her business with 4,000 somoni. Difficult and tough work has not been a problem for Asel. Thanks to her persistently hard work, Asel now has two dairy cows, one horse and 35 sheep on the farm. She also has a plot of land measuring five hectares, which grows beans, potatoes and perennial grasses. Her farm brings in about 7,000 somoni per month from the sale of milk, which covers the cost of food and household needs of the family. Income from the farm has allowed Asel to raise and take care of her children. 

In order to further grow her business, Asel has applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase cows. Asel plans to invest income from the loan to further grow her business, as well as to do construction on an unfinished house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Nidia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nidia llegó a la ciudad desde hace 8 años, se trasladó desde su pueblo natal con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 10 años, en busca de nuevas alternativas que le permitieran salir adelante como familia. Luego de radicarse, comenzó a trabajar como operaria en un taller de confección donde obtuvo la experiencia y el conocimiento, un tiempo después decidió independizarse para generar mejores ingresos y pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, su taller está ubicado en la casa donde reside, allí presta el servicio de confección a terceros pero por falta de una máquina ella realiza sólo una parte de la producción y luego debe enviarla a otro taller para la elaboración del proceso de fileteado; generando una disminución notable en la rentabilidad de su negocio. Esto la motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar una máquina fileteadora que le hace falta, pues con ella estaría en la capacidad de realizar el proceso de producción completo y así aumentaría sus ingresos y por ende la rentabilidad.
Nidia sigue luchando para sacar adelante su negocio, pues se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y sueña con hacer de éste, un gran taller de confección en el que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia arrived in the city eight years ago.  She moved from her home town with her husband and her two children, ages 8 and 10, in search of new alternatives for getting ahead as a family.  After getting settled she started to work in a tailor shop where she gained experience and knowledge.  A while later she decided to go out on her own to generate better income and spend more time with her children.  

Nidia's workshop is located in the house where she lives, where she makes clothing for third parties.  For lack of a machine, however, she does only part of the production, then has to send it to another shop for the overlocking process.  This results in a notable drop in the productivity of her business.

This motivates her to request the support of the loan, with which she wants to buy the overlock machine that she needs.  With it she'll have the capacity to do the complete sewing process and increase her sales and, as a result, her profitability.

Nidia keeps on striving to get her business ahead because it has become her main source of income.  She dreams of making it a great tailor shop that will provide job opportunities and guarantee her a favorable economic stability to give her children a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, who is 51 years old, is married with three children. According to her, she needs to be strong to run her business because sometimes she is struggling. But through her determination and positive outlook, she can manage her business well. 

Imelda is asking a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy additional dried fish for her business. She hopes she can expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Magda Liliana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio  se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Magda, tiene 36 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva un año en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos tiene su negocio el cual lo ha ido aumentando con el paso de los días. 
Doña Magda es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo ir mejorando día a día su vida y también con sus ganancias ayudar a sus padres que son ancianos y de escasos recursos, ella trabaja en una boutique de la ciudad pero también tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende materiales eléctricos y repuestos para carros, en este negocio le ayuda la mamá en los días y horas que ella esta trabajando en la boutique. 
Este nuevo crédito es para comprar todo tipo de materiales eléctricos y repuestos para carros. Sus sueños son tener un local más grande y surtido.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio credit group meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much frequented all year long, and for being an unmatched beautiful city with many tourist attractions.  

Here lives Magda. She is 36 years old. She is single and lives in her parents' house. She has been in the credit group for a year and she likes it because thanks to the loans she has her business. She has grown it over time. Magda is avery hardworking woman who likes to improve day by day by hard work. Also, with her earnings she helps her parents who are elderly and of low income. She works in a store in the city but she also has a small locale in her house where she sells electrical materials and car replacement parts. In this business, her mother helps her on the days and times that she is working in the boutique.  
 
This new loan is to buy all types of electrical materials and car replacement parts. Her dream is to have a bigger and better stocked locale.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials and car replacement parts.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio que se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Ana es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella junto al esposo con sus ahorros también compraron un taxi el cual les deja buenos ingresos. Ella lleva más de 8 años dedicada  a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ciertos repuestos que necesita el taxi. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es comprar otro taxi.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio credit group meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much frequented all year long and for being a city with unmatched beauty and many tourism attractions.

Here lives Ana. She is 56 years old. She is married and has four grown children. Two of them still live in her home. Her husband is a taxi driver. Ana is a housewife who in order to obtain her own income and thus help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing via catalog and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works three days a week two to three hours a day. She sells on credit and collects every week. With their savings she and her husband also bought a taxi which beings in good income for them. She has done this activity for more than 8 years and it is going well for her.   

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and certain replacement parts that the taxi needs. This is her fourth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to buy another taxi.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and replacement parts for a taxi.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 46 years old and married with two children who are both in school. Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase soft drinks, beverages, cigarettes, rice, and other grocery to sell.

Marites has been in this business for ten years.

In the future Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beverages, cigarettes, rice, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio, tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara, junto a sus cuatro hijos. Lleva 10 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de granos básicos como café, maíz y frijoles.  El siempre se ha dedicado  a la agricultura y a comercializar productos. Ha solicitado otro préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos y vender. Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener más producto para sus clientes y así tener una mayor satisfacción. Tiene como meta, crecer como microempresario para ganar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is 61 years old. He is single and lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara with his four children. For 10 years, he has been buying and selling basic grains such as coffee, corn and beans. He has always worked in agriculture and selling his products. He has asked for another loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy basic grains to sell. This loan will help him to keep more products for his customers and have more satisfaction. His goal is to grow as a micro-businessman in order to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as corn, coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: Mariela, joven soltera de 27 años que lucha a diario para progresar en la vida, pues actualmente habita en casa de su mama junto a ella, Mariela ya es madre de una  niña de 2 meses de nacida, por lo que ahora más que nunca desea el bienestar común en el hogar, gracias a su pequeña pulpería que tiene con el apoyo de su madre, mantiene sus gastos principales y de la familia. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar materiales para cambiar una parte del techo de su vivienda el cual está muy deteriorado,  pondrá una parte del piso el cual es de tierra, así como también, cambiara el portón principal que ya no le sirve, le urge mejorar esa parte, principalmente para la seguridad de todos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mariela is a young, single twenty-seven year old woman who works every day to make progress in her life. Currently she lives at home with her mother. Mariela is a mother of a 2 month old daughter, which means now more than ever she wants to improve the wellbeing of her home. Thanks to her small store that she runs with the help of her mother, she covers her family's main expenses.

She asks for a loan to buy materials to change part of the roof of her home that is deteriorating; to lay flooring, which is currently earthen; and also to change the main gate since it doesn't work anymore and it's urgent to fix it for the security of everyone in the home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, tin sheeting, and to construct an iron gate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, canned goods, cereals, home cleaning products, shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Patricia Cleopatra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 54 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene cinco hijas, todas ellas mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Patricia tiene en su casa una pequeña granja de pollos, ella compra los pollos cuando están pequeños y los cría por tres meses con puro maíz razón por lo cual sus pollos tienen el sabor de gallina criolla y por esta razón tiene clientes. Actualmente tiene lista una buena remesa de pollos para la venta ya que siempre en esta época vende bastantes y a muy buen precio, esta es la forma como ella sale adelante ya que vive sola.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, medicinas y alimento para pollos. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y algún día tener una tienda.
texts.en:
The credit group Las Divas de Tosagua meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic and having a lot of vegetation, where most of the inhabitants work in agriculture or raising animals.

Patricia, 54, lives here. She is separated, but she has five daughters from that relationship. They are all grown and independent. Patricia has a small chicken farm at her home. She buys the chickens when they are small and raises them on pure corn for three months. This is why her chicken taste like farm-yard raised chickens, and this is why she has customers. Currently she has a good shipment of chickens ready to sell, since she always sells a lot during this time of year and at a good price. This is how she advances, since she now lives alone. This loan is to buy chickens as well as medicine and feed for the chickens. She has been through four loan cycles at the communal back and she likes it because of the help the loans provide. Her dream is to move forward and one day own a store.

loans.use: to buy chickens, and feed and medicine for the chickens.

loans.name: Ciria Inés

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ciria, tiene  43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 19 años que es casado pero aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es maestro de una universidad local.
Doña Ciria es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de leonisa y productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 2 años con este negocio el cual le gusta ya que además de ganar algo por su cuenta la entretiene y la hace sentir independiente.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Hermano Gregorio meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for having beautiful beaches, which are visited throughout the year, and for being a city of unrivaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Ciria, 43, lives here. She is married and has a 19-year-old son who is married but still lives at home. Her husband is a teacher at a local university. Ciria is a housewife who, to have her own income and be able to help her husband with the household expenses, works selling clothing out of a Leonisa catalogue and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She works three days a week, two or three hours a day. She sells her products on credit and collects money every week. She has done this for more than two years and she likes it because, in addition to earning her own money, it's entertaining and makes her feel independent. This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. She has been part of the communal bank for two years and she likes it because it is easy to make payments. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Liliana Annabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Liliana, tiene 21 años  de edad, está soltera y estudia Auditoria en una Universidad de Manta. 
Liliana además de dedicarse a sus estudios también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas, carteras, perfumes, cremas y varios productos más que le envían desde los Estados Unidos un familiar, ella se dedica al comercio ya que los gastos de sus estudios y de su mantención son muchos. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en el centro donde ella estudia ya que allá tiene varios clientes, lleva 4 años con este negocio el cual le permite seguir adelante esperando un mejor porvenir.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas, cremas, perfumes entre otros productos que ella vende. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
The communal bank Hermano Gregorio meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for having beautiful beaches, which are visited throughout the year, and for being a city of unrivaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Liliana, 21, lives here. She is single and studies Auditing at the University of Manta. In addition to her studies, Liliana is also a businesswoman, selling all kinds of clothing, shoes, wallets, perfumes, creams, and other products that a relative sends her from the United States. She does this because her expenses and school expenses are high. She sells door to door, although she makes most of her sales at the center where she studies, since she has several customers there. She has had this business for four years, which has let her move forward hoping for a better future. This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, creams, and perfumes, among other products that she sells. She has been part of the communal bank for two years and she likes it because the loans finance her business. Her dream is to finish her degree and become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Aivy

texts.en:
Aivy, 21 years of age, is single and lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To help her parents meet their financial needs, she invests in a small sari-sari business (variety store). Her parents are thankful to her because of the things she has done for the family.

In the year 2013, Aivy became a member of PMPC. She believes that the institution can provide her financial assistance to access the loan amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional inventories for her sari-sari store business. She is thankful to the cooperative in supporting her to grow in the small business she started.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 31 years old. She is married and has a third grade school student. She lives in Northern Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. The family has a van for transportation as a source of income. 

Ofelia requested a new loan to buy five pigs to feed and three sacks of pig feed. She wants to have an income of her own through her new hog raising business. Ofelia hopes to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy five pigs and three sacks of pig feed

loans.name: Amorlita

texts.en: Amorlita is 45 years old, married with 2 kids, and a resident of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari (variety) store, which is the source of her income. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase items needed for her sari-sari store so she can cater to the needs of her costumers. Amorlita deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy stock her for sari-sari store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 63 years old, widowed, and has 1 adult child. She lives in Tamban Punta, Miray Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She has a sari-sari (variety) store and earns a monthly income of 4,000 PHP. Anita has requested a loan to buy stock for her sari-sari store. She is striving hard to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
“I started my business to show my children that they should always follow their dreams and, if they put their mind to it, they can accomplish anything,” explains Amy. Amy saw an opportunity to start her own home-based business designing T-shirts. A former Marine, Amy loves the ability to interpret her creative visions. She has even taken ideas from her children – her daughter recommended adding rhinestones to her T-shirt designs. Her business, "Krazy Kids", has made custom orders for schools, football teams, military units and special events.

Previously Amy had been using an engraving company to fill her designs. However, she realized that she could do the designs herself if she just had the right equipment. This loan will be used to purchase the necessary equipment to bring her designs to life.

Help this veteran and mother of four grow her business!

loans.use: to purchase equipment to create additional T-shirt designs.

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es:
BENEDICTA EULALIA, tiene 42 años, tiene dos pequeños hijos que aun están bajo su cuidado y protección. Ella es socia del grupo "Los Jardines", grupo caracterizado por su responsabilidad y puntualidad en los pagos, está formado por 5 socias, unidas en el deseo de progresar mediante su trabajo de forma independiente.
Desde hace tres años aproximadamente, inició su aventura del negocio propio, instalando en su domicilio una pequeña bodega, empezó vendiendo lo esencial, como bebidas y golosinas, actualmente su bodega ha crecido, aumentó un poco de artículos de abarrotes. 
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas y golosinas, para abastecerse para las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Benedicta Eulalia is 42 years old, and has two small children who are still under her care and protection. She is an associate of the group "Los Jardines," a group characterized by its responsibility and punctuality of payments. It is formed by five associates, united in the desire to progress through their independent work. 

Approximately three years ago, she started her adventure of her own business, installing a small grocery store in her home. She started selling the essentials, like beverages and candy. Currently her store has grown. She slightly increased the grocery items offered. She will invest the received loan in the purchase of beverages and candy, in order to stock up for the Christmas celebrations.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and candy to stock her store

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур 57 лет, вдова, одна воспитала 2 детей. У Айнур - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнур занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнур, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 12 дойных коров, 5 лошадей, 30 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,76 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, сеет эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнур обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ainur is a 57-year-old widow who has raised two children by herself.  She has a higher education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this field 16 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Ainur's hard work, her farming business now comprises 12 dairy cows, five horses, 30 sheep, as well as 2.76 hectares of land on which she grows potatoes and sainfoin for her own use and for resale.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  

In order to further develop her business, Ainur has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners".  She is taking a loan to buy cows and increase her livestock headcount.  Ainur plans to reinvest the profits from her loan to further increase her numbers of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gladys Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 60 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es chofer.
Doña Gladys como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice, el tiene un carro con el cual realizar fletes por toda la ciudad, sale en la mañana a los  mercados locales donde los comerciantes lo contratan para que les lleve sus productos a varias partes de la ciudad y fuera de ella, así el se gana para el sustento de la familia. Como el carro está un poco deteriorado necesitan el crédito para realizar ciertos arreglos en el carro ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con los cuales salen adelante.
Este nuevo crédito es para reparar la carrocería del carro y para comprar llantas nuevas que necesita. Lleva tres ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es muy ordenado y cumplido. Sus sueños son comprar un carro más nuevo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" meets every 15 days in the Abdón Calderón neighborhood of the city of Manta.  This is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited every season of the year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.  

This is where Gladys, 60, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage that has produced 4 children who are now grown and independent.  Her husband works as a driver.

Gladys, like the good wife that she is, will take this loan for her husband to use.  He has a vehicle that he uses to carry freight throughout the city.  He goes out in the mornings to the local markets where the merchants hire him to take their products to various parts of the city and surrounding areas.  This is how he supports the family.  Since his vehicle is a bit run down, he needs a loan to make some repairs to it, because this is the only source of income he has to get ahead with his family.  

This new loan will be used to repair the body of the vehicle and to buy the new tires that it needs.  Gladys has been with her communal bank for 3 loan cycles, and she likes it because the group is very organized and accomplished.  Her dream is to buy a newer vehicle.

loans.use: to finance auto body repairs and new tires

loans.name: Augustine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juin 2008.IL est composé de membres qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Solange qui est à l'extrême droite de la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 43 ans et mére de 04 enfants dont 03 filles le plus âgé a 22 ans et le plus petit a 6 ans.

Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus et les teindre pour les revendre,elle pratique cela depuis plus de 05 ans ce qui fait qu'elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 02 piéces  de tissus à 27000f l'unité,des produits de teinture à 25000f.

Son objectif est d'assurer les frais scolaires des enfants,leur habillement et acheter des meubles pour sa maison.
texts.en:
This group was created in June 2008. It is composed of members whose main activity is retail.
Solange, who stands all the way to the right in the picture, is the group leader. She is married, is 43 years old, and a mother of four children, including three daughters. Her eldest is 22 and her youngest is six.
Her business consists in purchasing fabrics and dyeing them to resell them. She has been doing this for over five years, thus benefiting from a good amount of experience in this type of business.
With the loan, she is planning on purchasing two pieces of fabric at 27,000 XOF a piece and dyeing products for 25,000 XOF.
Her goal is to provide for her children’s school expenses and clothes, and to purchase furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and dyeing products.

loans.name: Nhat's Group

texts.en:
Nhat is 45 years old and a married mother of four children. For the sake of her entire family, she raises pigs as her main source of income and also works for others for a fee to earn additional income.
