Her ten years of experience in the pig-raising business have enabled her to earn almost 34,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day.

Nhat has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, which has enabled her to improve her living. For this cycle, she teamed up with a group of three to get a new loan. She and her co-borrowers are each seeking 1,400,000 KHR. Nhat, who leads the group, will spend her portion of the loan to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes to gain a good income from her business and better her lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence  is married with two children and none of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 12 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,0000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  She works at the market six days every week.  Her major business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because there is no security required for one to access a loan. She resides in a rented house and her family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, aged 38 years, wants a loan  to buy more spare parts for resale. He sells spare parts in a rural area in Hoima, Uganda. He raised the initial capital from farming. His greatest challenge is limited clientele. He is a hard working man who desires to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Procura

texts.en:
Procura is one of the persons who loves music. She is 47 years old and married from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has had a sound system rental business for thirteen years. With it, she wants to expand her business; therefore, she needs additional capital to purchase musical equipment to gain costumers from their neighboring places.

Through PMPC, she asks financial assistance of 20,000 PHP to cater to her needs. This is a big help for her to become successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional musical equipment for business purposes

loans.name: Las Torres De Vista Verde Group

texts.es:
HEBER GLORIA, tiene 42 años de edad. Ella forma parte del grupo "Las Torres de Vista verde", grupo recientemente formado, caracterizado por las ansias de sus integrantes de progresar cada uno en su negocio.
La Sra. Heber Gloria se dedica desde hace tres años a la compra y venta de aceitunas (fruto del olivo), desearía aumentar su stock y poder ofrecer el producto al por mayor.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de aceitunas y también cubrirá sus gastos de transporte para realizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Heber Gloria is 42 years old. She is part of the newly formed group "Las Torres de Vista Verde", which is characterized by the strong desire of each of its members to progress in their businesses.

Heber Gloria has worked for three years buying and selling olives (olive fruit). She wishes to increase her stock and be able to offer her product wholesale. She will invest the received loan in the purchase of olives, and she will also cover her transportation costs to carry out her business.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of olives and transportation of goods.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli, in the region of Jinja, Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Shaban has been working hard to manage his spare parts shop, which sells spare parts and scrap. 

To help expand his business, Shaban has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more scrap, and will help Shaban to generate greater profits and increase sales. Shaban hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another branch. 

Shaban is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shaban who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more scrap for resale

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур житель района Яван, занимающийся сельским хозяйством и животноводством. Ему 49 лет. Он женат, имеет пятерых детей. У него трое сыновей и двое дочерей. Сыновья ему помогают в дехканском хозяйстве. Баходур вот уже три года как работает в дехканском хозяйстве и выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Ему нравится как он зарабатывает на жизнь честным трудом. Баходур сейчас должен обработать почву, чтобы весной получить хороший урожай. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений и топлива. С полученной прибыли Баходур планирует увеличить поголовье скота в скотном дворе, а также покрыть семейные расходы.
texts.en: Bahodur, age 49, is a resident of the Yavan district of Tajikistan.  He is involved in crop farming and animal husbandry and works on a dehkan farm (mid-size farm).  He is married and the father of five children (three sons and two daughters).  His sons help him with the farm work.  Bahodur has been working on his farm for the past three years, growing agricultural crops.  He likes the fact that he is making a living through honest work.  He currently needs to prepare his soil, in order to get a good harvest in the spring.  With this goal in mind, he is taking a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel.  He plans to use his profits to increase his livestock headcount and to cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela, a sus 42 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio de reparación y venta de relojes, actividad que aprendió de su esposo y, gracias a un beneficio que recibió, las autoridades de espacio público de la ciudad, le otorgaron un módulo para que abriera su negocio, ubicado en una calle muy transitada del centro de la ciudad; trabaja de lunes a sábado de 10:00 am a 6:00 pm, de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (relojes y repuestos), para abastecerse con más variedad y poder satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes y aprovechar la temporada de navidad, para aumentar sus ventas.
Ángela manifiesta que su principal objetivo para un futuro cercano, es poder tener un local más amplio, en el que pueda mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y aumentar su portafolio de productos, para que esto le genere una estabilidad económica favorable y así poder seguir apoyando económicamente a sus hijos y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Ángela at 42 years old is the mother of two children and lives with her life companion. She works in her own business selling and repairing watches. She learned this activity from her husband and thanks to a benefit she received,  the city authority of Public Spaces granted her a space to open her business. It is located on a very busy street in the center of the city. She works from 10 am until 6 pm and in this way earns enough money to support the household finances. 

Today she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise wholesale (watches and parts) to supply herself with more variety and satisfy the diverse tastes of her clients. She also wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to increase her sales. Ángela states that her main goal in the near future is to have a bigger shop where she can improve her working conditions and increase her portfolio of products. She wants to generate a more stable favorable economic situation and be able to continue to support her children and offer the whole family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (watches and parts).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth, 60, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leandro, a retired navy man, and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ruth operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demand for clothing like uniforms and such is met all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Ruth is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.

Ruth hopes that her business will grow larger and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Santos Emiliano

texts.es:
Santos, es casado, vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 4 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor, para dar a su familia lo necesario para vivir sin limitantes se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y hortalizas además cuando tiene oportunidad también ejerce la carpintería y albañilería, son oficios que aprendió de su padre, por su experiencia no se le dificulta ejercer esta actividad.
Solicita crédito para invertir en la recolección de la cosecha, el resto le servirá para comprar insecticida, plaguicidas, fertilizantes y abono para la siembra de la hortaliza, espera recolectar su cosecha de maíz y frijol de manera muy rápida y obtener una mayor producción de la hortaliza, mejorara el producto que ofrece a sus clientes, aumentara sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
Desea fortalecer su negocio y poder ofrecer sus productos en el mercado municipal de su ciudad, así mismo continuar apoyando a su familia con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Santos is married and lives with his wife and his four-year-old daughter.  He is an enterprising man who provides his family with what they need without limits.  Santos cultivates basic grains and vegetables.  In addition, when he has the opportunity, he works as a carpenter and bricklayer.  He learned these trades from his father and his experience allows him to do this type of work without difficulty.  

Santos is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the gathering of his harvest.  The rest of the money will be used to buy insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers, and compost for planting vegetables.  He hopes to harvest his corn and bean crops very quickly and also obtain improved vegetable production so that he can offer better products to his customers.  As a result, he will be able to increase his sales and improve his earnings.  Santos wants to strengthen his business and offer his products at the municipal market in his town.  At the same time, he wants to continue helping his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the gathering of his harvest and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Fashionista Group

texts.en:
Ildesita is the featured borrower of Fashionista group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to cheer up their beloved families back in the Philippines, especially during the coming Christmas celebrations.

Ildesita has become close friends with the other group members since they left their hometown and came to work in Lebanon as housekeepers to provide their beloved ones a secure and healthy living.

Ildesita is a 41-year-old married mother of two children. This loan will be sent to her family to make sure that they will have the chance to celebrate Christmas time just like any normal family will do during this holy period of the year. She wishes that she could celebrate it with them this year, but unfortunately she can't. However, she is working hard to save the suitable capital to start her own business in the Philippines, and she is sure that when she is capable to take this step forward she'll be sure to take good care of both her family and business at the same time.

Ildesita is the first from the left. As for the other group members, Imelda is standing at the center of the picture with a red scarf, and Jovelyn is the first from the right.

loans.use: to make sure that her family will have the chance to celebrate Christmas time just like any normal family will do during this holy period of the year.

loans.name: Reiner

texts.es: Reiner  tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y una hija actualmente. El quiere el crédito para comprar  insumos como abono, fumigaciones y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es dar la mejor asistencia posible  para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como un caficultor de la zona. El pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Reiner  is 39 years old, married and lives with his wife and a child. He wants a loan to buy supplies like fertilizer, fumigants (pesticides) and help with labor. He has some land and wants to apply all the assistance possible to increase his next harvest and grow as a coffee producer in the area. He hopes that with these improvements he will generate a higher production of  coffee and more money to continue with his project and improve his well-being. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from the state banks and FUDECOSUR has offered this loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizer and fumigant.

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es: Gilber , un hombre emprendedor , tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar unos insumos para asistir una plantación de café, con la finalidad de mantenerla en buenas condiciones y con ello obtener una mejor cosecha de café y una mejor estabilidad económica, la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Gilber, an enterprising man, is 37 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and four children. He is requesting a loan because he wants to buy inputs to improve a coffee farm with the goal of maintaining it in good condition so he can have a better coffee harvest and better economic stability. The only challenge he has is the lack of money to continue growing. They depend on this business for their living, so that is why he is requesting a loan. This is the first loan he has recieved from FUDECOSUR. He doesn't have other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted him a loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 47-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a tailor from her house for the past sixteen years. Mirvat is a hard worker who is putting much effort towards supporting her beloved family. She is running her business from her house to make sure that she can respond to both family and business needs at the same time. Also, she wasn't financially capable of establishing the business outside her house when she started it.

Mirvat is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special threads and textiles, to respond (as much as she can) to the increasing customer requests for the upcoming Christmas celebrations. She hopes that in the future she can open a factory where, in addition to tailoring clothes, she can develop the curtains sector. She is already doing some of this but needs more updated machines to develop this properly.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special threads and textiles, to respond to the increasing customer requests for the upcoming Christmas celebrations

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 27-year-old single woman. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to add to her stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will live happily. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Migdelia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Migdalia es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería, el cual ha logrado un negocio próspero y rentable. Esta agradecida con Kiva y Micrédito ya que ha logrado cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes y adquirir más productos. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: granos básicos, galletas, pan, gaseosas, jabones, entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos que más demandan. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que tendrá buenas ventas e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Migdalia is originally from the city of Managua.  She is a merchant who manages a grocery business that she has been able to make prosperous and profitable.  Migdalia is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for enabling her to meet the needs of her customers by acquiring more products.  

She is requesting a new loan so that she can buy basic grains, cookies, bread, sodas, soaps, and other products.  This will allow her to offer her customers a variety of products that are in greatest demand.  She expects this loan will help her to have good sales and increased earnings.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cookies, bread, sodas, soaps, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase his existing pork soup production.

loans.name: Samoern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Samoern is 51 years old and married. She and her husband have nine children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living as paid workers on a rubber farm. She can earn about KHR 23,000 per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is the third loan for Samoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Samoern is going to use her portion to buy household supplies for her family to use. She hopes to have enough supplies for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for her family to use

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: Wilfreda is married with an only child, and she runs a general store for a living. She has been doing this for seven years, and she earns good money for the family. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy additional groceries to resell. Wilfreda plans to improve her business and expand it into the refreshment and snacks area to gain more returns for the better future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to resell.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Leap, 38 years old and from a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, is married with four children. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who raise pigs and sell grocery items. She can earn about KHR 27,000 per day to support her family. 

Leap has just been with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes to make more income and fatten her pigs to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sokchea is aged 50 years and married. To support her family, she and her husband have been farming rice for five years. The current business earns her family about 23,000 KHR per day to meet their needs. 

Sokchea has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she successfully used her past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting the field. She hopes to harvest on time.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting the field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 56-year-old widowed Palestinian refugee. She is a hard worker who puts so much effort for her income through developing her business as much as she can.

Maha is well-known in her region, with a wide and long experience in her domain. She is very skilled because she started this type of business early, since Palestinians have limited access to several working domains, and this kind of business is highly requested in her region and wasn't very expensive to establish long ago. 

Maha started her business from her house with one tailoring machine, and today, she has seven, which is a very important development. She has had to make sure to keep moving forward.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary fabrics to make sure that she can reply to the increasing customer needs before the coming Christmas celebrations.

She hopes that one day, she can open a tailoring factory where she can recruit someone to help her reply to the increasing customer requests.

loans.use: To buy necessary fabrics to make sure that she can reply to the increasing customer needs before the coming Christmas celebrations

loans.name: Mt Meru Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel, who is in his mid 30s, is single. He has been running a guesthouse business for six years now. He works from 10 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Emmanuel's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. He used the previous loans to pay electricity and water bills, pay the supporting staff in his guest house, build a few guest rooms and cover the cost of other business maintenance. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to cover his household expenses and reinvest back to help his business to grow. 

Emmanuel is now doing great with his business and he has been a part of Tujijenge since it's commencement. He dreams of taking an individual loan to meet his expectation of having a successfully business. Emmanuel will use this loan to renovate his guest house by painting, plumbing and undertaking other small repairs in order to attract more customers.

He will share this loan with his loan group 'Mt Meru', which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to renovate his guesthouse by painting, plumbing and undertaking other small repairs in order to attract more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale to increase her inventory levels

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe,  habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua es una mujer trabajadora que lucha a diario por el bienestar de la familia, en la actualidad está separada de su esposo, es  madre de tres hijos,   todos independientes aunque habitan con ella en su  casa, doña Guadalupe labora como conserje en una escuela pública. Ella solicito  un crédito anterior para realizar un muro perimetral en forma de L pero debido al alto costo de los materiales de construcción solamente pudo comprar una parte de los materiales por lo que no logro concretar la obra, ahora solicita un segundo crédito para comprar los materiales que le hace falta y continuar con su meta de realizar dicho muro que es tan importante para ella y sus hijos, así podrá evitar la presencia de delincuentes.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, an inhabitant of one of the outer neighbourhoods of Managua, is a hard-working woman who daily fights for the welfare of her family. She is currently separated from her husband. She has three children and they are all independent although they live with her. Guadalupe works as a caretaker at a public school. 

She requested the previous loan in order to build an L-shaped perimeter wall, but due to the high cost of building materials she was only able to purchase some of the materials and did not manage to build the wall. She is now requesting a second loan in order to purchase the materials she needs and continue with her goal of building said wall, which is very important for her and her children as it will deter delinquents.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, iron, gravel, and sand, and pay for labour

loans.name: Estrella Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos mayores  de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es maestro soldador.
Doña Estrella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella también los fines de semana instala un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende encebollados que le deja muy buenas ganancias. Ella lleva más de 4 años dedicada  a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y víveres para preparar los encebollados. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Su sueño es salir adelante
texts.en: The Credit Group "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood Abdón Calderón in Manta, a city known for its gorgeous all-year-round beaches, and its unrivaled beauty, with many tourist attractions. This is where Estrella, age 47, lives. She is in a common-law relationship, from which she has five grown children, although the youngest lives in her home. Her partner is a master welder. Estrella is a home-maker who, in order to obtain her own resources and help her spouse with the household expenses, works selling clothing from a catalog and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works three days a week from two to three hours a day. On weekends she also runs a small stand in her home where she sells seafood onion stew that brings in good profits. Estrella has been doing that work for four years and it is going very well. This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and supplies for the onion stew. She has been in the Credit Group for four years and she likes it because of the help the loans give her. Her dream is to move forward.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and supplies.

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Men is 47 years old and lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day but she can manage to save about 16,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Men has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her improve her standard of living. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Men is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a tailoring shop, where she makes new clothes and repairs torn clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy fabric, threads and other materials for making clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and other materials for making clothes

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with four children, and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of tailoring and has been in this business for 16 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material, an electric sewing machine and threads. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on a wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to own four electric sewing machines and also own a tailoring school. 

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the  family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material, an electric sewing machine and threads.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 47-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, daughter and mother in a small village of Bolnisi district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two pigs and a plot of agricultural land, where potatoes, maize and haricots are grown. They all work hard to ensure in a good harvest, which is sold locally at a good price. 

Makvala decided to expand her husbandry and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,000 GEL (Georgia lari) to purchase a cow and calves. She will start producing dairy products and sell them, as well as use them for the family. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and calves

loans.name: Walter De Jesús

texts.es:
Walter, a sus 45 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos, trabaja como mensajero en una empresa de nutrición y, de manera alterna, se dedica a vender productos nutricionales por catálogo, con el fin de generar un ingreso adicional; sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo, vecinos y familiares; lleva 5 meses realizando esta labor y hasta el momento le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (suplementos dietarios, malteadas, productos multivitamínicos, productos de aseo personal y para el hogar, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para suplir las necesidades de su clientela y aumentará las ventas que le generan mejores ingresos para su familia.
Walter expresa que su meta principal para un futuro cercano, es convertirse en un líder de ventas, pues así podrá generar mejores ingresos y estará en la capacidad de dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter is 45 years, married, and the father of two children. He works as a messenger at a nutrition company. He also works selling nutritional products from catalogs, with the goal of generating additional income. His main clients are his co-workers, neighbors, and family members. He has been doing this work for 5 months and so far he has had good results with it.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale price (dietary supplements, shakes, multivitamin products, personal hygiene products, and products for the home, among other things). This way he would be able to stock up enough to supply the needs of his clients and he will increase his sales, which generate improved income for his family.

Walter explains that his main goal for the near future is to become a leader in sales. This way he could generate a better income and he would have the ability to give his family a better level of well being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale price (dietary supplements, shakes, multivitamin products, personal hygiene products, and products for the home, among other things).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the coffee pickers and to weed her coffee farm.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita runs a cafeteria while her husband is working as a government employee. She has been selling assorted viand in the market for four years, earning a good living. She joined GDMPC recently and has taken out a new loan to buy raw ingredients for her cafeteria. She plans to improve her services and expand her business, as it is her only way to have a stable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, firewood, and locally-made ovens to boost her sales.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit and his family are engaged in animal husbandry. Davit lives with his wife and a son; his elder son is a migrant worker at a neighboring country who from time to time supports his family financially. 

Davit is a very hardworking and enthusiastic agronomist. He keeps livestock of cows, pigs and chickens. Near the house where Davit and his family live, Davit also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. The gathered meat and milk Davit sells to local re-sellers, and the gathered harvest from cultivation he sells in the open market. 

Davit perfectly manages to cover his family's daily needs, but for improving his farm, there is no money left. That's the reason why he has applied for this loan of $2,500. The loan will greatly assist Davit to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Davit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Davit hopes for lenders' trust and support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock

loans.name: Kajumba

texts.en:
Kajumba is a thirty-five-year old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa, which he sells to the factory in the vicinity, but he also buys from other farmers since his output is still low. Like most good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the University. He also wants to buy more land to expand his cocoa farm, despite the challenges of inadequate capital and prolonged rains.

Kajumba intends to use the loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as a motivated person. He operates a retail shop where he sells drinks and other items. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are local residents. 

Benson describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. He will use the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to add to his stock of drinks. He hopes that, in the future, he will live happily. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He repaid his previous loan of 20,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: add to his stock of drinks

loans.name: Ma. Caselyn

texts.en: Ma. Caselyn is a married woman and the mother of a four-year-old son from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than two years now. She sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her town. This is the source of her income. Ma. Caselyn is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients to use like flour, cassava, sugar, milk and other items. Through this loan, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods to the people in her area. In the future, Ma. Caselyn hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to use like flour, cassava, sugar, milk and other items

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 31 year old woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined and focused. She operates a retail store where she sells curtains, blankets, towels etc. 

She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low demand. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to add stock of curtains, blankets and towels. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 25000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to add stock of curtains, blankets and towels.

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Nget is a 60-year-old mother of six children. Rice farming has been the only source of income for her family to make a living for 30 years. She also sells desserts to supplement the family’s income. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Nget’s group consists of three members who live in the same village and she is in her seventh loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Nget will use her portion to harvest rice. She hopes to earn more crops from her paddy.

loans.use: to harvest rice

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is widowed with five children, and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She has been in this business for four years. She moves door to door, selling used clothes seven days out of every week, and mainly sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income from rental rooms.  

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of getting a permanent business premises, and also to become a wholesaler.  

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a 41-year-old married mother of two children who has been running her small convenience store since February 2011.

Pascal is a hard worker who supports her beloved husband in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs, especially their children's educations.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter season items that will fulfill customers' needs and requests.

She hopes that in the future, she will be capable of expanding her business to a wider supermarket that covers almost all of her customers' needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter season items

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is from the village of Toria. He is married with two school-age children. He also takes care of his retired mother. Gagik earns a living through agriculture. Specifically, he breeds two milk cows, one calf, and a pig. During grazing season, when his cows produce milk well, Gagik's wife makes cheese to sell as well as for family consumption. 

Now, Gagik is requesting a loan to start an auto repair shop in his house. With the received amount, he will buy all the needed tools and fix the cars on special projects. Gagik used to work as a hired car mechanic and has the proper experience in this field. Gagik will get a stable monthly income and improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy needed tools and start working as a car mechanic.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy stock to sell in her store, such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and additional wood for the renovation of her house. With this loan, she will be able to improve her store business and complete the renovation of her house.

In the future, Vilma has hopes of making her sari-sari business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and additional wood for the renovation of her house

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a single man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail store where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy town, and his primary customers are of all types. He will use the 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of shoes. His business goal is to open a bigger store within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will economically sustain his business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans of 80,000 KES and 50,000 KES were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of shoes

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is 53 years old and lives in the village of Dzimiti with her husband, grown son, daughter-in-law, mother-in-law and two grandchildren. The family runs an agricultural business and breeds cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Lamara grows maize, citrus and nut trees as well on her own plot of land. 

Their existing income is not enough for a family of seven. With this start-up loan, Lamara will purchase a truck, and her husband will work in a transportation business. He will carry and transport a variety of goods, depending on the needs and requests of his customers. For this season, Lamara’s husband will transport firewood from the forest and get a service fee. As he has the appropriate experience in this field, Lamara hopes their project will be successful and lucrative. Lamara would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a truck so her husband can transport a variety of goods.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a hardworking woman. She is married. Her husband, Akbar, is a kind person. Rano has 4 children who are all adults. She is also a grandmother. 

Rano has been busy with her own business. She has been selling thread in a local market for more than 20 years. She has her own selling place. She is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. From the profit, she will improve her living conditions.

Rano is requesting a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy thread. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy thread to increase working capital.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more coconut, bananas and other ingredients needed in her food stall. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more coconut, bananas and other ingredients needed in her food stall. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan dreams of being more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more coconut, bananas and other ingredients

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Bohol, a province in the Philippines. Esterlita and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than 15 years. She is also engaged in dried fish making and vending.

Esterlita needs a loan for their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to dry and sell.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for her boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more rice, yams, gari and other ingredients for the preparation of the food.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.  More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Her Direct Selling business is continuously running.

Nancy hopes to expand and have other sources of income. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen lives in the Kisii area of Nyanza. She is married and has five children and her family looks to her for their daily needs. She has been practicing farming for 18 years, where she produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, bananas and sugarcane in the local market. She enjoys farming since it is her main source of income. Her greatest challenge in farming is poor roads and the lack of good, reliable markets.

Mellen chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer their loans at a low interest rate, they help small income earners with their financial needs and they are very client friendly. This loan will help her purchase a dairy cow which will generate more income and hence help her in taking care of her family's needs and her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Haydie

texts.en:
Haydie is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a mother of six children. She and her husband are engaged in fishing to support the needs of their children. This is the source of her income. 
Haydie is asking for a loan to buy crab traps, nylon, paint, and fish hooks. With this, they will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish and crabs to sell at the market.
In the future, Haydie hopes of continuing her business even more successfully.

loans.use: to buy crab traps, nylon, paint, and fish hooks

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a  farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of five grown children. Erlinda has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. She is also involved in a retail store business. These are the sources of her income.
Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and additional goods for her store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the yield at her farm and profit from her store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional goods for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 40-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband is a tailor by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past 13 years, in addition to the profession of tailoring, he also has driven a taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Samina has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount needed to repair the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit her husband wants to open a new tailoring shop in the future. She prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business . She is very much thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay for repairing their taxi.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is married and has three children.  She operates her own retail business to make a living. Her husband operates a motorcycle taxi service in their village. She had joined GDMPC and had borrowed a new loan to buy rice and other groceries to sell. She wants to become successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Winifreda

texts.en:
Winifreda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her ready-to-wear clothing business. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from business is used to assist in their everyday household expenditures. As a widow, she is working hard to provide for her family. She also has a videoke rental for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan for her to buy ready-to-wear clothing and other merchandise to increase her business inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Winifreda dreams that all her businesses will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies with her group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear clothing and other merchandise to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maura hopes that her variety store will become a grocery store and dreams that her family will be able to have a vacation. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Christ The King Group

texts.en:
Josinta is a twenty-seven-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the hotel business for four years and also owns a retail shop of mattresses and bedsheets as her side income. She started this business with hopes of getting income to look after her family and educate her children. Her challenges are high rent and license fees.Her future plan is to buy land for construction and pay school fees for her children to attain degrees. She is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan and that is why they are 14 members even when one is not taking the credit facility but had to appear in the photo as the group policy requires.

Josinta intends to use the loan to buy mattresses and bed sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy mattresses and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is from the village of Antonino. He is 39 years of age and is married to Romajane. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with two children. To make a living, Alexander is engaged in the furniture-making business. He has been running this business for six years and has been able to earn a net income of PHP 4,500 a month. At this moment, Alexander is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase raw materials to improve his finished furniture products to sell. He knows that his requested loan has something to do with the increase in his income, so he is hoping for approval of his requested loan to make his furniture business profitable and productive someday.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make furntiure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mixed goods like cooking oil, sodas and many other items for his shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more eggs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more eggs needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes to have her own stall and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more eggs needed in her business.

loans.name: Bekzod

texts.ru: Бекзод добродушный и жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 24 лет. Он женат и живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход для удовлетворения имеющихся нужд семьи, Бекзод занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается дехканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Бекзод занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Бекзод хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Бекзод заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bekzod is a kind-hearted, cheerful 24-year-old who is married and lives with his family in a small village. To earn money for his family, Bekzod grows crops and raises livestock. He has a plot of land, naturally irrigated in some parts and artificially in others, which he uses to grow carrots, potatoes and grain crops. His wife helps him tend to their cattle, who typically graze on their land as it's large enough to do so.

Raising livestock allows Bekzod to earn a decent living, and he hopes to expand his farming operations by buying more cattle. As such, he's turned to Arvand for a loan to buy cattle, and would like to thank them in advance for their support.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: M. Ashiq

texts.en:
M. Ashiq is a 60-year-old man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a small crockery store, in which he sells utensils and crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons and buckets.
 
M. Ashiq is a father of seven children and is the only responsible person, who has to feed them. He has only one source of income and he has to pay the utility bills and household expenses by himself. The condition of his house is not up to the mark according to the living standards.

M. Ashiq wants to buy more inventories to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in a large quantity for making a dowry. For this purpose, more inventories are required to cope with the sudden increase in the demand.

M. Ashiq requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy utensil and crockery items and generate more income. M. Ashiq is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed him a beam of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: To buy crockery and utensils to sell.

loans.name: Sabelita

texts.en:
Sabelita previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy toys and accessories needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of toys, accessories and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sabelita dreams of being more successful in business and hopes that her family will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for toys and accessories needed for her business.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is a married woman and the mother of nine children. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in retail sales of cosmetics products, such as make-up, perfume and lotions. Desideria is also engaged in a rice farming business with her husband.

Desideria is asking for a loan to buy more fertilizer for the farm and to buy more products for her cosmetics business, such as perfumes and lotions. With this loan, she will be able to sell more products to her customers and improve the productivity of her farm as well.  In the future, Desideria hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for the farm and more products for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
Dorcy is thankful for the financial assistance, from her last loan,extended to her as she was able to buy the materials needed in her business. Her business has been running for eight years now. Her income from this business is assisting to pay for her family's everyday household expenditures. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy fabric, thread and other materials needed. Her profits will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dorcy hopes to have more customers and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Om Mokhtar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Mokhtar which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking women and try their best to improve their living standards.

Taisir is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is an employee getting a low salary. She is a hardworking woman who tries her best to assist her husband in covering the household expenses. Her husband owns a broken down taxi and unfortunately his income is not enough to repair it. So, Taisir decided to apply for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to assist her husband to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi. Taisir dreams of a prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to assist her husband to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de FIYELE commune de WACORO préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’arachide, des céréales, des tubercules et des beignets.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
La cliente KOROTIMI la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche est vendeuse de beignet. Elle compte acheter 25kg d’haricot qui sera transformé en beignet. La vente se fait au marché et aussi à la maison à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte faire un bénéfice mensuel de 5000F qui sera injecté dans l’élevage.
texts.en:
Group Djefako is composed of married women. They are on average 32 years old with five children, and live in traditional extended families in the village of Fiyele, Wacoro township, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came together through family, neighbor, or friend relationships. They sell ground nuts, cereals, root vegetables and fried dough.
The women of group Djefako are on their second solidarity loan.
Borrower Korotimi, the second person from the left, sells fried dough. She is planning on purchasing 25 kilos of beans to be turned into fried dough. Sales take place at the market and at home, to a mixed-gender clientele. She is counting on a monthly profit of 5,000 XOF, to be invested in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy beans to make fried dough.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida de 50 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo, mayor de edad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Esta mujer se ha caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligadas a trabajar dese temprana edad. 
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosmético como rubor, sombra de ojos, lapiz labial, cremas corporale,perfumes, antiojera, desmaquilladoras, lapiz de ojos. de forma ambulante y por encargo. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, todos los días recorre la calle con un peso de unos 10 kg ofreciendo sus productos, a clientes fijos y eventuales para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cosméticos. Cándida agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cándida is a 50-year old woman, who is single and has one adult son. She's originally from Sauce, located in the north of the region. She's a hard-working and responsible woman, and has a strong willingness of self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, she could not attend university and had to start working when she was very young.

Thanks to her hard work and willingness to get ahead, she works selling cosmetics, such as blusher, eye shadow, lipstick, body lotion, perfume and eye concealer. She sells in the street and taking orders. She spends 10 hours daily working and walks the street every day carrying a weight of 10kg. She offers her products to regular and occasional clients with an aim to obtain better income in the near future. 

She plans to invest the loan in working capital and to stock up on cosmetics. Cándida is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up on cosmetics, such as blusher, eye shadow, lipstick, body lotion, perfume, eye concealer, make-up remover and eyeliner.

loans.name: Emaran Desire

texts.fr: emaran est une homme de 49 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. il vend des vivres secs (plantains, riz, haricot, maïs, arachide) dans un quartier de la ville depuis 8 ans. il sollicite le crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant 20 sacs de denrées alimentaires (vivre secs) afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, renforcer son activité et augmenter ses ventes/bénéfices. les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre de réinvestir dans son activité et améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emaran, age 49, is married and the father of three children. He's been selling dried food (plantains, rice, beans, maize, peanuts) in one of the city's neighborhoods for the past eight years.

He's seeking this loan to bolster his stock of products, by buying 20 sacks of dried food products, in order to meet customer demand, strengthen his business and increase his sales and profits.

His profits will enable him to reinvest in his business and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy eight bunches of bananas, five nets of pistachos, some maize, couscous, yams, njasang seeds and macabo.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase accessories and materials like lawn edging, brick, gravel and other materials. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy accessories and materials like lawn edging, brick, gravel and other materials. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams to have more customers and hopes to have another sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for accessories and materials like lawn edging, brick, gravel and other materials.

loans.name: Soso

texts.en: Soso is 29 years old and is a married man, from Batumi city. He lives with his wife and 2 kindergarten-aged daughters. The only employed person in the family is Soso, who works as an electric-welder and earns 580 GEL monthly. He has just started another activity: trading iron items. He has opened a metal shop and gets private orders. Soso has rented a place in an auto station, where he sells his items. His plan now is to continue to work on his business and to make it grow. Soso applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of their Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $3000 will help him to purchase materials and get more orders. This will be great support for this hard-working man, enabling him to increase his income significantly and provide a better future for his family. Soso awaits yours goodwill.

loans.use: To purchase materials for him to make more metal items

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr: Anne est une femme, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle vend des vivres secs (arachides) dans un marché de la ville depuis 6 ans. Dynamique, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant 1 sac d'arachide afin de diversifier son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses profits.les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre agrandir son point de vente et de relever le niveau de vie de sa famille (nutrition, éducation, santé)
texts.en:
Anne is married and the mother of four children. She's been selling dried food (peanuts) in one of the city's markets for the past six years.

She's energetic and she's seeking this loan to bolster her stock of products, by buying one sack of peanuts, in order to diversify her business and increase her turnover and her profits.

These profits will enable her to expand her point of sale and increase the standard of living of her family (food, education, healthcare).

loans.use: to buy dried food

loans.name: Dilshad Group

texts.en:
Dilshad, a 41-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and two daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Dilshad is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Dilshad is a member of a two-person group and has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the  region of Jinja Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Hamisi has been working hard to manage her salon, which deals in hair plaiting, weaving, and retouch. 

To help expand her business, Hamisi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve on the salon and buy more weaving hair, and retouch oil for the hair and will help Hamisi to generate greater profits and educate her children. Hamisi hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the salon. 

Hamisi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hamisi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve on the salon and buy more weaving hair, and retouch oil for the hair

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 55-year-old married man. He has six children. He describes himself as a stable person. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk that he sells.

He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area fit for the business. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes which affect milk production. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy animal feed for his dairy cows to use during the dry season. His business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 50-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a restaurant where she sells drinks and food. 

She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add a stock of drinks and ingredients for making food. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To add a stock of drinks and ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bitter ball and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil, salt and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of soft drinks, biscuits, Milo, milk, and sweets, credit cards and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 40-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells bread, sugar, washing soap, drinks and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. 

Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add a stock of drinks, bread, milk, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to add a stock of drinks, bread, milk, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 39-year-old married lady. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching clothes. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is facing difficulty in fulfilling her customers’ demands. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new stitching machine and spools of threads in different colors. It will allow her to stitch more dresses on time and generate a healthier source of income. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine and spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 40-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as honest, focused and determined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for 15 years.

Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low demand. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy beauty products to use in her salon. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start up another business.

loans.use: buy beauty products to use in her salon.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. 

She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only.
