Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her. She aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to owning a delivery van to ease transportation.  

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes medication, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr:
Ndella est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 filles

elle fait partie des femmes fondatrices de son banc villageois et a une bonne expérience du crédit 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle s'approvisionne au marché de sa capitale régionale en bétail avec l'aide du mari. Ainsi elle achète un boeuf à 300 000 frs et 08 moutons à 40 000 frs l'unité. Le reste du prêt est utilisé en fond de roulement. Elle engraisse avec 30 000 frs pendant 04 mois et revend le boeuf à 450 000 frs et les moutons à 80 000 frs l'unité.

Les bénéfices récoltés de l'activité lui servent à renforcer ses épargnes, payer les intérêts du prêt et à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en nourriture et d'assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ndella, age 44, is married and the mother of nine children, including four girls. She's a founding member of her Banc Villageois and has a good experience with loans.

With her new loan, she gets livestock supplies at the regional capital's market, with help from her husband. She buys an ox for XOF 300'000 and eight sheep for XOF 40'000 each. The remainder of the loan is used as working capital.

She fattens the animals for four months, which costs her XOF 30'000. She resells the ox for XOF 450'00 and the sheep for XOF 80'000 each.

She uses her profits to bolster her savings, repay the loan, and improve her family's standard of living and food conditions, and cover her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy one ox and eight sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Santos Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Santos Francisca de 36  años de edad es  Soltera,  tiene dos  hijos  que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Santos Francisca  se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta de charamuscas, jugos naturales y costura de vestidos, faldas, pantalones de uniforme, sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención.
Doña Francisca se levanta muy temprano a ordeñar sus vacas para luego vender la leche y luego se pone a costurar. 
Doña Francisca está solicitando el préstamo para gastos de mejora de vivienda ya que desea instalar las puertas y balcones y quiere comprar cemento, arena, y grava. Está muy contenta  de seguir trabajando con Prisma ya que gracias a sus préstamos ha mejorado  su  calidad de vida.
 Doña Francisca su sueño es mejorar su casa y con el apoyo de este préstamo desea mejorar su casa y así tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Santos Francisca is 36 years old and single. She has two children who depend on her. She has her own home located in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.

Santos Francisca has worked for 6 years selling charamuscas, fresh juices, and sewing dresses, skirts, and uniform pants. Her customers prefer her because she provides good service. Francisca gets up very early to milk her cows to later sell the milk. Then she starts to sew. 

Francisca is asking for the loan to pay for home improvements. She wants to put in doors and balconies and to do that she wants to buy cement, sand and gravel. She is very happy to keep working with Prisma, since thanks to their loans her quality of life has improved.   

Francisca's dream is to improve her house and with the help of this loan she hopes to do that and thus have a better quality of life for her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2013.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel for her house.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a married woman and a mother of four children from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in selling snack foods to the people in her area such as kakanin among others. Kakanin is made of glutinous rice, sugar, milk and other ingredients. 

As of now, Anastacia is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for making rice cakes, including glutinous rice, sugar and milk. With this, she will be able to cook more snack foods that she can then sell to her customers. In the future, Anastacia hopes to make her business a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making rice cakes such as glutinous rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie, age 54, who is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Elvie dreams of expanding her business into a grocery store. She hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Asima Gulistan

texts.en:
Asima gulistan is a 36-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, a daughter and a son in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2010, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife, Asima gulistan, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Asima gulistan and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To buy items for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 44-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health care, clothing and education. She has been operating a business of making artificial flowers for the past seven years. She offers various handmade artificial flowers in different colors, which are used for decorating homes and rooms. She has become well-known for providing good quality colorful flowers in her community. In order to meet the orders of her customers, she needs to purchase raw materials such as silk cloth material, glace paper and tissue paper along with packs of glues and wires. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000.  In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silk cloth material, glace paper and tissue paper along with packs of glues and wires.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda, age 53, has had a difficult time after her husband’s death. She decided to work to support her family for a better future. She started stitching clothes in her house. Rasheeda stitches for the people who live near her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, Rasheeda contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. She intends to use this loan to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors. This will allow Rasheeda to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen has been saving money for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband. However, when the time came to purchase the item, money became short. Therefore, she has requested a loan so that he can buy a new rickshaw for her husband's business. She had received a loan in past but she could not buy a rickshaw for her husband due to household expenses. This time, she will successfully buy the new rickshaw with the contribution of her previous savings.

Shaheen is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She hopes that this time her husband can easily generate sufficient income to cherish his children and promises to pay all the installments on time. She is very happy and grateful after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Victor Cruz

texts.es:
Victor vive en al ciudad de Aguaytia, trabaja como empleado de seguridad en una institución de su ciudad, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar una maquina mezcladora de cemento, la cual alquila a los albañiles de la zona y puede tener un dinero extra para los gastos del hogar y salir adelante.

 Victor está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Victor lives in the city of Aguaytia. He works as a security employee at an institution in his city. With a lot of effort, he was also able to buy a cement mixer which he rents out to bricklayers in the area so he can have extra money for household expenses and get ahead. 

Victor is grateful for the Kiva loans, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy construction materials to be able to do home improvements and in this way obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es: Verónica de 25 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad. Verónica se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo y además  vende fruta fresca en su lugar de residencia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño lavable ya que el que tiene se arruino y es necesario construir uno nuevo. Con el monto del crédito comprará ladrillo, arena, y cemento.
texts.en: Verónica is 25 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and her one year old son. Verónica has sold tortillas as well as fresh fruit from her house for a long time. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a bathroom, because the one she has was ruined and she needs to build a new one. With the money from the loan, she will buy bricks, sand and cement.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and cement to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Blanca Deicy

texts.es: Blanca de 44 años de edad es casada y habita junto a sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y le colaboran con la economía del hogar.  Blanca se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo desde hace 4 años. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado junto a su esposo construir su vivienda la cual es su principal patrimonio y futura herencia  para sus hijos. Para terminar las mejoras de su vivienda solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y pintura para repellar y pintar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 44 years old, married and lives with her children, who are now adults and support the household economy.  Blanca has been making a living selling beauty products from catalogues for four years.  Alongside her husband and with a lot of effort, Blanca has managed to build a home.  This is one of her biggest assets and will be part of the inheritance she leaves for her children.  In order to finish the improvements to her home, Blanca is applying for a loan from FUSAI so as to buy cement, sand and paint in order to plaster and paint the walls of her home.
º

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and paint in order to plaster and paint the walls of her home.

loans.name: Mayra Yesenia

texts.es: Mayra de 22 años de edad reside junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo en casa propia. Mayra se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos desde hace 6 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes que cada día lo profieren más. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para construir un muro de retención ya que su terreno es muy vulnerable a las aguas lluvias y desea proteger a su familia y su vivienda lo cual es su principal patrimonio. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro.
texts.en: Mayra is 22 years old and lives with her partner and young son in a house that she owns.  Mayra has been making a living selling traditional snacks for six years and so now has a good group of regular customers who prefer Mayra's food over others'.   Mayra is applying for this loan from FUSAI in order to build a retaining wall, as her house is at risk of being damaged by rainwater.  Mayra wants to protect her family and her house, as this is all she has to her name.  With this loan, Mayra will buy cement, bricks, sand and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and iron in order to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Nominchimeg

texts.en:
Nominchimeg is a bachelor's/master's student who studies at a public university in business administration. If she did not get this loan, she would stay out for a year. 

Her short term goal is to graduate her university successfully and get a job. She was so happy for the Kiva loan, helping to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 36-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids; three sons and two daughters. Omar works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He opened a small grocery store three years ago, he works in it after his job. Omar would like to improve his project since it is a very profitable one. 

Omar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store. By taking this loan, Omar will be able to put more fruits and vegetables in his store. 

Omar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one kid in a simple house in the city. Osama works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He opened a small grocery store eight years ago, he works in it after his job. Osama would like to improve his project since it is a very profitable one. 

Osama took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products like suger, rice and wheat to resell in his grocery store. By taking this loan, Osama will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Osama appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like suger, rice and wheat to resell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Magole 'b' Group

texts.en:
Lucas, who is in his early 40's, is married with four children who are still going to school  He has been running a business selling fruits and vegetables for five years now.  He works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Lucas' third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy the out-of-stock items in his business. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, built a small house and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables. He dreams of buying a truck so that he is able to deliver his products to his customers. 

Lucas will share this loan with his loan group "Magole B'" which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Abdel Azeez

texts.en:
Abdel Azeez is a 24-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Abdel opened a small grocery store two years ago. Abdel would like to improve his project since it is a very profitable one. 

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat to resell in his grocery store. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a farmer living in Eldoret on the north Rift side of Kenya. He is married and has five children all of whom are of school-going age. He has been in farming for 12 years and he produces and sells milk, vegetables, maize and also does fish farming.

Christopher chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give asset finances which helps farmers to build themselves up economically. Through the training received from the loan officers, he learnt how to keep proper records. His highest expense is school fees. With this loan, he will start to keep rabbits, which will boost his income and thus help him meet his children's school fees as well as improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to start keeping rabbits.

loans.name: Blanca Magdalena

texts.es: Blanca de 36 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace 4 años de edad y de esta forma colabora con la economía de su hogar. Junto a su esposo llevan el sustento diario a sus hijos y hace todo lo que esté a su alcance para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la  reparación del corredor ya que actualmente está cubierto de plástico y se encuentra deteriorado por lo que con el monto del crédito comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old Blanca lives in her own house with her husband and two children, aged 17 and 12 years old each. Blanca has been making a living as a domestic servant for four years and, with this work, she is able to contribute to the household economy. Blanca and her husband are able to support heir children and they do everything they can to provide them with better living conditions.  Blanca is applying for this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in repairing the hall in her house, which is currently covered only with plastic.  The hall is in a bad condition and so this loan will be used to buy galvanized laminate sheeting and wood.

loans.use: to buy galvanised laminate sheeting and wood to replace the plastic which is currently serving as a roof in the hall in her home.

loans.name: Julia Idalia

texts.es: Julia de 61 años de edad habita en casa muy humilde junto a su compañera de vida.  Ella tiene una pequeña tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer en su casa de habitación. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la ampliación de su humilde vivienda con la construcción de un cuarto para cocina ya que no tiene un lugar adecuado para la misma. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento y arena para construir el cuarto para la cocina.
texts.en: 61 year old Julia lives in a very humble house with her partner. She has a small store that, with much effort, she has established in a room of her house.  She is requesting this loan from FUSAI with the goal of improving her living conditions. She will increase her humble home by building a room for a kitchen as she doesn't have an adequate place for this. She will use this loan to buy galvanized sheets, wood, cement, and sand to build a room for a kitchen.

loans.use: To buy galvanized sheets, wood, cement, and sand to build a room for a kitchen.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 37-year-old married father of two children. He has been working in repairing the body of cars for eighteen years. In 2006, he established his current business, which is doing just fine but is considerably low income. His family's increasing educational and living needs made him think of starting another business.

Rani is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a small van, which he will use to gain additional income through providing transportation services.

He hopes that in the future he can establish a car selling showroom.

loans.use: to buy a small van which he will use to gain additional income through providing transportation services.

loans.name: Rosamie

texts.en:
Rosamie is 24 years old, married, and a resident of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living through fishing. Fishing is the only livelihood the family has to sustain the needs of everyone.

Rosamie has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for six years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fishing tools and purchase materials for house repair.

Rosamie deeply wishes to continue as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Mariatu. She is single but has a seven-year-old child. In 1998, Mariatu established her commercial used clothes business. She began her business because she wanted to be self sufficient and to adequately cater for her child’s needs. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to buy bales of girdles, tights and blouses. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her profit margin. In the future, Mariatu plans to establish an outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of girdles, tights and blouses.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
María vivía en el Departamento de Caldas, allí trabajaba con su padre en la finca pero, hace 5 años tomó la decisión de trasladarse para otra ciudad, en busca de nuevas oportunidades para salir adelante, luego de radicarse, comenzó a trabajar como vendedora de minutos a celular de manera ambulante y un año después, se le presentó la oportunidad de abrir un pequeño local en el que hoy en día ofrece todo lo relacionado con equipos de telefonía móvil como accesorios, minutos, reparación, venta de sim cards, entre otros, trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:30 am a 7:30 pm y cuenta con la  ventaja de estar en un local bien ubicado y de manejar su propio tiempo. 
Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido de mercancía al por mayor (protectores de pantalla, cargadores, carcasas, auriculares, equipos celulares, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada decembrina, aumentando sus ventas y por ende las utilidades que percibe.
Con esta labor, trabajando con empeño, disciplina y dedicación, María desea en un futuro cercano poder cumplir el sueño de fortalecer y posicionar su negocio en el mercado, para que le permita adquirir su casa propia; dándole la oportunidad de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en:
María lives in the Department of Caldas, where she used to work on the farm with her father. Five years ago, she made the decision to move to another town in search of new opportunities to get ahead. After moving, she began work selling cell phone minutes door to door and, one year later, she had the opportunity to open a small sore in which she now sells everything to do with cell phones such as accessories, minutes, repairs, sim cards, and other things. She works Monday to Saturday 7:30am to 7:30pm and has the advantage of being in a store that is well located and of being able to manage her own time. 
She is requesting the support of a loan to supply her store wholesale (buying screen protectors, chargers, cases, headphones, handsets, and other things). In this way, she will be able to stock-up and satisfy the extra demand that she gets in the month of December, increasing her sales and, therefore, her income. 
With this labor, working with persistence, discipline, and dedication, in the near future, María wants to be able to complete her dream of strengthening and positioning her business in the market and to get her own home. This would give her the opportunity to enjoy a better quality of live with her husband.

loans.use: to stock-up on merchandise wholesale (screen protectors, chargers, cases, headphones, handsets, among others).

loans.name: Adrian Santos

texts.es:
Don Adrian es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y su nieto. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 6 años así como también se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos.
Don Adrian su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad al sur de Honduras y es muy visitado y conocido por los vecinos de su comunidad, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser: maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, etc. así como a  la compra de cerdos, etc. 
Don Adrian necesita el préstamo para surtir más de producto su negocio y comprar arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, café, huevos queso, manteca, etc.  espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos.
Don Adrian de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. El espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia para cumplir las metas y sueños.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Adrian is a very strong and honest person. He lives in a community in the south of Honduras along with his wife and grandson. His business is a grocery store and he has had it for 6 years, and he also works buying and selling pigs.
Adrian's business is located in a community in the south of Honduras and it is well known and utilized by his neighbors in the community. He is requesting a loan to buy more products such as: corn, lard, eggs, cheese, sodas, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juice, etc, as well as to buy pigs. 
Adrian needs the loan to better supply his store and to buy rice, sugar, lard, beans, coffee, eggs, cheese, lard, etc. He hopes that the loan will be a great help as, thanks to the loan, he will have the supplies he needs to meet demand from his customers and provide what they need.  
Adrian hopes to increase his sales and, as a result, to generate more income that will benefit his family's quality of life at home. He hopes to grow his business and continue supporting his family to achieve their goals and dreams.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lard, cheese, sodas, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, and juices for his business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 45-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business with her husband for many years. Bushra has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth previously accessed a 30,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Elizabeth would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better! More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes that her business will last long and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ani Fe

texts.en:
Ani Fe is 33 years old, married and lives in Plaridel on the island of Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. To earn a living she has been raising pigs for five years, enabling her to provide educational and financial support for her child. 
Ani Fe has been a member of Paglaum MPC from 2009 until the present. She had a previous loan from the institution and promptly made her repayments. Because of her current situation, she has asked the PMPC for another loan to the amount of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more pigs. Indeed, PMPC has granted it and Ani Fe is very thankful.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is a 26-year-old young man who lives in the village of Mukhaestate, Kobuleti District. He lives with his wife, mother and 1-year-old daughter. His wife and mother are housekeepers and Archil's work is the only source of income for the family. He is an artisan and works at a plastic factory. Archil gets private orders and monthly generates 400 laris (GEL). However, his income isn't enough to meet the basic needs of the family and he decided to start another activity parallel to his nowadays work.

Archil applied for credit to Micro Finance Organization Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva permitting the rural poor to start or restart businesses. A loan of $4,000 will help him to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them intercity.

Archil is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his family has good living conditions. This credit will be a great support for the family. Archil is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie has been involved in the agricultural business for 12 years. He grows corn and rice crops within his locality. He sells his crops to the grain dealers located near his place of residence. He helps cover family expenses with the profits he earns from his sales. 

Louie would like to request a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and seeds. He knows that the complete application of farm inputs to his farm land will enable him to obtain a plentiful harvest and better income this next crop season.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and seeds used for farming.

loans.name: Bernarda Alicia

texts.es: Bernarda se dedica a la venta de variedad de prendas de vestir desde hace mucho tiempo. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Tiene 62 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija. Desea ampliar su negocio por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa nueva como faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y así poder aumentar las ventas y por consecuencias sus ingresos.
texts.en: Bernada works selling a variety of clothing and has done this for a long time. She sells door to door and this business is her main source of income. She is 62 years old and lives in her own home along with her daughter. She wants to grow her business, so she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a variety of clothing such as skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc. She hopes to be able to access this loan and so to be able to increase her sales and, as a result, her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new clothes such as skirts, dresses, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 13 años, 12 años y 5 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Manuel se dedica a la venta de variedad de zapatos para dama, caballeros y niños. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la zona donde habita y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de ampliar su negocio ya que ha notado un aumento en las ventas y desea aprovechar esta temporada navideña y fin de año que es cuando las ventas tienden a crecer. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de zapatos y sandalias, de esta forma espera mejorar sus ingresos y así dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: 32 year old Manuel lives in his own house along with his partner and their 3 children who are 13, 12, and 5 years old and who all study at the local public schools. Manuel works selling a variety of shoes for women, men, and children. His business is located in the market in the area where they live. This is how he earns a living and supports his family. He has decided to grow his business as he has seen an increase in sales and wants to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year season which is when his sales tend to increase. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a variety of shoes and sandals. He hopes to increase his income and, consequently, to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda manages a retail store business in their village. She started it with a small stall twenty-seven years ago and she is happy because she is able to expand her business site. With her business, she is capable of providing her children's school allowances.

Due to insufficient funds, Imelda wishes for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy beverages, breads and food seasonings. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow to reach her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads and food seasonings

location.town: San Pedro, San Pablo, aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronnie is a highly experienced farmer. He has been involved in growing crops, which is the most profitable business in his village. He has been doing this kind of business for 12 years. Ronnie is certain that his success relies on his hard work and initiative.

He aims to have continuous growth of his farming business, so that's why Ronnie is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP.  The amount he requested will be used in buying fertilizer and pesticides to improve his crop production. Ronnie would be grateful enough if his loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farming business

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 37-year-old married woman. She is very talented and excels in her work of stitching clothes. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers, and lace in various colors. 

In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Noor hopes to grow her business, and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase thread, along with the packs of buttons, zippers, and lace in various colors.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years; he sells seasonal, fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheeled manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop in a good manner.

His children are young but growing, as are their needs as well. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business, but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk. Therefore, Kishwar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is a single entrepreneur who manages her own general store for a living. She sells different kinds of grocery goods in their village. Her earnings allow her to provide for the needs of her only child. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her business to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Abdulaziz Group

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is a group of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are applying for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Asmhan is a 32-year-old married woman who has children. She lives with her family, which struggles financially. Her husband works hard to provide his family with food and clothing. Although he is employed, he earns a low salary that is not enough to cover household expenses. Asmhan tries her best to raise her children well.

She and her family live in an old house, which she wants to refurbish. The savings from her husband's income is not enough to cover the cost of construction supplies. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from AMB to buy building materials, including sand, wood, and cement. With this loan, she hopes to be able to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials, including sand, wood, and cement.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 36-year-old married woman and she has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a business where she rents houses to customers and they pay a monthly fee. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand her business.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy materials to repair and maintain her rental houses. Her business goal is to build more rental houses in another place within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will purchase land and build more houses and also educate her children to give them a good life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair and maintain her rental houses

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is the age of 30. She is the mother of three children. Her daughters are married and living in their homes happily. Her husband supports the whole family; he is responsible for all expenses and utility bills. He is a hardworking and zealous young man. He owns a general store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Rozina wants to buy more inventory for the general store so her husband can generate more income. He will buy stock such as pulses, flour, sugar, biscuits, rice, etc. Therefore, Rozina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Rozina thanks Kiva and hopes the lenders will support her.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a general store.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.en:
Bunafsha was born in the year 1981. She is divorced and does not have any children. She lives with her mother in the capital of Tajikistan.

Bunafsha has a special education. She is a sewer with enough experience and has been busy with sewing women's national dresses for more than 5 years. She sews dresses in her house. Bunafsha has her regular clients.

She wants to develop her business, so Bunafsha is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine. In this way her service will be of more quality. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en:
Elnara is 32 years old. She is single and lives with her parents; they live in the Abseron region. Her father is a bus driver and her mother doesn’t work. She helps Elnara in her business. 

Elnara is a confectioner. She bakes pies, biscuits, etc.. sells them to markets to earn money. She also bakes birthday cakes by order. 

Today Elnara needs to increase her business, and therefore she has applied to Komak company for a loan of 700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

With this loan she wants to buy more products which are useful in her business. 

Elnara says thank you to Kiva and Kiva lenders for help. In the future she wants to open a pastry shop.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 26-year-old married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with the packs of lace, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her second  loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 34-year-old woman; she describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells handbags and clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years.

Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances and changes in fashion.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to add a stock of handbags and clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business and be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. 

She will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of handbags and clothes

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been doing business selling milk, with the support of her husband, for many years. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. 

This will help her increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Bande Maataram Shg Group

texts.en:
The Bande Maataram SHG self-help group is composed of 14 members, all of them women. All the members of this group are engaged in different activities, like vegetable selling, betel leaf selling, flowers selling, etc., to support their families. All the women from this group help and support each other, and all are dedicated to make more money so they will be able to better support their families.

The president of the group is Padmini, who is 35 years old and has three children, ages 4, 6 and 11 years old. In the picture, the lady standing in a yellow sari with a raised hand is Padmini. She sells meals from her sales post located in a local market. Her loan is destined to buy supplies wholesale, like groceries, oil and vegetables, in order to prepare her meals. Padmini is a very hardworking woman who has worked in this field for many years. Her husband is a farmer and he helps Padmini in her business.

Padmini is grateful to the institution for its support, as this is her only way to support her family. She is also happy for the other members of the group as, in many cases, they support their families by themselves.

loans.use: To purchase supplies wholesale, like groceries, oil, spices and vegetables, in order to prepare meals for her food stall.

loans.name: Benna

texts.en:
Benna is a 46-year-old farmer living in Eldoret in North Rift, Kenya. She is married and has seven children who are still in school. She has been farming for the past 23 years, producing milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She enjoys farming, as the income from farming has been sustaining her family. Her major challenges in farming are pests and diseases.

Benna chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because she loved the training she received from the loan officers before taking out the loan. She learnt that when she takes out a loan for a particular use, she should not divert the funds to other things. Her highest expense is school fees; therefore, with this loan, she will add more poultry and this will lead to more profit and she will cover her children's school fees. Her family will also be assured of food security.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 25-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Abdallah opened a small grocery store seven years ago. He would like to improve his project since it is a very profitable one. 

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Abdallah appears in the photo in his store

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of five. 

She has been selling milk for many years with the support of her husband. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time her sales have increased and also her income. Now she has three buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids, two sons and two daughters,  in a simple house in the city. Shadi opened a small grocery store six years ago. He would like to improve his project since it is a very profitable one. 

Shadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store. By taking out this loan, Shadi will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Shadi appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a  married man and a father of seven children. They live in San Miguel, Bohol. Rafael is a farmer. He grows rice in his farm. This is the source of his income.

Rafael is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm thus augmenting his yield and income.  In the future, Rafael has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 38-year-old married woman, living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband drives a van in Lahore city, providing transportation services to passengers from one stop to another. Due to continuous work most of the parts of his van have depreciated and urgently need to be replaced with new ones.

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan which is the field partner of Kiva. Nasreen hopes that through this amount her husband will be able to buy the spare parts so he can drive it again. 

Nasreen belongs to a poor family; her husband is the only earning person and does not have any other source of income. Now Nasreen seems very glad; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: For the replacement of depreciated parts of their van.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is a taxi driver. He is married and has three children. Parviz and his family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Qubadli city and now live in the Abseron region. His wife doesn’t work in business; she is housewife and takes care of her children. All of the children are juveniles. 

It was noted that Parviz is a taxi driver. Winter is coming, and he needs a loan amount of 700 AZN (Azerbaijan New  Manat) to buy winter wheels for his car. For this reason he has applied to Komak company. Parviz is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for aid. In the future, he wants to repair the car’s interior.

loans.use: to buy winter wheels

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura is a young and purposeful woman. She is married and has two children. Mashhura has been working for more than one year in a café as a cleaning woman. Mashhura lives poorly because her husband does not have a job and her salary is small. She brings home leftovers from the café every day to feed her children. 

Mashhura has some savings. She wants to buy a car so her husband can start a taxi service, but she does not have enough money. Mashhura is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy a car for her husband’s business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a car so her husband can start a taxi service.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a woman who always tries to educate Tajik people. She is a smart and highly educated person. She has a pedagogical education. Jamila has worked in a school for more than 22 years. She teaches the Russian language and Russian literature. Jamila is married and has 3 children. She is a careful mother and always wants to provide her children with good living conditions. She wants to buy a TV set for her children but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy a TV set. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy TV set for her household.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Mercedes would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like bananas, pork, chicken and chicken parts needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedes hopes to have her own place of business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like bananas, pork, chicken and chicken parts needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladis Carolina

texts.es: Gladis de  22 años de edad reside junto a su grupo familiar conformado por su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad quien ya comenzó su primer año de estudio en la escuela de su localidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa nueva en el mercado de su municipio. Normalmente, en esta temporada navideña las ventas tienden a aumentar y desea aprovechar dicha oportunidad invirtiendo en su negocio en mayor cantidad de mercadería. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa nueva como: blusas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Gladis is a 22-year old woman who lives with her family: her life partner and their 5-year old daughter, who has already started her first year in the local school. She sells new clothes in the municipal market. Sales normally increase during the Christmas season and she would like to make the most of the opportunity and invest in a bigger stock. She is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy new clothes, such as blouses, skirts, pants and underwear. She expects to have this financial support and to be able to provide her family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, such as blouses, skirts, pants and underwear.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta, age 38, is a married woman; she has been selling milk with her husband for many years. She has three buffaloes; she sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them. 

She is a mother of six children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and healthcare. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to increase milk production, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, oil, butter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. She has been selling milk for about five years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time her sales and income increased. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family and financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 23-year-old married woman who is running a business, selling milk with her husband. She has one cow and one buffalo, which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  

Kousar has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She has some past savings and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Kousar is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her net income through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a business, selling milk with her husband. She has four buffaloes in milk; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them on a daily basis. 

She needs to earn much more to meet her everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and health. Currently, she requests a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy one more buffalo. It will help her to inflate her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Firdos

texts.en:
Firdos is a 21-year-old married woman who has been running a business, selling milk with her husband. She has six buffaloes, which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Firdos has become famous for providing good-quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Firdos is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 23 years old, a married woman and the mother of three children. For 10 years, she has been running a business of selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased, and also her income. Now, she has three buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She enjoys doing machine embroidery. She started doing this work to support her family for a better future. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her area and she counts a good client list. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and earns insufficient income to support the family alone. 

Saira is requesting her fourth loan from Kashf Foundation for 35,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase frames, needles, and threads in different colors. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes, and education.

loans.use: to purchase frames, needles, and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Sayada

texts.en:
Sayada is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her family. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet their household expenses. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Sayada wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial vive en casa de unos familiares, en una habitación con acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Las Lomas  de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de costurero en un taller. Marcial necesita el crédito para la compra de una maquina de coser para  independizarse y de esta madera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
El sueño de Marcial es poder tener un taller costura propio.
texts.en:
Marcial lives in the house of some relatives, in a room with brick walls and a concrete floor, in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. He has a job working as a tailor in a workshop. 

Marcial needs the loan to buy a sewing machine so can he set up independently and so improve his income and quality of life. Marcial's dream is to have his own tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to set up independently and continue working as a tailor.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en casa propia en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Obejuyo de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de ayudante de costruccion.
Juana necesita el crédito para la compra de material de construccion; comprará estuco, cemento, ladrillo, otros para construir una habitación más en su casa y de esta madera tendra una mejor calidad de vida ella y sus hijos.
El sueño de Juana es poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her own brick house with a cement floor in the Obejuyo area of the city of La Paz.  She works as a construction assistant.

Juana needs this loan to buy construction materials; she will buy stucco, cement, bricks, and other items to build an additional room on her house.  In this way she will have a better quality of life, along with her children.

Juana’s dream is to be able to finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy stucco, cement, bricks, and sand to build an additional room on her house and to live more comfortably.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth vive en casa de sus padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Santa Rosa de la ciudad de El Alto. El oficio que desempeña es de costurera de polleras.
Elizabeth necesita el crédito para la compra de materia prima; comprará tela, hilos y otros insumos para elaborar más polleras y de esta madera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
El sueño de Elizabeth es poder tener un taller ya que actualmente solo trabaja en su misma habitacion.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in her parents’ cement-floored, brick home in the Santa Rosa area of the city of El Alto.  She has a job sewing polleras (traditional  embroidered skirts).

Elizabeth needs this loan to buy supplies; she will buy fabric, thread, and other items to decorate more polleras and, in this way, improve her income and quality of life.

Elizabeth’s dream is to be able to have a workshop, because right now she can only work in her own bedroom.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other items to increase her production of polleras (traditional embroidered skirts).

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 32-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a simple house in the city. Hani opened a small grocery store two years ago. He would like to improve his business since it is a very profitable one.
 
Hani took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell. By taking this loan, Hani will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Hani appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 31-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife in a simple house in the city. Sulaiman opened a small grocery store four years ago. He would like to improve his business since it is a very profitable one.
 
Sulaiman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell. By taking this loan, Sulaiman will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Sulaiman appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 24-year-old single man from Qalqila city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Bilal opened a small grocery store three years ago. He would like to improve his business since it is a very profitable one.
 
Bilal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell. By taking this loan, Bilal will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Bilal appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 46-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a simple house in the city. Amal opened a small grocery store three years ago. She would like to improve her business since it is a very profitable one.
 
Amal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for her grocery store to resell. By taking this loan, Amal will be able to increase her sales and also her  income.
 
Amal appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for her grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for her grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
 
Kawthar is a 43-year-old married woman from Tulkarm city. She lives with her husband and ten children, six sons and four daughters, in a simple house in the city. Kawthar opened a small grocery store seven years ago. She would like to improve her business since it is a very profitable one.
 
Kawthar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for her grocery store to resell. By taking this loan, Kawthar will be able to increase her sales and also her income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for her grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José de 45 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 14 años y su hijo de 10 años de edad. José se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería desde hace mucho tiempo. Estas ocupaciones son las que le permiten ganarse el pan de cada día y mantener la economía del hogar ya que su compañera de vida no cuenta con un oficio remunerado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la  reparación del baño y construcción de una pila para el resguardo del agua potable. Con el monto del crédito comprará arena, cemento, grava, ladrillo, etc.
texts.en: José, 45, lives in his own house with his partner and 14-year-old daughter and 10-year-old son.  He has made his living in agriculture and construction for a long time.  These occupations allow him to make his daily bread and support the household, since his partner doesn't have a paying job.  José is seeking this loan from FUSAI to renovate his bathroom and put in a sink to get drinkable water.  He'll use the loan to buy sand, cement, gravel, brick, etc.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, and brick to renovate the bathroom and put in a sink.

loans.name: Wilber Gabriel

texts.es: Wilber tiene 23 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia.  Él es un joven trabajador y responsable quien desde muy joven aprendió a cultivar la tierra y esta ocupación es la que ahora en día le permite ganarse el pan de cada día y apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del piso ya que actualmente es de tierra y desea ponerle ladrillo. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena y ladrillo de piso espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso pero sí tiene la capacidad de responder a las cuotas mensuales que el préstamo implica.
texts.en: Wilber is 23 and lives with his family in his own house.  He is a hardworking and responsible young man who learned very young to work the land.  That's how he earns his daily bread to meet the family's household expenses.  In order to improve living conditions he has decided to seek this loan from FUSAI.  He'll use the loan to fix up the floor because right now it's dirt and he wants to put in brick.  He'll buy cement, sand, and floor brick.  He hopes he'll get the loan because he doesn't have the capital to outlay, but he does have the ability to make the monthly payments the loan would require.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, floor brick because he currently has a dirt floor.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three children, two sons and one daughter, in a simple house in the city. Mohammad opened a small grocery store ten years ago. He would like to improve his business since it is a very profitable one.
 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and also his income.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like sugar, rice and wheat for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 30 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business selling animals. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another calf. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 30-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for many years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Farzana was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner.  

At present, she enjoys a great client list and makes enough to contribute to her family’s income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she is in her third loan cycle and requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She intends to use this loan amount to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads in various colors. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their small house in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  He is a hardworking, responsible and talkative man. His wife, Munhzaya, has just been laid off from work and now is running a public transportation service with her husband. His two children are under 5 and attend local kindergarten.

Nyamsuren has been driving a mini-bus for years and his vehicle has aged and now requires replacement in order to run his business. Since his mini-bus is the only source of family income, he needs 3,000,000 MNT to replace it with a better and newer one.

loans.use: to replace his old mini-bus with a better and newer mini-bus.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Meet Margaret, a farmer living in Eldoret with her family of  seven children, all of school-going age.

She has been an established farmer for 25 years. She produces and sells milk and eggs. She enjoys mixed farming but more so giving her livestock proper feeds.

Margaret chose Juhudi Kilimo through a referral from a neighbour when she saw how the loan from Juhudi Kilimo has helped change her living standards. She also liked the training that the loan officers give before disbursing loans.

Her biggest expense is school fees and through the output of the loan, she will be able to handle school fees comfortably. It will also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Don Oscar es un campesino muy trabajador. Él ha dedicado su vida a la producción de lácteos, sin embargo necesita comprar una vaca mas para poder seguir produciendo, por lo que solicita un crédito de quinientos mil colones (500.000. Con esto el pretende seguir realizando la labor que le ha dado el sustento a su familia.
texts.en: Oscar is a very hardworking country farmer.  He has always worked in dairy production, however he needs to buy another cow to be able to keep producing.  And so he is asking for a loan of 500,000 colones.  With this he plans to keep doing the work that has been the means of support for his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle

loans.name: Zobia

texts.en: Zobia is a 34-year-old married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 39-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchasing for many years. She buys calves and heifers at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase two more calves. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Gulsat

texts.ru: Гулсат 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей-2 сына и 2 дочери-близняшки, все школьного возраста. Супруг занимается частным строительством. У Гулсат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулсат занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок и земельный надел мерою 1,60 ГА на котором ежегодно выращивают фасоль, картошку, кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. От купленной коровы Гулсат собирается получить молоко, тем самым планируя получение дополнительного дохода от реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Гулсат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulsat is 43 years old, married, and raising four children with her husband. She has two sons and twin daughters, all of school age. Her husband works in construction. Gulsat has a secondary education. The primary source of income for the family is Gulsat's work in livestock and farming. She started this business nineteen years ago when she bought 7,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Gulsat's hard work, her farm now has a dairy cow, a calf, and a 1.60 hectare plot of land where she grows beans, potatoes, and corn. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Gulsat approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Gulsat will get milk from the cow she buys, so she is planning on getting additional income from selling milk. Gulsat plans to invest profits she makes from the loan into increasing her livestock and she plans to save enough money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 59 años de edad, es una persona que  estudio hasta noveno grado y es  casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias.

 María se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que le ha enseñado su esposo, durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas camina 3 K.m.
