Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a elaborar pupusas y su esposo a recoger frutas de temporada para ir a vender al mercado del municipio. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca lechera, para producir leche para la venta y así obtener un ingreso adicional

 María planea que con los ingresos que obtenga de la venta de leche y  de la siembra, poder comprar en un futuro un terreno, para pastar sus animales ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
María, 59 years old, studied until ninth grade. She is married, and her husband makes his living in agriculture. She gets up at 4:30 am with her husband to carry out the daily activities. 

María also makes her living in agriculture, a vocation that her husband taught her. In the morning they work in the plots; they walk 3 km to get there. During the afternoon, she makes pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and her husband picks seasonal fruits to sell in the town market.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a milk cow to produce milk to sell, and thereby make additional income. With the income that she gets from the sale of milk and of her crops, María hopes in the future to buy some land to graze her animals, since she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Josue

texts.es:
Josue, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de San Martín  de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel Secundario y trabaja de ayudante de Albañil en diferentes obras de la ciudad de El Alto y le pagan un jornal diario. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de herramientas(pico, pala, plomada, carretilla).
El sueño de Josue es poder comprar herramientas para asi poder trabajar y estudiar  asi  tener mejores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Josue is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the San Martín area of the city of El Alto. He only studied up to high school. He works as a mason's assistant on different jobs in the city of El Alto, and they pay him a daily wage. He is requesting this loan to buy tools such as a pick, shovel, plumb, and wheelbarrow. Josue's dream is to be able to buy tools so that he could work and study in order to have a better income and quality of life. This is the first time that he is applying for a loan with IMPRO and also with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tools for his job as a mason's assistant such as a pick, shovel, plumb, and so on.

loans.name: Maria Yosselin

texts.es: María de 35 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a sus hijos. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de  variedad de especies, dicho negocio es el que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Su vivienda es su principal patrimonio y futura herencia para sus hijos, por lo que desea mejorarla poco a poco. Con el fin de darle condiciones más seguras a su familia ha tomado la decisión de levantar un cerco perimetral en su terreno. Con el monto del crédito comprará arena, cemento, ladrillo, y malla metálica.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old and lives in a very simple house with her children. For a long time now she has earned her living selling a variety of animals, a business that brings in enough money to support her family on a daily basis. Her home is her main asset and her children’s inheritance so she wishes to renovate it gradually.

With the goal of providing her family with safer conditions, Maria has decided to construct a fence round her lot. She plans to use the loan money to buy sand, cement, bricks, and chain link fencing.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, bricks, and chain link fencing to build a fence around her property

loans.name: Otgonpurev

texts.en:
Otgonpurev is 43 years old and lives with his wife and twin sons in their small house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife, Anhtuya, is 38 and runs a small clothes retail on a rental counter of the local market. She started her business in 1999 and has gained a lot of experience and regular clients over the years. Otgonpurev's sons are 18 and graduating from local high school this fall.
 
Otgonpurev drives a mini-bus and provides public transportation services in the area. He has just started producing building blocks in their plot of land during summer. He is planning on expanding the production and growing the business. 

He is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventories for his wife's business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who is really concerned about his sons' further education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventories for his wife's business.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza was born in 1994. She is a smart and hardworking woman. Nargiza is married and has no children. Her husband works in IMON International. 

Nargiza is a sudent of Tajikistan State University of Politic and Business. Nargiza studies well. She must pay for tuition but her husband has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
Married for 22 years and the father of three, Amil, 48 years old, has a small store where he sells daily food products. His wife is a barber, while his eldest daughter studies in her third year of medical college; his other daughter is in the 10th grade and plays the piano well. Amil’s son is preparing for university. All are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native city of Fuzuli and now live in the Abseron region. 

Amil wants to increase his business and therefore has applied to Komak for a loan of 1600 AZN to buy a fridge. He is thankful to Kiva for aid, and in the future wants to increase the size of his store.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for his store.

loans.name: Nazokatkhon

texts.en:
Nazokatkhon is a woman of taste. She lives in the capital of Tajikistan. Nazokatkhon was born in 1976. She is married and has four children.

Nazokatkhon has her own business. She has been busy with sewing more than 10 years. Nazokatkhon sews national dresses and Europe-style dresses. She has her regular customers thanks to her good service. 

She wants to buy an embroidery machine but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy an embroidery machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 33-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. For about seven years, she is been in business, selling embroidered cloths. She makes beautiful embroidered patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, Tahira has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy bundles of cloth and reels of thread, along with packets of beads and sequins. In this way, she would be able to consistently cater to more customers. 

Tahira is hopeful of an increase in her income through her larger sales. She is in her third loan cycle, with good repayment history. She dreams for her children's bright future and well-being.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth and  reels of thread, along with packets of beads and sequins.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 29 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the village of Zeda Alisubani with her parents and takes care of them, as both of them have health problems. The family earns a living through small agricultural activities including breeding cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Sopio’s husband grows grapes and makes wine to sell. 

The income from agricultural activities is seasonal and in order to generate monthly funds Sopio and her spouse plan to buy a van and start a trading business. Specifically, Sopio’s husband will purchase fruits and vegetables from wholesalers and sell in neighboring villages. Sopio will assist him in this business. They will save on transportation costs and make deliveries easily. Sopio hopes the family initiative will be successful and this will increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase a van for product transportation

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is a 37-year-old divorced man from Rustavi city. He lives with his pensioned mother. 

Malkhaz works as a car artisan and generates approximately 700 GEL monthly. In his free time he wants to start other activity in order to increase his income and achieve financial stability. 

Malkhaz applied for credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $3,200 will help Malkhaz to purchase a second-hand car and serve clients as a taxi driver. The new business initiative will give him a chance to have financial stability and increase his monthly income. Malkhaz is thankful to Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To buy a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 5 years to 25 years. He describes himself as strong and a go-getter. 

He operates a car wash business where he washes cars. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are vehicle owners. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a car-washing machine. His business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his second  loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a car-washing machine.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is from  Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, happily married and has three children. She has a business of nipa weaving. 

A number of years ago, Daisy became a member of PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Daisy asked for financial assistance of PHP 50,000 to buy materials for house renovation. She hopes this will help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin, who is single and lives with his parents in the Abseron region, is a master mechanic who repairs truck motors, a profession he learned from his uncle. Yasin's mother is a housewife and his father a seller. Having fled the Khojaly genocide 21 years ago, the family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons). 

Yasin wants to increase his business and so has requested  a loan of 1400 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) from Komak to buy spare parts, equipment, etc. He is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for help. 

In the future Yazin wants to increase his business and hopes to get married.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and equipment

loans.name: Kifayet

texts.en:
Kifayet is 58 years old. Her mother has been sick for many years and Kifayet has taken care of her mother, so far. In addition, Kifayet didn’t leave her father alone, so she hasn’t married. They are an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Kelbejer city and they now live in the Abseron region. 

Kifayet rents a shop where she sells women's clothing, like pants, blouses, and dresses. She has been at this business for 18 years. 

Today, Kifayet is planning to increase her business. She needs AZN 2,300 (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy new seasonal clothes. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to Komak Credit Union. Kifayet is thankful for the aid from the Kiva organization and lenders. In the future, she wants to buy a store to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy new seasonal clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 29-year-old, married man. He has one child. He describes himself as being honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. 

Anthony's business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are traders and travelers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads which affect transportation of customers and goods. 

He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and also to buy a dairy cow, to start dairy farming to earn extra income from the sale of milk. 

Anthony's business goal is to have a self-sustaining business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be financially stable. 

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). His previous loan of KES 99,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and also to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 55 years of age.She offers viand (cooked foods) within her village. According to her, she loves to cook, and that’s why she decided to make it  her business.

With her determination to improve her business and provide good customer service, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy meat, spices and other ingredients for her business. She knows that the amount she requested has much to do with her business development and improvement of her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, helping her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Om-Adnan Group

texts.en:
The Om-Adnan group consists of three women from Aden, Yemen. All of them are making efforts to improve their businesses. Abtehal is the leader of the group. She is a married woman and has children. She lives with them in Aden, Yemen.

Abtehal sells many items in her business, like perfumes and ladies' clothes. She is focused on her business, because this is a great help in improving her economic conditions. She has been operating this business for many years. As time has passed and her customers' needs have grown, she has doubled her seriousness. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy perfumes, clothes, and electronic devices. This will enable her to expand her business, so that she will gain more profit. She hopes to be able to provide a good living for her family. She thanks Kiva lenders, for having financed the group's previous, first loan.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, clothes, and electronic devices, for her business expansion

loans.name: Shamima

texts.en:
Shamima is a 48-year-old lady. Her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.

Her husband owns a furniture shop in which he manufactures wooden accessories such as sofas and beds. Her husband has been making furniture for many years and teaching his arts to his son as well.
 
Now her son has become a fine carpenter and can easily run a separate business, so he opened a new shop. Now he wants to buy all his tools and  materials for making furniture. Therefore, Shamima requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy materials for making furniture. 

Shamima is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials for the newly opened furniture-making shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more undergarments and lotions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Magali

texts.en:
Magali is single mother to a special needs boy. At the age of two, he started the Early Intervention Program and, as a result, Magali was not able to juggle a job at the same time. Dedicated to her son, Magali needed a way to provide for them while staying at home. Three years ago, she applied for a Group Family Day Care license and started her own day care business. 

Though she started her business out of necessity, Magali’s passion for her business grew. “I am working with children, and I treat them as if they were my own. It’s not because the responsibility that the job entitles me, but because I want to give them the quality care that I want my own child to receive,” explained Magali. 

Determined to provide quality service to the children she cares for, Magali is seeking a loan to buy educational materials, such as a computer.  She hopes to finish her degree in Early Childhood Education and eventually open up a day care center. 

Help this dedicated mother provide quality education and care for her son and other children in her community!

loans.use: to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize to increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his inventory and ultimately better satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
For years, Aaron worked for his father’s pharmacy in the Dominican Republic. However, he dreamed of having something he could call his own. Nine years ago, he moved to New York in search of his American Dream. He earned income working as a taxi driver, but never strayed from his vision. Finally, he seized on the opportunity to make his dream come true and started Christ Beauty Supply. 

His business has become his passion. The business has slowly grown to two employees, one of whom is Aaron’s wife. He is proud of how much the business has continued to grow. However, Aaron still lacks the necessary inventory to meet his demand. Without it, he is worried that his customers may seek other suppliers. 

Help Aaron grow his business and fulfill his dream!

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
When Juan moved from Venezuela to the United States, he knew he wanted to start his own business.  After talking with friends and family in his new community, he noticed a need for installation and handyman services in South Florida. Capitalizing on the opportunity, Juan started his own business. 

Juan found success through word of mouth referrals. He quickly built a steady and large client base for his business. However, with a growing demand came the need for more capital. He needed to purchase electronics such as cameras, satellites and other security equipment to install for his clients. New to the U.S. financial system, Juan has had difficulty finding financing for his business.

Help Juan purchase the technology to satisfy the growing demand for his services!

loans.use: to purchase security equipment.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es: Emmanuel, tiene la edad 30 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa y una hija actualmente. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos novillos de engorde y algunas vacunas y medicinas para los mismos. El cuenta con algunos  en su poder y lo que pretende es engordarlos. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de ganado. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter. He is seeking a loan to buy some young bullocks, as well as some vaccines and medicines. Once he owns the animals, he will fatten them and when they have reached their ideal weight, he will sell them in the local market or in nearby places. 

Emmanuel wishes to earn money to provide for his own wellbeing and that of his family, and grow his livestock business. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has had no previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with easy payments and very low interest rates.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Dev

texts.en:
Dev first came to the U.S. from India seven years ago and after committing himself to his education, he graduated from NYU Stern Business School in 2010.

It was during his stint at business school that Dev thought of a great idea for a business: He envisioned a home based company that would offer remote full-service laptop and computer protection. This year, three years after first coming up with the idea, Dev established GProtect, a company made up of live technicians who access a customer’s desktop or laptop remotely to resolve their technical issues. In addition to providing technical support, Dev has also patented his own anti-virus software.

By contributing to this loan, you will help this tech savvy entrepreneur incorporate his business, develop web content, and set up a better payment system.

Dev wants to eventually hire more employees and provide the GProtect services to the world. Help him get there.

Visit Dev’ business website here:  http://www.gprotect.net/

loans.use: to incorporate his business, develop web content, and set up a better payment system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Guilherme

texts.en:
Do you remember what you loved as a kid? For Guilherme, it was trucks. As soon as he was old enough, Guilherme began a career driving trucks. After five years of working, he decided to take a chance and open up his own business in the hopes of earning more income for his hard work.

Guilherme’s business, American Quality Transport LLC, transports vehicles all over Florida. Although this fledgling business is new, Guilherme hope to see it expanding to additional employees. In order to do so, Guilherme needs to purchase a bigger trailer to transport more cars.

“My vision is to build a strong foundation for my transportation business so that can help our economy by hiring more people,” he says.

Help Guilherme fulfill his vision and create jobs in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger trailer.

loans.name: Valy

texts.en: Valy was born in 1956. He is married and has 4 children. He lives with his family in a rural area. Valy has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 21 years. He feeds cows. He began his business by growing agricultural products, then he changed his business. Valy has great experience in his field and with ease, manages with business. He is going to develop his business and get a good income because he currently lives poorly. He is asking for a loan of TJS 5000 to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cloth, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 41-year-old mother of two children who has worked as a tutor for seven years to help her husband in making their living and covering their precious children's needs.  Hiyam works from her house. She tutors children at home and provides them with the necessary reinforcement lessons.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary carpets and curtains for her house to keep her beloved family warm and healthy during the coming winter. She is very happy and comfortable with her small business since she runs it from her house and provides her family with the necessary care.

She hopes that, in the future, she can open a special tutoring center and increase her students to make sure she can provide her children with special university degrees and be capable of covering their expected expenses.

loans.use: to buy necessary carpets and curtains for her house to keep her beloved family warm and healthy during the coming winter

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar, 28 years old, is a mother who is willing to sacrifice everything just to give her child a better life. She is engaged in a motorcycle transportation business. She has been running this business for two years. 

At this time, Maricar wants to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy spare parts, oil and gasoline for maintenance of her motorcycle. Having this financial assistance from lenders will enable Maricar to improve her daily income, which will serve to provide for her family's daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Alimaa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and 5 children in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband, Tsogtbaatar, helps his wife to run their family business of organic vegetable growing and sales. Her older 2 children work at local companies and her younger 3 children attend local public schools and kindergarten, respectively.

Mrs. Alimaa started her organic vegetable growing and sales business in 2007. She has been running her business successfully for years and has increased the production and quality over the years. She is building a storage pit and needs an extra investment of 3,100,000 MNT to purchase the necessary materials to finish building. The storage pit will enable them to store their vegetables fresh for selling to local customers. She is a hardworking and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials to finish building the storage pit in which to store their vegetables to keep them fresh and sell to local customers.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 25 years old. He is a farmer who works and lives with his family in Khan Yunis, a city in the southern Gaza Strip. According to the Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics, Khan Yunis had a population of 142,637 in 2007, 202,000 in 2010 and 350,000 in 2012.

Adam asked Ryada for this loan in order to paint his house and repair the ceiling to prevent rainwater flowing in.  That will give warmth for his family at home and reflect better living conditions. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to prevent rainwater flowing in

loans.name: Purevnyam

texts.en:
Mr.Purevnyam is a 33-year-old, married man who lives with his wife and a son in their ger, a traditional yurt house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife, Chuluuntsetseg, works at a local cafeteria. His son attends local kindergarten.

Purevnyam has been running a taxi service business for three years and has built closer relationships with his clients. He is a careful and reliable driver, with a good reputation among his clients. During the summer, he also grows organic vegetables and fruits on their plot of land. 

Purevnyam is now requesting loan of MNT 2,600,000 to purchase spare parts and to repair his car, to continue his business without problems. He is a hard-working and reliable man, with good previous loan records at XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to repair his car, to continue his business without problems.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 41, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Eric, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Vilma is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Vilma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help Vilma continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Vilma dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He has been in the farming business for more than three years.

Henry is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the labor costs. Through this, Henry will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his yield and income.

In the future, Henry dreams of making his farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Novavilla

texts.en:
Novavilla is a married woman from Bohol, Philippines. Novavilla is a farmer. She has been in the farming business with her husband, for more than four years. This is the source of their income.

Novavilla is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticide for their farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm

loans.name: Maileen Rose

texts.en:
Maileen Rose previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maileen Rose dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a family of her own. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is married with two children. He grows bananas and other crops on his farm to make a living. He has been doing this for ten years and he earns well to provide for his family. 

He joined GDMPC and has requested a new loan to buy seedlings and organic fertilizer in order to improve his farm. He is determined to improve his farm in order to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has five children . He describes himself as being diligent. He operates a transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle. He also owns a retail shop where he sells household goods. 

Anthony has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenges to be poor roads, which affect transportation of customers and goods, and changes in the prices of products he sells in his shop.

Anthony will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and a stock of products for resale in his retail shop. His business goal is to purchase a piece of land and develop it within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be financially stable. 

This is Anthony's sixth loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). His previous loan of KES 95,000 was successfully repaid. He also grows crops for sale to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and a stock of products for resale in his retail shop.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis owned a few different businesses in his native country of Honduras. However, when he moved to Florida over 20 years ago, he had to start from scratch, taking odd jobs to provide for his wife and daughter. Recently, he noticed many changes occurring in his neighborhood of Little Havana and decided to take the opportunity to open up his own store.   

Luis’s store, El Expolosivo Mini Market, sells groceries, lottery tickets and does money transfers to Latin America. He employs one individual during the week and his wife helps him out on the weekends. The business allows Luis to pay for his daughter’s college education at a prestigious university. 

Luis’s keen observation is what keeps his business competitive. When he first opened the business, he was quickly able to gauge which products sold the fastest. Lately, he’s noticed that his stocks of Central American bread are always sold out before he can replace them. With this loan, he will purchase equipment to make his own bread in order to quickly meet his customers' demand. 

Help Luis expand his business and pay for his daughter’s college education!

loans.use: to purchase bread-making equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels

loans.name: Rossana Maribel

texts.es:
Rossana vive en la ciudad e chincha, trabaja como digitadora en una institución de su ciudad, y con los ingresos de su trabajo pude sacar adelante a su familia, especialmente porque es madre de 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años a los que quiere muchísimo y por los cuales lucha cada día.

Rossana esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá solventar los gastos para tramitar los documentos para poder renovar su contrato con la institución donde trabaja, asi ella podrá seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Rossana lives in the city of Chincha, where she works as a data entry clerk for a company in the city. With the income she earns, she is able to support her family. She has two children, ages 6 and 2, whom she loves very much, and for whom she works very hard every day.

Rossana is grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to pay for the processing of the documents she needs to renew her contract with the company where she works. Then she will be able to continue working to make her greatest dream a reality, which is to enable her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for the processing of the documents she needs to renew her contract with the company where she works.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle.

loans.name: Makotor

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Makotor. She is married and has children ages 18, 15, 11 and 6 years. In 2000, Makotor established her commercial ladies dress, shoes, and bodies business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband with domestic problems.

Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are ladies. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Makotor requires a loan in order to buy ladies shoes and bodies’ skirts. She hopes that this loan will help increase her profit by approximately 500,000 SLL.

In the future, Makotor plans to open an outlet and deploy her younger brother there. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ladies shoes and skirts.

loans.name: Hawa B.

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Hawa B.  She is married. She has 4 children aged 18, 15, 10 and 6 years respectively, and all are school going children.

In 2008, Hawa B. established her drinks and pure water business. She began her business because she used to do a local produce business where she travelled from one place to another. Her husband thought it was a risky and exhausting business, so he set up a soft drinks and pure water business for her.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 542,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Hawa B. requires a loan in order to purchase crates of soft drinks. In the future, Hawa B. plans to expand her business and give her children good educations. The rainy season causes low sales.  She is hardworking and competitive.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand bags and belts

loans.name: Sandra Hilvea

texts.es:
Sandra de 37 años de edad, es una persona que estudio educación media, es madre soltera su esposo, la abandono y la dejo con sus 3 hijos.  Sandra se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a sus hijos que estudian en la tarde y en el transcurso de la mañana  le ayudan  en la agricultura.

 Sandra se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que le  enseño su esposo durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas camina 2 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a a trabajar cuidando una vivienda por lo que le pagan.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir una habitación en su vivienda, ya que es muy pequeña y ya no tienen espacio. 

Sandra planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo,  de la siembra y del préstamo para mejoramiento de su vivienda; en un futuro desea que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra is 37 years old and has studied at high school. She became a single mother after her husband abandoned her and left her with three children. Sandra gets up at 4:30am and spends time with her children who study in the afternoon, while in the mornings they help her with farming.

Sandra works in farming, having been taught by her husband. In the mornings they work in their plots, walking 2km to get there. In the afternoons they work as caretakers for a home, which they are paid for.

Sandra is requesting a loan to build another room in her home, since it is very small and they have no space.  Sandra plans to sow her fields with the earnings from her job, while the loan will be used to make home improvements. In the future she would like her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to build a room in her home

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer. She lives in Eldoret, a place with land that is extremely rich and fertile for agriculture. She is married and has six children. She has been farming for 14 years, and her main source of income is the sale of milk, eggs, and a few crops, like vegetables. In farming, she enjoys selling eggs from her poultry. However, she experiences a challenge of disease control.

Esther chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During the training offered to the farmers by the loan officers, she learned how to keep proper records. She also learned how to develop a culture of saving. With the income from the loan, she will be able to pay her children's school fees and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry birds.

loans.name: Elimkhan

texts.en:
Elimkhan is a 45-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, three children, and pensioner mother. Elimkhan is a painter; he gets orders and paints walls and houses. The income of his family depends on those orders, but it is not stable. 

Elimkhan decided to start his own business and is requesting a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $1200 for his business. He will purchase hens and resell at a higher price to generate income. This will increase the income of the family and with the increased income Elimkhan will be able to improve living conditions for his children. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase and resell hens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes, etc. el negocio es venta por catalogo y lo hace de forma ambulante visita las diferentes casas de donde ella reside ya tiene clientela fija que la prefieren por la calidad de los productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo quien es empleado de una fabrica y su hijo, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The client sells all types of personal use products like lotions, deodorants, creams, and perfume, etc.  Her business is selling by catalog.  She does this in an itinerant manner by visiting the different houses where she lives.  She already has a fixed clientele that prefer her for the quality of the products that she sells and for the good prices.  

With the profits that she gets from her sales, and with her husband’s help, they manage to pay for the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband, who is a factory employee, and her son.  The client wishes to increase her business.

She is, therefore, requesting a loan that will allow her to be able to buy everything she needs for her business.  This is her only source of work.  With the requested help, she will be able to get better income and have better financial stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, creams, and perfume, etc.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley  es soltera no tiene hijos, viven en casa de su abuela con sus hermanas y sobrinas (pero no cancela alquiler, aporta para la cancelacion de servicios basicos), la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta la carrera de contabilidad; no pudo ejercer su profecion devido al estado de salud de su abuela y se dedico al comerio de edredones y ropa para dama. Ella comercializa sus productos en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de material de construccion(arena, cemento, ladrillo) ya que construirá una habitacion, asi tendra mayor espacio.
El sueño de Shirley es tener su consultora contable.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Shirley is single and has no children. She lives at her grandmother's home with her sisters and nieces (she doesn't pay rent, but she does help with utilities). The house is located in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto. She studied for a degree in accounting; she was unable to pursue her profession due to the state of her grandmother's health, and she worked by selling comforters and women's clothing. She sells her products at various fairs in the city of El Alto. She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials, such as sand, cement, and bricks, since she is going to build a room; in this way, she will have more space. Shirley's dream is open her accounting consulting firm. This is the first time that she is applying for a loan together with IMPRO and also with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and bricks to build a room.

loans.name: Effort De Catier Morin Group

texts.fr:
Medeid  est le coordinateur de son groupe Effort de Catier Morin. Il  est  marié, Il  a 2  enfants. Il  habite dans la région nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee.  
   
 Medeid pratiquait l'artisanat d'où il achete et revend boeuf et de cabrit. Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Il était  un écolier. Il  plan à acheter de l'artisanat et de la viande pour la revente.
 
Des autres membres de EFFORT DE CATIER MORIN  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes produits de  cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc.  Il déclare que son défi principal est de devenir un  grand commerçant  dans le département du nord. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a construire une  grande epicerie  avec l’aide  d'Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Medeid is the group coordinator for 'Effort de Catier Morin'.  He is married and has two children.  Medeid lives in the north of Haïti where electricity is rare and drinking water is very scarce.

Medeid is a craftsman and buys and sells beef and goatskins.  He started his business directly after finishing school.  He will use his loan to buy meat for resale.

The other members of the group will use their loans to support their businesses, such as selling cosmetic products, fizzy drinks, etc.

Medeid says that his aim is to become a big trader in the north of Haïti.  He would like to run a large business and build a grocery shop with the help of the field partner, Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy beef and goatskins for resale.

loans.name: Hokimjon

texts.en: Hokimjon is 21 years old. He is a hardworking man from a village. Hokimjon is a student of the four-year course of Technologies University of Tajikistan. Hokimjon has a business, in animal husbandry. He feeds two cows. Hokimjon’s parents work in Russia. He must pay his tuition, but his parents have no opportunity to help him. Hokimjon is asking for a loan of 950 US Dollars, which he will use to pay tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay his tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of cassava to sell.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol, in the Philippines. She has been farming rice and vegetables for more than five years now, together with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Gorgonia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of their farm, thus augmenting their yield and income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Pepito

texts.en:
Pepito is aged 55, married and they are living in one house together with his parents.

He has grown corn and rice for some years and he also raises cattle. He buys his materials in their town and sells his products in the same place. He asked for a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm. The loan has helped him increase his income to help his family.

He dreams to have a farm near irrigation for the easy supplementation of water.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman and she has 7 children. She describes herself to be God fearing.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough water for domestic use.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy a 3,000 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a 3,000 liter tank

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela's wish in life is to be in good health and to always be safe. She is 53 years old, married and has three grown children. Her husband has a furniture-making business. Adela manages her sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been running this kind of business for three years. Adela doesn't want to get bored, so she is always finding ways to assure herself. Now she would like to sell more grocery items so she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy toothpaste, soap, shampoo, conditioner and canned goods. She believes that her sari-sari (variety) store will continue to run smoothly.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soap, shampoo, conditioner and canned goods for her retail store.

location.town: San Jose Norte II, Mallig, Isabela

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for several years now with her husband. 

Vilma is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs for her farm. She will use her loan to improve her farm and augment her harvest and income. In the future, Vilma hopes to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma previously obtained a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Now, she would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 22,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy raw materials, like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her tailoring business. Her profits from business will definitely help to meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lerma hopes that her business will last longer, and dreams of being financially stable. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario  tiene la edad de 28 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mario is 28 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and give care to the coffee plantation he wants to start. He wants to give proper maintenance to the crops to allow them to have greater production and thereby generate more income.

He hopes in the future to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability as well as growing as a person and producer. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from the state banks and FUDECOSUR is offering the loan on better conditions and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Yareli

texts.es:
Yarely es una clienta kubo y esta es su historia.
Yareli tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive con su mama. Ella esta terminando la carrera de Administración de Empresas y desde hace 4 años combina sus estudios con su negocio de venta de ropa. Tiene un pequeño local donde vende ropa para niñas, bebes y de temporada. Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar ropa para la temporada de invierno como chamarras, suéteres y abrigos. Sus mayores logros han sido tener su propio negocio y estar por terminar su carrera.  En el futuro le gustaría abrir un restaurante y comprarse un departamento.
texts.en:
Yareli is a Kubo-client and this is her story.

Yareli is 24 years old, single and lives with her mother. She is close to finishing her studies in Business Administration and has been both studying and running her clothing business for four years.

She has a small store where she sells clothes for girls, babies and seasonal clothes. She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothes, such as jackets, sweaters and coats. Her biggest achievements have been to have her own business and to be where she is in her studies. In the future, she would like to open a restaurant and buy her own apartment.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell, such as jackets, sweaters and coats.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other products needed in her tailoring business. Her earnings were a big help for her family’s personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Beatriz is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. She will use her business profits to sustain her daily needs. Beatriz looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She dreams that her business will continue to exist and hopes that her grandchildren will finish their studies. Beatriz meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials

loans.name: Mariama B.

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mariama. She is married to a petty trader and has two children, ages 20 and 23. Mariama supports three additional dependents living with her and takes care of them while they attend school in the city. She works producing different types of gara cloth such as clothing, bedding, and curtains. Mariama works six days a week, 10 hours a day and earns about 1,100,000 SLL each month.

Mariama is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy bales of brilliant material to produce different types of gara cloth, including clothing, bedding, and curtains. She has not yet opened a shop as she had planned but her children are now in college. Mariama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of materials to produce different types of gara cloth.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 42 year old Adama. She is married with children ages 3, 10, 15, 17 and 21. Three of her children attend school. In 1998, Adama established a business selling groundnuts and clothing. She began her business because her father was against sending a girl child to school. Adama had wanted to have a good education but, without the support of her parents, she decided to engage in her mother's business. She works seven days a week and 10 hours each day to earn about 890,000 SLL every month.

Adama is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase bags of groundnuts and ladies' wear. In the future, she plans to expand her business and help her husband to educate her children. Adama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of groundnuts and ladies' wear

loans.name: Om-Mahmoud Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Mahmoud and consists of 3 female members who live in Aden, Yemen. This community is hardworking and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. 

Smara is the leader of the group. She is a 27 year old, married woman. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her family with a better future. She went through a lot of effort and had to save money with the help of her family to set up her small house. Now she has applied for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete her house. She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete her house.

loans.name: Olga Mery

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos por quienes lucha incansablemente para sacarlos adelante.
Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia como comerciante independiente, pues inició su propio negocio como alternativa para generar ingresos que le permitieran apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar; en el almacén de variedades ofrece utensilios de cocina, lociones, utensilios de aseo, entre otros, trabaja sola todos los días de la semana y así logra obtener los recursos para su familia.
El crédito lo solicita como apoyo para fortalecer sus inventarios, con el dinero comprará mercancía al por mayor (productos de aseo, utensilios de cocina, artículos para el hogar), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad para satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores y así mejorar el nivel de ventas y ganancias.
De esta forma, Olga desea seguir luchando para acreditar y fortalecer su negocio y en un futuro a mediano plazo sueña con ampliarlo para tener mayor variedad de inventario y garantizar una rentabilidad favorable que le permita brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga is a friendly and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and two children, and she works tirelessly to get them ahead.

She has more than 10 years experience as an independent businesswoman. She started her own business as an alternative to generate income that would allow her to share the household financial burden with her husband. In the variety store, she offers kitchen utensils, lotions and cleaning tools, among other things. She works alone every day of the week and thus manages to earn money for her family.

She is applying for the loan as backing to strengthen her inventory. With the money, she will buy wholesale merchandise (cleaning products, kitchen utensils, items for the home). This will allow her to offer a greater variety to satisfy the needs of her buyers and thus improve her level of sales and earnings.

In this way, Olga hopes to continue striving to validate and strengthen her business. In the medium term, she dreams of expanding it to have a greater variety of inventory and to guarantee a profitability that will allow her to provide her children with a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (cleaning products, kitchen utensils, items for the home).

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe, a married woman of five, is an agriculturalist who does both animal rearing and crop farming. The farming helps to put food on the table for her and her family without spending and the cows produce milk. She sells the surplus to get income to pay for her children's tuition and buy their other basic needs. She will use the loan to buy young cows that she will graze and later sell when they have appreciated in value. Phoebe is hard working and thanks Kiva lenders for the opportunity to obtain a loan. In the photograph is Phoebe with the Ugafode credit officer (left-right) at her farm.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Yeabu S.

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Yeabu S.  She is single and has a 4-year-old child and a child who attends school. In 2006, Yeabu S. established her clothing business. She began her business when she was in college.  By doing this trade, she was able to pay for her fees and other school charges.  

After graduating, she continued with her trade since she could not find a job. This business is now her job and will help her generate income. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 660,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Yeabu S. requires a loan in order to purchase clothing. 

In the future, Yeabu S. plans to expand her business. Competition is high, but she is hardworking and determined. The loan will make a big change in her business.  She is looking forward to subsequent loans from ARD and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of eggs thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels to sell greater quantities of ‘sabo’ (a traditional dish of maize and groundnuts).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bead anklets and bracelets.

loans.name: Alladin

texts.en:
Alladin is a retailer of local food supplements in Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in business for more than two years now. Alladin works hard to support the needs of his family, especially for the food. 

Alladin is asking for a loan to buy more food supplements to sell to his customers. With this loan, he will be able to sell more and augment his income. 

In the future, Alladin hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more food supplements to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia tiene 42 años, casada con 4 hijos que tienen la edad de 18, 15, 12 y 10 años y, ella trabaja como vendedora de jugos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la  localidad de Sacaba, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, la señora Patricia va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que La señora Patricia tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Patricia is 42 years old and married. She has four children aged 18, 15, 12 and 10 years. She works as a juice vendor at her sales booth which is located in the village of Sacaba. This is her first loan with the institution. Patricia will use this loan to finish setting up water facilities in her home, since she currently only has a well and it's a lot of work to carry the water from there. That's why she'll set up water hookups for the toilet, shower and kitchen, and thus she'll provide more comfort for her family. For several reasons, her area doesn't have basic utilities, but this shall not prevent Patricia from having clean water in her house. She feels very happy because of the opportunity she has been given to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to set up water facilities in her home.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 24-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child, who is attending school. She is an ambitious woman who strives to work very hard just to provide her family with a sufficient income. Her work consists of selling traditional Lebanese clothing called “Aabaya”. She works from her home and from time to time she visits customers on her own to offer them her good-looking outfits. 

Today, Fatmeh seeks to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more clothing items as she plans to increase her business sales and therefore her revenues. Fatmeh intends to improve the family’s way of living. She desires to have another baby but she must be capable financially before getting into this.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric and footwear.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer living in Eldoret, a fertile land for agriculture. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are of school-going age. Lucy has been farming for 22 years, producing and selling milk, eggs and maize. In farming, Lucy enjoys dairy farming and the part she loves most is milking the cows, but the challenge she faces is lack of enough animal feed during dry seasons.

Lucy said that she chose Juhyudi Kilimo for this loan because she needed an MFI that would enable her to improve her dairy farming. During the training, she learned how to develop a strict savings culture. Her greatest expense goes to school fees and this loan will boost her income because her dairy cows will produce more and thus increase her income base and allow her to pay her children's school fees. She will increase the food supply on her farm.

loans.use: get a dairy unit extension.

loans.name: Ufalme Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bagaza est une commerçante depuis 4 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires « Ufalme», âgée de 35 ans et mère des 6 enfants dont, 4 étudient et 2 sont encore gamins. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle étale ses marchandises à  son domicile sur la rue dans une avenue animée du Quartier. Elle sollicite un crédit  auprès de Hekima, pour accroitre son entreprise. Son conjoint est un enseignant. Elle va acheter 20 litres huiles, 1 sacs de farine formant, les allumettes, 1 carton de savons, un sac de sucre, des bonbons, biscuits, sel iodé, etc. Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique. Dans  photo du groupe, une cliente porte ses bébés.
texts.en:
Bagaza has been a trader for four years, and is a member of the business group 'Ufalme'.  She is thirty-five years old, and mother to six children.  Four of her children attend school, and the other two are too young.  Her husband is a teacher.  

Bagaza sells various products from a stall at her home, on a busy avenue.  She began her business with funds received from her husband.

She has requested a loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to improve her business.  She will buy twenty litres of oil, one sack of wheat flour, matches, one box of soaps, a sack of sugar, sweets, biscuits and iodized salt.

In the future, Bagaza would like to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She would also like to feed and educate her children.  

Bagaza thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

In the photo, one of the clients is holding her child.

loans.use: to buy 20 litres of oil, 1 sack of wheat flour, matches, 1 box of soaps, 1 sack of sugar, sweets, biscuits and iodized salt.

loans.name: Savet's Group

texts.en:
Savet is a villager from Sangke district in Battambang province. She is 46 years old and married with seven children, six of them are under her responsibility. To make a living, Savet and her husband have been rice farming. She has also worked as a paid worker for 11 years. These current businesses return her around 23,200 KHR per day. 

Savet is a past client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three times and she successfully paid back the loans which have helped her family’s condition improve. This is the fourth cycle for her. Savet leads the group of two. They are seeking a loan for 2,400,000 KHR to pay for reaping fees. She hopes to earn more income to make her standard of living better.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fees
